This is the first loan she has taken out in the community bank she was invited to join by her neighbor. She will invest the loan in buying a woodlot for her husband's business.
 
Her goal is to grow her animal selling business.

loans.use: to buy a woodlot.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy candies and materials to make sweets.

loans.name: Ivonne Jazmin

texts.es:
Ivonne tiene 40 años y dos hijos a los cuales no tenía quien los pueda cuidar, pero también necesitaba colaborar con los ingresos en su hogar, es por ello que decidío salir a recorrer su sector y se dió cuenta que no tendría mucha competencia en lo se relaciona a una tienda y  que luedo la complementó con línea bazar.

Ella vende de todo un poco, colas, azucar, arroz, aceite, huevos, cuadernos, lapices etc. Como todo sector suburbano ella señala la inseguridad como un peligro latente, pero del que tenemos que aprender a cuidarnos.

Su esposo trabaja en taxismo, lleva a los niños a las escuela muy temprano, pero cuando regresan de clases le ayudan un poco, Ivonne desea el préstamo para terminar de construir su casa como cemento, arena y dividir en algunos departamentos para alquilar y tener otra fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Ivonne is 40 years old and has two children. She didn't have anyone to take care of them but she also needed to contribute to the household expenses. That is why she decided to go through her neighborhood and she realized that she wouldn't have a lot of competition with a small grocery store and later she added variety store items. 

She sells a little bit of everything: soda, sugar, oil, eggs, notebooks, pencils, etc. As in every marginal neighborhood she states that crime is a latent danger, and something we all have to be careful of.  

Her husband works as a taxi driver. He takes the children to school very early but when they come home from school they help her out a little. Ivonne wants the loan to finish building her house and buy materials such as cement and sand. She also wants to divide it into apartments to rent out and have another source of income.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and blocks.

loans.name: Silvia Margarita

texts.es:
La Señorita Silvia es socia del banco comunal Unión y Prosperidad, vive por la parroquia de Zhidmad, lugar que cuenta con hermosos paisajes, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes trabajos.

La Señorita Silvia tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres quienes se dedican a la agricultura, la casa en la que habita es de propiedad de sus padres.
 
Nuestra socia labora como empleada domestica y trabaja de lunes a sábados medio día. 

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para construir su casa.
 
Su meta es culminar sus estudios del colegio.
texts.en:
Señorita Silvia is a member of the "Union and Prosperity" communal bank.  She lives in Zhidmad Parish, a place that has beautiful scenery.  Its people work in animal husbandry and agriculture, with many working in the city in various jobs.

Señorita Silvia is 22 years old and single.  She lives with her parents who work in agriculture.  The house where she lives is owned by her parents.

Our member works as a maid, working from Mondays through noon on Saturdays.

This is her first loan through the community bank, and she will invest it in the purchase of construction materials for construction on her house.

Her goal is to complete her college studies.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Feliza Janeth

texts.es:
Feliza  es una madre de 29 años empezó su negocio con un pequeño capital una tienda de abarrotes con nombre "4 Hermanos", trabajo que realiza sola desde la 7H00 am hasta las 19H00 am. En su pequeña tienda ella tiene productos como verduras, arroz, azucar; lo que no se le diciculta al momento de abastecer el negocio ya que son productos fáciles de conseguir y de movilizar, su incoveniente es realmente la movilización ya que su zona es de dificil acceso.Junto a su esposo que labora de guardia de seguridad ella ha procreado  hijos, los cuales tienen 8 6 y 2 años y estudian recién primaria.

Ya que sus niños estan empezando sus estudios ella sabe que le espera un largo camino para educarlos y desea un préstamo para surtir su tienda con arroz, azucar, verduras. Tambien tener mas ingresos y ahorrar y además hacer su casa de cemento y así vivir en mejores condiciones con su familia.
texts.en:
Feliza is a 29 year old mother, who began her business with a small amount of capital.  She has a grocery store named "4 Hermanos"  ("4 Brothers"), where she works from 7 am to 7 pm.  In her small shop she stocks products such as vegetables, rice, sugar.  It's not difficult at the moment to supply her business, as these products are readily available and easy to obtain.  Her drawback is really distribution as her area is difficult to access.

She has children with her husband, who works as a security guard.  The children are 8, 6 and 2 years old, and they are recently attending primary school.

Since her children are beginning their education, she knows it's going to be a long path to educate them, and she wants a loan to stock her store with rice, sugar, and vegetables.  She will also earn more income and save money, and also make her house from cement and so live in better living conditions with her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar and vegetables.

loans.name: Maudelina Mercedes

texts.es: Maudelina  de 33 años vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 y 11 años. Meudelina inició vendiendo bolis y cubetas de hielo, además de dulces y con este primer ensayo su negocio creció y en la actualidad agregó refrescos, bebidas frías y planea adicionar licores los cuales le dejan un margen de contribución superior.  Su meta es convertirse en una distribuidora de estos productos para venderle a otros negocios ubicados en su comunidad objeto, pero su gran desafío es su insuficiente capital de trabajo, y esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará cervezas y gaseosas por cajas, así como también agregará licores en mayor volumen. Con su nuevo financiamiento maudelina planea tener éxito en la medida en que tendrá surtido su negocio y la mercancia rotará rapidamente lo cual implica el aumento rápido de su capital de trabajo. Su sueño mas anehelado es que sus hijos logren ser exitosos por eso ella y su cónyuge trabajan esforzandose diariamente para lograr abornar su camino.
texts.en:
Maudelina, age 33, lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and their two children, ages 3 and 11.  Maudelina started out selling ”bolis” (frozen juice snacks) and trays of ice cubes.  She also sold sweets, and in this first attempt her business grew.  She has currently added soft drinks, cold drinks, and she plans on adding liquor; which leaves a better contribution margin.

Her goal is to become a distributor of these products in order to sell to other businesses in her community.  However, her greatest challenge is insufficient working capital.  That is the reason she requests a Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy beer and soft drinks by the case.  She will also buy liquor in greater volume.

With her new loan Maudelina plans to be successful because she will have a well-stocked business.  The merchandise will turn over rapidly, which means a rapid increase in her working capital.

The dream she longs for the most is for her children to be successful.  That is why she and her husband put forth effort while working every day to clear their way.

loans.use: to buy beer and soft drinks by the case, and to also buy liquor in greater volume.

loans.name: Las Artesanas Del Fresno Group

texts.es:
Doña Angelina vieve en una comunidad que se distingue por ser casi un bosque, hay muchos pinos y tambien se encuentra el centro ceremonial Mazahua, se dice que no hace mucho tiempo habia venados pero hace unos años se terminaron, doña Angelina tiene un grupo que se llama las artesanas del fresno, se llaman así porque las 8 integrantes son artesanas y sabes bordar y coser por esa razón se llaman así, doña Angelina se dedica a comprar tela por metro para hacer colchas, cobijas y chalecos, ya tiene 15 años de experiencia y sabe bordar muy bien, nos dice que hay varias cosas que le dificultan las ventas, por ejmplo nos dice que en tiempos de calor sus bordados no se venden, porque como son de lana es dificil que una persona quiera comprar un chaleco, tambien nos dice que las ventas son un  albhur, para poder salir a vender nesecita llevarse todo lo que hizo para enseñarles al cliente su trabajo, pero como puedes vender cosas como te puedes regresar con ellas, por eso nos comenta que es un albhur, otra cosa que se le hace dificil es andar cargando las cosas, y es mucho peso el que se junta y si se hace muy complicado cargar toda sus cosas, a doña Angelina le gustaria ya tener suguras sus ventas nadamas dedicarse a entregar pedidos, porque sus hijos estan estudiando y quiere que salgan adelante, el credito le ha servido de mucho para poder hacer sus bordados y manda un mensaje de agradecimiento por los creditos para su negocio, la señora tiene 4 hijos, lleva 8 años de casada, y 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia y su esposo trabaja y tambien nos dice que sabe bordar y habeces le ayuda, las demas integrantes del grupo se llaman
1.-Maria de los Angeles,
2.-Leonila,
3.-Lucia,
4.-Gregoria
5.-Rufina
6.-Rosio
7.-Juana Iris
todas las integrantes son artesanas y se dedican a lo mismo hacer bordados de manteles y costuras de todo tipo.
texts.en:
Doña Angelina lives in a community that is distinctive for being almost a forest; there are many pine trees and it's also the location of the Mazahua ceremonial center.  It is said that not long ago there were deer here, but as of a few years ago they were gone.  

Doña Angelina has a group that calls themselves "Las Artesanas del Fresno" (The Artisans of Fresno).  They are so named because the 8 members are artisans who know how to do embroidery and sewing, and they are from El Fresno.  It is for this reason that they are named this way.

Doña Angelina works buying fabric by the meter for making bedspreads, blankets and waistcoats.  She has 15 years of experience and knows how to embroider very well.  She tells us that there are several things that hinder sales.  For example, she tells us that in hot weather her embroidery does not sell; as her waistcoats are made from wool it is difficult for a person to want to buy one.  She also says that making sales is a gamble.  To be able to go out to make sales, she needs to bring everything she has made ​​so as to educate her customer about her work, but while she may sell some items, she needs to return with the rest, which is why she tells us it's a gamble.  Another thing that makes it hard is carrying the items, as they are very heavy together which makes it very difficult to carry all her items.  Doña Angelina would like to have reliable sales and only offer items to meet orders, because her children are attending school and she wants them to progress in life.

The loan has done a great deal for her embroidery business, and she sends a message of thanks for the loans for her business.  The señora has 4 children; she has been married for 8 years and is 37 years old.  She lives in her own house and her husband works.  She also tells us that he knows how to embroider, and provides her with help.

The other members of the group are named:
1.-Maria de los Angeles
2.-Leonila 
3.-Lucia 
4.-Gregoria 
5.-Rufina 
6.-Rosio 
7.-Juana Iris 

All the members are artisans and work in the same field, embroidering tablecloths and sewing of all different kinds.

loans.use: to buy fabric for embroidery.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama San Antonio, se localiza en el estado de Morelos, México, es un pueblo bonito de clima calido, está integrado por el señor José Socorro va a comprar alimento para criar mojarras, la señora María Fidela va a comprar puercos, borregos, toros, las señoras Felipa y María de la Luz va a comprar jabón, azúcar, leche, huevos, la señora Patricia va a comprar alimento para engordar borregos, la señora María Mercedes va a comprar puercos para engorar, la señora Virginia va a comprar verduras, carne para elaborar sus taquitos. La señora Virginia tiene 51 años de edad, ella estudio hasta el 2º. Año de primaria, ella es casada tiene siete hijos, cinco ya mayores de edad ya trabajan y dos hijos menores un varón de 15 años de edad estudia la secundaria, una niña de 9 años de edad estudia la primaria, ella vende taquitos de bistec, longaniza y tripa, ella solicito su crédito para comprar 1 quemador, refrescos, verduras, carne para elaborar los taquitos y una parte para poner el piso donde vende los taquitos, ella inicio su negocio hace 25 años por falta de recursos económicos ya que su esposo no tenía trabajo y sus hijos estaban pequeños así que consiguió prestado con su cuñado para poner su negocio y comenzó a vender sus taquitos, su negocio es importante porque le deja ganancias cuando vende bien, ella recuerda cuando su nieta se enfermo consiguió $500.00 pesos para llevarla al doctor y comprar  las medicinas y con las ganancias de su negocio pudo pagar, ella se siente orgullosa por la preferencia de sus clientes que son las familias y cuando le dicen que sus taquitos están sabrosos, las ganancias las reinvierte comprando los insumos para seguir vendiendo, su hija y su esposo le ayudan en su negocio a preparar y a despachar los taquitos. Sus sueños y esperanzas son hacer más grande su negocio que sus hijos pequeños logren una profesión. Ella está feliz con este préstamo porque no donde quiera ayudan a las personas desinteresadamente. Los integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación realidad “muchas gracias por confiar en nosotros, no les vamos a fallar y que sigan ayudando a más personas en sus negocios y a sus familias”. falta en la foto el señor Jose Socorro.
texts.en: This solidarity group is named "San Antonio." They are located in the state of Morelos, Mexico, in a beautiful village with a warm climate. The group is comprised of Mr. José Socorro, who will use this loan to buy food for raising mojarra [a type of fish]; Ms. María Fidela, who will buy pigs, sheep and bulls; Ms. Felipa and Ms. María de la Luz, who will buy soap, sugar, milk and eggs; Ms. Patricia who will buy food for fattening her sheep; Ms. María Mercedes who will buy pigs to fatten; and Ms. Virginia, who is going to buy vegetables and meat to make her tacos. Virgina is 51 years old and studied until the second year of primary school. She is married and has seven children, five of whom are grown up and working. Her two younger children are a 15 year-old boy who is in secondary school and a 9 year-old girl who attends primary school. Virginia sells steak, sausage and tripe tacos. She is requesting a loan to buy one burner, soft drinks, and vegetables and meat to prepare her tacos. She will also use part to install a floor where she sells her tacos. Virginia started her business 25 years ago because, with her husband out of work and her children still young, she lacked the necessary economic resources. She obtained a loan with her brother-in-law to put into her business and started to sell her tacos. Her business is important because it brings in profits when she's selling well. Virginia remembers once when her granddaughter was sick and she came up with 500 pesos to bring her to the doctor and to pay for her medicines. It was the profits from her business that made it possible for Virginia to pay. She feels proud that the families who are her customers prefer her business and is proud when they say that her tacos are delicious. She reinvests her profits to buy ingredients to continue selling. Her daughter and her husband help her with the business, preparing and selling the tacos. Virginia's hopes and dreams are to make her business larger and for her youngest children to reach professional careers. She is happy to receive this loan because it's not just anywhere that you find people who help others unselfishly. The members of this group would like to tell Kiva and Fundación Realidad: "Thank you very much for having confidence in us. We will not fail you, so that you will continue helping more people with their businesses and families." Mr. José Socorro is missing in the photograph above.

loans.use: to buy a burner, soft drinks, and vegetables and meat for preparing tacos

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora  Teresa  de Jesús  tiene  treinta y ocho años de edad, se dedica  a la venta de  quesos desde hace siete años y a la venta de comida  desde hace tres  años.
Esta muy contenta  por tener su propio negocio  y ver el fruto de su esfuerzo  ya que le va muy bien y obtiene muy buenas ganancias.
Ella estudio hasta la  primaria terminada, tiene  dos hijos una mujer Karina de  doce años de edad   y un varón Gilberto de  quince años de edad  quienes le ayudan a  hacer los quesos.
Esta muy agradecida  con fundacion realidad  por el apoyo  que le  dio cuando mas lo necesitaba  y con su esfuerzo ya cuenta con un local donde realiza sus  quesos y los vende. 
Ella pidió el préstamo para comprar los materiales que necesita para la elaboración de  quesos  como son: tinas, aros   y molino.
Es una persona  con muchos sueños para  sus  hijos como;   seguir ayudándoles para  que terminen sus estudios y tengan más oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa is 38 years old. She has been selling cheese for seven years and selling food for three years. Teresa is very pleased to have her own business and seeing the fruit of her labor. She has done very well and has earned a good income.

Teresa finished her elementary school education. She has two children, a daughter named Karina (age 12) and a son named Gilberto (age 15), who help her with making cheese. Teresa is very grateful to Fundación Realidad for the support it has given to her when she needed it most. Through her efforts, she now has a shop where she can make and sell cheese. Teresa is requesting a loan to buy necessary supplies for making cheese such as vats, hoops, and a mill.

She is a person who has many dreams for her children, such as helping them finish their studies and providing more opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy vats, hoops, and a mill for making cheese.

loans.name: Placida

texts.es: Placida de 61 años, para Placida su único objetivo es salir adelante. Desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar muy arduamente para poder ayudar a sus padres en el gasto familiar. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta ganado y cerdos. Ella aún no se conforma por ello aspira en incrementar su negocio. Este es su quinto crédito por lo que ella se compromete a realizar puntualmente el pago de sus cuotas. Con este crédito comprara toros, vacas y chivos. Ella está feliz con el apoyo que recibe.
texts.en:
Placida is 61 years old. Her only goal has been to get ahead. Since she was young woman, Placida has worked very hard so that she could help her parents with the family expenses. She buys and sells cattle and pigs. Placida has not become complacent, so she aspires to increase her business.

This is her fifth loan and she promises to submit her payments on time. She will use this loan to buy bulls, cows, and goats. Placida is happy with the support she has received.

loans.use: to purchase bulls, cows, and goats.

loans.name: Blanca Luzmila

texts.es:
La Señora. Blanca es socia del banco comunal San Pablo, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  es conocida por la belleza de sus calles y arquitectura, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

Doña Blanca tiene 25 años, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 8, 4 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo está en la escuela, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
La Señora. Blanca es comerciante siguiendo el ejemplo de su madre, se dedica a la venta de chuzos (carne en palitos), lleva 10 años en esta actividad, también en su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes y chanchos.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la construcción de un galpón para cuyes y una chanchera.

Su meta es tener un vehículo propio.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca is a member of the Communal Bank “San Pablo”. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful streets and architecture. The city offers a wide variety of cuisines and its people have maintained their culture and traditions.

Doña Blanca is 25 years old, divorced, and has three children (ages 8, 4, and 2). Her oldest child is in school. She does not own a home, so she lives at her parents’ house and shares in the household expenses.

Sra. Blanca is a merchant, following in the footsteps of her mother. She sells “chuzos” (meat on a stick) and has been in this business for 10 years. She also raises guinea pigs and pigs at home.

This is her fourth loan with the Communal Bank. She will invest the money in the construction of a pen for the guinea pigs and a pig sty. Her goal is to own a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy materials for building a pig sty and a pen for her guinea pigs.

loans.name: María Roberta

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal San Pablo, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de sus calles y arquitectura, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora María tiene 65 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 14 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, 12 de sus hijos son casados e independientes, sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente. Su esposo es comerciante y la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

Doña María es comerciante de frutas actividad que la desempeña hace muchos años, trabaja de lunes a viernes todo el día.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su hija, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para su negocio. 

Su meta es conservar y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. María is a member of the Communal Bank “San Pablo”. She lives in the central part of the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful streets and architecture. The city offers a wide variety of cuisines and its people have maintained their culture and traditions.

Sra. María is 65 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has 14 grown children. Twelve of them are married and independent. The other two are single, working, and helping her financially. Her husband is a merchant and they own the home in which they reside.

Doña María is a fruit merchant and has been in this line of work for many years. She works all day Monday through Friday.

This is her first loan with the Communal Bank. She was invited to join by her daughter. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of fruits for her business. María’s goal is to preserve and continue her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Manos Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Manos del Sur”, está conformado por 19 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran negocios de todo tipo, venta de antigüedades, costuras, productos congelados, entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Puerto Montt.
Julieta integrante del banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie al medio del grupo, vistiendo un sweater color verde y una bufanda del mismo color, además su cabello está suelto. 
Ella se dedica a entregar el servicio técnico en reparación de celulares, desde hace 5 años. Julieta estudió técnico en informática, lo que le facilita en su trabajo, por los conocimientos que tiene. Ella trabaja en un local que arrienda de lunes a domingo en un horario de 9ºº a 5ºº de la tarde. Los repuestos para celulares los compra en una distribuidora en la ciudad de Santiago. 
Con el crédito Julieta comprará repuestos para celulares. 
Sus metas son expandirse en su negocio.
Ella vive junto a su hija de 10 años de edad y sus sueños son terminar sus estudios universitarios en la carrera de psicopedagogía. 
Julieta está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios entregados por Fondo esperanza, ya que es una ayuda integral que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio y aprender nuevas estrategias en administración. 
Comenta que la relación con las demás socias le ha permitido conocer nuevas experiencias y grandes personas. 
Puerto Montt es una ciudad del sur de Chile, ubicada en la región de Los Lagos. Una de las atracciones de Puerto Montt son sus bellos paisajes verdes; sus playas poco frecuentadas; su gastronomía y especialmente la reputación de sus pescados y mariscos y sus artesanías. Es también la puerta de entrada a la Isla Grande de Chiloé, rica en tradiciones y leyendas.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank named “Manos del Sur” (Hands of the South) consists of 19 entrepreneurs who engage in different fields, which includes all types of business such as selling antiques, sewing, selling frozen foods, and other trades. All of them live in the city of Puerto Montt.

Julieta is a member of the Communal Bank. In the photograph, she is standing in the middle of the group. Julieta is wearing a green sweater and a scarf of the same color. She is wearing her hair down. Julieta has been providing mobile phone repair services as a technician for five years. She studied information technology, which has helped her perform her job due to the knowledge she acquired. Julieta works from a rented shop Monday to Sunday, between the hours of 9am and 5pm. The mobile phone parts that she uses are purchased from a distributor in the city of Santiago. With this loan, Julieta will buy mobile phone parts.

She lives with her 10-year-old daughter and her dreams include finishing her university studies toward a degree in psychology. Julieta is very pleased with and grateful for the services that Fondo Esperanza has provided. This vital source of support has allowed her to invest in her business and learn new strategies for managing it. She says that her relationship with the other members has allowed her to gain new experiences and meet great people.

Puerto Montt is a city in southern Chile, located in the Los Lagos region. The attractions of Puerto Montt include its beautiful green landscapes. The beaches are rarely visited. It is also known for its cuisine, particularly its reputation for seafood and shellfish, and its handicrafts. Puerto Montt is also the gateway to the Grand Isle of Chiloé, which is rich in traditions and legends.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone parts.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Mariana es socia del banco comunal San Pablo, vive por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca,  esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de sus calles y arquitectura, tiene una gran variedad en su gastronomía, su gente mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

La Señora. Mariana tiene 44 años, es soltera, vive con su hermana y cuida a sus 3 sobrinos, dos de ellos están en el colegio y su último sobrino en la escuela, la casa en la que habita es propia.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de pantalones, vende recorriendo la ciudad dos días a la semana y ha iniciado este negocio con su primer crédito. 

Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal  y lo va a invertir  en la compra de más pantalones para incrementar su negocio.

Su meta es crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Mariana is a member of the Communal Bank “San Pablo”. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful streets and architecture. The city offers a wide variety of cuisines and its people have maintained their culture and traditions.

Sra. Mariana is 44 years old, single, and lives with her sister. She takes care of her three nephews and nieces. Two of them are in high school and the youngest one is in elementary school. She owns the home in which they live.

Mariana sells trousers by traveling throughout the city twice a week. She started this business using her first loan.

Mariana is now receiving her third loan from the Communal Bank. She will invest in the purchase of more trousers so that she can increase her business. Her goal is to grow her business even more.

loans.use: to buy trousers to sell.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia de 35 años convive con José, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, todos menores de edad. Ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas.Está emprendedora mujer, hace tan solo 5 años, que comenzó con la actividad de siembra de maca, su producto bandera. Siembra este producto en terrenos de la comunidad, que son alejados, hermosos y espacioso. Primero, vendía su producción a los intermediarios que trasladaban sus cosechas a la ciudad de Junín. Luego, al ver que la maca que producía y era de buena calidad, Eulalia, recibió la propuesta de vender su producción a una empresa procesadora de bebidas a base de maca en la capital. Desde entonces comenzó a invertir en la mejora de la calidad de su producto, el cual le genera ganancias netas entre 9 mil a 10 mil nuevos soles anuales. Por ello está planeando abrir su propia empresa de procesadora de maca, con la cual pueda expandir su negocio y por ende generar mejores ganancias, en corto plazo.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de San Pedro” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, donde está segura de salir adelante junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal y agradece el apoyo recibido de parte de todos ustedes. Eulalia este año recibió un incremento en las ventas de Maca, aún le falta por extraer y es por eso que de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la contrata de peones para que le ayuden en la cosecha de Maca.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 35 years old and in a common-law marriage with her husband José. They have four young children and live in their own home in the town of San Pedro de Cajas. She is an enterprising woman who started growing “maca” five years ago since it is a prized crop. The land on which she plants is in a remote part of her community that is beautiful and spacious. At first Eulalia sold her crop to brokers who transported her product to the city of Junín. After she determined that the “maca” she produced was of good quality, Eulalia received an offer to sell her harvest to a beverage processing company in Lima that uses this product. Since then, she began investing in her crop in order to improve its quality. Eulalia earns a yearly net income between 9000 to 10,000 PEN. For this reason, she plans to open her own “maca” processing company so that she can expand her business and generate more earnings in the short term.

Eulalia is a member of the Communal Bank “Corazón de San Pedro” (Heart of San Pedero) and this will be her third loan with MFP. She is confident of achieving success along with the other members of her Communal Bank. Eulalia appreciates the support that she has received from everyone. She increased her “maca” sales orders this year, but her crop has yet to be harvested. This is why she is requesting assistance. Eulalia will invest the money she requested in the hiring of workers to help harvest the “maca”.

loans.use: to hire workers to help with harvesting.

loans.name: Nuevos Emprendedores (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevos Emprendedores está formado por 4 mujeres y 4 hombres quienes trabajan en sus diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares, son personas muy amables, luchadoras y carismáticas. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad más importante del país y fue nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999. 

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señora Ana y vive por la ciudad de Cuenca. Tiene 42 años, es casada y se encuentra embarazada de 8 meses. Su esposo es maestro latonero y tiene un taller propio. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Doña Ana hace 10 años se dedica a la atención de su tienda, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario. También tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, ella aprendido este oficio hace 20 años.

Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda.

Su meta es crecer en su taller de costura.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Nuevos Emprendedores” (New Entrepreneurs) consists of four women and four men who work in different business activities so that they can cover their household expenses. These people are friendly, determined, and charismatic. They live in the city of Cuenca, the third largest city in Ecuador, which was named a World Heritage Site in 1999.

One of the members of the group is Sra. Ana, who lives in the city of Cuenca. She is 42 years old, married, and eight months pregnant. Her husband is an expert at auto body repair and has his own workshop. They do not own a home, so they live at her mother’s house and share in the household expenses.

Doña Ana has been managing a store for 10 years. She works Sunday through Sunday without a set schedule. In addition, she has a small sewing workshop in her home. She learned this trade 20 years ago.

This is her first loan with the Communal Bank. She will invest in the purchase of basic necessities for her store. Her goal is to grow her sewing business.

loans.use: to purchase basic necessities for her store.

loans.name: Giovana Elizabeth

texts.es: Giovana, de 28 años, convive hace 3 años con Marcelo, su esposo. Ambos tienen 3 hijos menores a los que quieren y cuidan en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Sus días se centran en el trabajo arduo. Desde hace algún tiempo comenzó en la venta de golosinas, bebidas y comida; en el cafetín de la escuela de su localidad donde obtiene buenas ganancias, ya que es la única que abastece a todos los estudiantes y profesores. Además de dedicar sus tiempos libres a tejer chompas de lana muy coloridas y vistosas; que gracias a su creatividad logra vender a intermediarios de la zona que comercializan los tejidos a la ciudad de Oroya, donde tiene mucha acogida por las bajas temperaturas. Además de recibir el apoyo de su esposo; que trabaja trasportando verduras, papa y frutas por todo el país, esto lo realiza manejando un camión, le va muy bien en su trabajo, por ello para el futuro está planeando ahorrar lo necesario para comprarse uno propio.Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Corazón de san pedro” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual en sus cuotas. Giovana de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra dulces al por mayor para surtir su tiendita.
texts.en:
Giovana is 28 years old and has been in a common-law marriage with her husband Marcelo for three years. They both love and take care of their three young children. Giovana and her family live in a rented house in the town of San Pedro de Cajas. Her days involve hard work. Some time ago, she began selling candy, beverages, and food at a local school cafeteria to earn a good income. Her business was the only one that catered to all of the students and teachers. In addition, she weaves colorful and vibrant wool sweaters. Thanks to her creativity, Giovana began selling to local brokers who sold her woven articles in the city of Oroya. Her handiwork is well-received because of the cold weather. She also receives the support of her husband, who transports vegetables, potatoes, and fruit all over the country with a truck. Her husband has done very well in his job, so he plans to save enough money to buy a vehicle of his own.

Giovana is a member of the Communal Bank “Corazón de San Pedro” (Heart of San Pedro) and this will be her first loan with MFP. She hopes to receive everyone’s support so that she can continue with her goals. In addition, she promises to complete her payments on time. With the support she will receive, Giovana will invest the money she requested in the purchase of candy in bulk so that she can restock her small store.

loans.use: to buy candy in bulk to sell in her store.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is a widowed mother of one child. Socorro is 60 years old and lives in Zamora Aloran, Misamis Occidental.
She vends food such as different kinds of viand, snacks like puto, soman, hotcake, etc. to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,200 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan  of PHP 5,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business.
Socorro has been a member of PMPC for a year.  In the future, Soccoro hopes to have a food stall.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Tranquilino

texts.en:
Tranquilino is 63 years old and lives in Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City. He is widowed with two children. 
To earn a living, Tranquilino has a business selling items like sugar, salt, milk, milo, vinegar, rice, soft drinks, etc. He earns about PHP 1,500 each month from his business. Tranquilino has requested a loan 10,000  to  purchase more products for his general store.
Tranquilino has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Tranquilino would like to own a grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase more products for his general store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 57 years old, and lives in Plaridel. She is married with four children. 
Delia has a cloth-selling business, and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. 
Delia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Delia hopes to have a concrete house.

loans.use: To purchase cloths to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 31 years old, and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 
To earn a living, Victoria has a business selling snacks. She earns about PHP 1,200 each month doing this type of work. Victoria has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to purchase raw ingredients for snacks making.
Victoria has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Victoria would like to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for snacks making

location.town: Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 59 years old, and lives in Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is separated from her husband and has six children. 
Tita sews dresses to earn a living. She has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to purchase a new sewing machine. She has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Tita hopes to save money to have it available for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is married and has six children. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Lilia is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase piglet feed and vitamins. 

Lilia has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to improve her family's living conditions and to have more savings for their future use.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Rio

texts.en:
Rio is married and has four children. She is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Rio is a farmer and grows mangoes to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for mangoes. 

Rio has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, hopes to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for mango production

loans.name: Ma. Elisa

texts.en:
Ma. Elisa is 47 years old and lives in Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jaena. She is married with no children. 

Ma. Elisa sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to purchase a unit-construction motorcycle for transportation. 

Ma. Elisa has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Ma. Elisa hopes to have more savings and income for her family's consumption and repayments for loans.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for transportation

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 64 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena. She is married and has five children. 

Rosita has a retail business of hypochloride and detergent bar and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has  requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase 100 gallon of hypochloride and 10 boxes of detergent bar for her retail business.
Rosita has been a member of PMPC for 11 years. In the future, Rosita hopes to save more for the brighter future of her children.

loans.use: To purchase 100 gallon of hypochloride and 10 boxes of detergent bar for her retail business

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 61 years old and lives in Southern Poblacion, Plaridel. She is married with two children. 

Rosita has a palm tree business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase a bundle of palm trees. 

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Rosita hopes to build a concrete house.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of palm trees for retail sale

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 44 years old and lives in Balanlinao, Plaridel, Philippines. She is married with four children.
To earn a living, Elvira has a junk business. She has had this business for 15 years. Each month, she  earns approximately PHP 7,000.00. Elvira has requested a loan if PHP 20,000 to purchase junk items. She has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.
In the future, Elvira hopes to have enough savings to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase junk items

loans.name: Lorda

texts.en: Lorda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Lorda has been in this business for 10 years. Lorda requested a 29,500 Philippine pesos loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. She would like to save money to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 52 years old and has six children. She is married and has three children who are in school. Merilyn is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. She has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 31 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farm.

Merilyn requested a 27,000 Philippine pesos loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. In the future, Merilyn would like to build up and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is 41 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Susan works very hard to provide for her family. Susan runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 24,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store. Susan has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, eggs, noodles, spices, soap, etc. In the future, Susan would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 55 years old and married with 9 children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing and rice retailing.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is 35 years old and lives in Biasong, Lopez Jeana, Philippines.  She is married with four children. 
Alona has a pottery business and earns approximately PHP 2,500.00 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan  PHP 10,000 to purchase  clay for pottery making and the labor cost for a pottery worker. 
Alona has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future,

loans.use: To  purchase clay for pottery making and the labor cost for a pottery worker

loans.name: Socoro

texts.en:
Socoro is 49 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Socoro runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Socoro has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 13 years. Socoro hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hard-working entrepreneur who makes and sells food in the Philippines. Vilma has been in this business for two years. She earns additional income from selling meat. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business. Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Amalia works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from farming vegetables. Amalia is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional inventory of fruits and vegetables to sell.

Amalia has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her reach her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 41 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Mila sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to purchase more containers of fish for sale. 
Mila has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, Mila hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more containers of fish for sale

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is a hardworking entrepreneur who buys and sells dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in her dried fish business.

Celestina has been in this business for 7 years. Celestina earns additional income from farming rice.

Celestina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Merly is a farmer and grows bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 50,000 to purchase banana plants and to pay for the labor. 
Merly has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Merly hopes to improve the living condition of her family and to save for the education of her children .

loans.use: To purchase banana plants  and pay for a worker

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is separated from her husband and has 3 children. 
To earn a living, Elsa has a business selling fish. She earns about PHP 2,000.00 each month doing this type of work. Elsa has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase more fish to sell.
Elsa has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.  In the future, Elsa would like to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family. Alicia is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Alicia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks like pants, blouses, foot-wear etc. to sell.

Alicia has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Alicia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks like pants, blouses, foot-wear etc. to sell

loans.name: Aleli

texts.en:
Aleli is 46 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor.  She is single.

To earn a living. Aleli has a business selling snacks. She earns about 2,500 PHP each month doing this work. Aleli requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her snack business.

Aleli has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for ten months. Aleli would like to help her family.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her snack business

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is 49 years old and has 5 children. Carolina is married and has 5 children who are in school.

Carolina is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Carolina requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Carolina has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her pigs.

In the future, Carolina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy is 22 years old and lives in Sabang, Larena, Siquijor. She is single. She has a synthetic medicine business and earns approximately 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase an order of natural medicine.

Tracy has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for eight months. In the future, Tracy hopes to sustain and show progress in the said business.

loans.use: To purchase an order of natural medicine.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 49 years old and lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City. She is married with two children. To earn a living, Priscilla has a business selling goods like rice and corn. She earns about 2,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Priscilla has requested a loan for 3,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients for her food vending business.

Priscilla has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Priscilla would like to have a food stall in the market.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for food vending business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke rentals business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional unit for her videoke rentals business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 3 years. Jocelyn earns additional income from vegetable vending.

Jocelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and buy more farm lands in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional videoke unit.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is married with one child. She is 44 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. Catherine sells used clothing to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 1,800 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 14,900 PHP to purchase more bundles of used clothing. Catherine has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Catherine hopes to pay tuition fees for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more bundles of used clothing

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is a hardworking father who works all day to maintain his farming business. He wakes up early and goes down to the field and visits his rice field. Romulo plants and harvests rice and sells it to traders. In the last cropping season in May, he earned a yield of 25,000 PHP and used it to pay electric bills, for daily needs at home and for the education of his three children. His wife does household chores and budgets the income.

As of now, he has just finished transplanting rice seedlings ready for the next cropping season of November. So, he is requesting a loan of 37,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and pesticides used for the maintenance of his farm. 

In the future, Romulo wants to achieve a plentiful harvest to earn enough money and save in case of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides used for the maintenance of his farm

loans.name: Dometila

texts.en:
Dometila is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Dometila has a food shop that sells snacks like rice and pancakes. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Dometila has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Dometila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Jocelyn has a retail shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses and underwear. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy t-shirts and blouses to sell.

Jocelyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts and blouses to sell

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en: Janeth, a 46-year-old married mother of five, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a shop selling canned goods, snacks, beverages and noodles for 10 years. A member of HSPFI since 2009, she is now requesting a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, noodles and breads.  In the future, Janeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles & breads.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: Noemi, a 43-year-old married mother of four, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a shop selling canned goods, beverages and snacks for seven years.  A member of HSPFI since 2009, she has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy more snacks, detergents and beverages to sell. In the future, Noemi hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, detergents & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn, a 26-year-old married mother of one, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages for the past seven years. A member of HSPFI since 2010, she has requested a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy more beverages, canned goods and snacks to sell. In the future, Marilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, canned goods and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for her transportation services.

loans.name: Kulsahira's Group

texts.en:
Kulsahira, the leader of this group, is 50 years old and divorced. She has raised a daughter, who is now married and living separately with her own family, and a son, who is in the military.

Five years ago Kulsahira secured a loan with which she started her own business baking bread at home and then supplying it to grocery stores. She is now requesting this loan in order to purchase more flour. In the future, Kulsahira wants to expand her business and improve her living conditions.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more mobile phones

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru:
Шахло честная, ответственная и добросовестная женщина. Она вдова и мать 3 детей.  Она сама одна кормит своих детей, старается обеспечит их всему чем они нуждаются, потому что она не хочет чтоб её дети почувствовали отсутствии отца. Вот с этой целью она занимается купля продажей женских тканей, а также шитьем более 5 лет. Она принимает заказы униформы для школьников, садиков и т.д. Она имеет несколько учеников, которые помогает ей. Шахло хотела бы получит кредит в размере 2500$ США для покупки тканей для шитья униформы для школьников, потому что в сентябре школы начинаются и большой спрос на рынке. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Shahlo is an honest, responsible and conscious woman.  She is a widow and is mother of three children.  She is supporting her children on her own and tries to provide them with everything that they need because she does not want her children to feel the absence of their father.  This is why she has been involved in buying and selling women's fabrics and sewing for over five years.  She has orders for uniforms for school children, kindergartens and the like.  She has several apprentices who help her.  Shahlo wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $2500 for the purchase of fabrics for sewing school uniforms because schools start in September, and the demand for uniforms increases.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for sewing school uniforms

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, pictured with her loom, is a silk weaver. Her husband, Proeung, is a farmer. They have been married since 1989 and have three children: one son and two daughters. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Silk weaving is a traditional profession. Sophea is asking for another loan of $500 US to continue her work by buying silk materials.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Som Ol

texts.en: Som ol (in the photo with his grandson) is a soldier, while his wife, Norm, sells small trees and flowers in her village. They have been married since 1983 and have five children: four sons and a daughter. One is married, two are garment workers and the other two are in school. Som ol is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for his children to drive to work.

loans.name: Sithan

texts.en: Sithan (in the photo) has been driving a tuk tuk taxi [a motorcycle pulling a passenger trailer or a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi] for more than five years. His wife raises pigs and chickens at home. The couple has been married since 2004 and has two young children: one son and one daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Sithan is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a tuk tuk for his brother to launch a business driving a tuk tuk taxi.

loans.use: to buy a tuk tuk for his brother to launch a business driving a tuk tuk taxi.

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.ru:
Сарвиноз трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 2 дочерей. Её муж является разнорабочим.  Чтобы помогать мужу она начала заниматься шитьем национальных платьев, курпачи и вышиванием тамбурным швом более 3 лет.   Она принимает заказы, и день за днем её клиенты растут.   Сарвиноз хочет, чтобы её дети выросли в хороших условиях жизни и стали образованными и культурными людьми, поэтому она хочет,  расширит свой бизнес и максимизировать прибыл.  Она хотела бы получит займ в размере 1400$ США для покупки тканей, швейную машинку и нитки. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Sarvinoz is a hardworking and conscientious woman. She's married and has two daughters. Her husband is a general laborer. In order to help her husband, three years ago, she began sowing ethnic clothes, blankets (kurpachas), and tambour stitches. She accepts new orders daily, and has an ever increasing amount of clients. Sarvinoz's dream is for her children to grow up in a healthy environment as educated and cultured individuals. Hence her wish to expand her business and maximize her profits. She's asking for a loan of 1400$ in order to purchase fabrics, a sewing-machine and thread.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, a sewing-machine, and thread

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a responsible and cheerful person. He enjoys daily activities in his farming business. David is single and devotes himself full time to maintaining his business which is the only source of income for his family. He lives in a village with his parents. He plants and harvests rice twice a year and merchandises his yield to traders in his village. David's parents are old and not capable of working anymore to make a living on their own. Last cropping season in May, he produced a good crop and earned about 40,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). The income generated from the business went for his family's daily consumption and investment in the maintenance of his business. The rest of the profit was saved for future emergencies.

David wants to achieve a bountiful harvest to increase his earnings which is why he is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy seeds and fertilizers and pay for the labor costs of sowing and transplanting rice seedlings on his farm. According to him, he pays laborers who help him with the farm activities and thanks them for the services they render. With the help of this loan, he will thoroughly prepare his farm land for the next planting season. In the future, David wants to strengthen his business to achieve financial independence. Someday, he also wants to have his own family – a wife and children to raise too.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and to pay labor costs for sowing and transplanting rice seedlings on his farm.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Maria has a computer shop that provides computer services like online games and encoding of documents. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to pay for the electricity for the computer services.

Maria has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for the electricity for the computer services

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Nilda has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Nilda has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Nilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Elsie has a shop that sells snacks, beverages, canned goods and breads. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks.

Elsie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Elsie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Jenalyn has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages and snacks. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jenalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jenalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 54 years old and married. She has five grown children living with her in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. Nilda has engaged in raising pigs to make a living. She personally tends to the cleaning, bathing and feeding of the domestic animals. Her interest in doing this business has kept her going for four years. Every month, she earns PHP 10,000 from her business undertakings.

Earlier this year, Nilda joined GDMPC to have an access to financial services. On her 1st loan transaction, she has requested PHP 30,000 from the cooperative to purchase breeding livestock to raise and later sell. By having all of these animals grown, Nilda hopes to sell them at a higher price to increase her income generated.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock to raise.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 36 лет. Она разведена. Живет вместе с родителями. У нее трое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Матлуба занимается торговлей на рынке. Она арендует торговую точку, где продает летнюю обувь. Этим видом деятельности занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для покупки осеней обуви.
texts.en: Matluba lives in the town of Khujand. She is 36 years old. She is divorced and lives with her parents. She has three children. She has completed secondary education. Matluba works as a vendor at the local market. She rents a stand where she sells summer shoes. She has been in this business for 10 years. She is taking out a loan to buy shoes for the fall season.

loans.use: to buy fall shoes

loans.name: Phally

texts.en:
Phally, 45, grows small trees for sale at her home. Her husband, Phous, 51, is a motor taxi driver. They live along National Road Number Two about twelve kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have five children; two sons and three daughters. Two are garment workers and the other three are in school.

Phally is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to buy a motorbike for her children.

Photo: Phally and her husband.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her children.

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.ru:
Муаззам честный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и отец одного ребенка.  Муаззам всегда старается, обеспечит свою семью, и жить в хороших условиях жизни, и поэтому он начал занимается купля продажей промтоварами. 14 лет тому назад после развала СССР он торговал на улицах и привозил товары с других районов. А потом постепенно он взял маленькую торговую точку в аренду. Муаззам хочет, расширит свой бизнес и получит максимальный прибыль. Он хотел бы получит  займ в размере 2000$ США для покупки промтоваров. Муаззам заранее благодарит вас за вашу поддержку и милосердие.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Muazzan is honest, hardworking and driven. He's married and has one child. In order to provide for his family and live in a healthy environment, he began a small business dealing in household goods and appliances. Fourteen years ago, after the collapse of the Soviet Union, he was a salesperson on the streets and imported goods from nearby regions. Gradually, he was able to build up his business and started renting a sales point. Muazzan wants to expand the business and maximize his profits. He's requesting a loan of 2000$ in order to purchase household goods and appliances. He thanks all of his lenders in advance for their support and charity.

loans.use: to buy household goods and appliances.

loans.name: Merry Christ

texts.en:
Merry Christ is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Merry Christ has a pigpen that sells grown and matured pigs. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.

Merry Christ has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merry Christ hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Romilaine

texts.en:
Romilaine is 33 years old, but looks very young. She is married with one child to attend to. She is engaged in a farming activity to earn a living. 

It requires hard work, patience, and interest to succeed.  Romilaine has been able to manage six years at this work and earns PHP 6,000 a month.

Earlier this year, she joined GDMPC. Romilaine has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 from the cooperative to purchase farm fertilizers and pesticides for protection. The more inputs, the more possible income to generate. In this period of production, Romilaine hopes to reap more, have more farm to cultivate and sustain the livelihood as well.

loans.use: To purchase farm fertilizers and pesticides for protection.

loans.name: Abed Al Nasser

texts.en:
Abed A. Nasser is a 50-year-old married man and father of three children. He has worked in construction for the last 35 years, and was very young when  he started working. Unlike his friends, he had to help in his family's income instead of enjoying teenager's games and conversations. 

Abed A. Nasser misses his childhood a lot. He works hard on providing the best for his kids, and makes sure that they will enjoy their childhood through working hard on improving his business and increasing his income to cover their expenses.

Abed A. Nasser is specialized in pasting tiles and polishing them. He uses a generator to provide himself with electricity since it is a major problem in Lebanon. He needs to cut tiles through a specialized electric cutter, which will help in finishing his business in a short period of time with the best quality provided.

Through requesting  a loan from A. Majmoua, Abed A. Nasser will be capable of fixing his generator, because it is not working as it should be, and this will affect his business a lot, since he'll be late in finishing most of his work.

Abed A. Nasser can't imagine his business without having an engine that makes his life easier as he describes it.  Abed A. Nasser hopes to open his own  company in the future that deals with all types of construction.

loans.use: To fix his business generator

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is 46 years old and lives in Bato, Plaridel. She is widowed with seven children. 

Marichu has a shop that sells clothing products. She has had this business for four years. She has requested a loan for 10,000 to purchase more stocks of clothes.

Marichu has been a member of PMPC for 11 years.  In the future, Marichu hopes to have her children finish their studies.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of clothes

loans.name: Melicia

texts.en:
Melicia  is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Melicia  has a shop that sells canned goods, beverages & snacks.  She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Melicia  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Melicia  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim (pictured with her loom) is a weaver.  Her husband, Kunla has been employed in a printing shop.  They live on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two children, a son who is in   his4th year at his university and one daughter who is attending secondary school.  

Yim is asking for a loan of $800 to pay school fees for her son who is in his 4th year at his university.  She will use part of the loan to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son who is in his 4th year at his university.

loans.name: Sameng

texts.en:
Sameng (in the photo), 41, is a flower farmer.  Besides farming, she also buys fish from Phnom Penh market and carries them by her motorbike to sell in her local market.  Her husband, Leangkeo is a construction worker. 

They have been married since 1994 and have five children, four sons and one daughter.  One is married and lives in a separate home, two are chefs and the other two are in school.  The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sameng is asking for a loan of $1,000 to repair the house where she lives and to fill in the land of her farming plot.

loans.use: To repair the house where she lives and to fill in the land of her farming plot.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 3 children. 

Josephine raises and sells mature and grown pigs . She has had this business for 5 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs .

Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josephine  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 38 years old; married to Nelson.  She supports a family of five people.  She has been in her business for nine years.  Her monthly income from her business is KES.36,000.  This is her third loan.  She has been loaned KES.40,000, which she will use to purchase more stock of second hand clothes for sale.

The anticipated profit that she will get from her business will be used to buy more mitumba clothes (second hand clothing).  Her hopes and dreams for her future is to educate her children and to become a well off person in the society.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her second hand clothing business

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
