Ligaya is 43 years old. She is from Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has six grown children. Ligaya works as a farmer to earn additional income for her family; this is not her only income. She started farming three years ago. She finds it tiresome, but she has learned to love it as time passes by. Every month, she receives a total of 23,500 PHP--enough money to cover everyday expenses.

Earlier this year, Ligaya joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase farm fertilizers and to pay for irrigation costs. The cycle of production has just started. Ligaya hopes to increase farm production today and on subsequent cycles of production in order to gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase farm fertilizers and to pay for irrigation costs

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 40 years old, married, and has three grown children who live with her. She is from Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  To support her daily needs, Alma runs a small restaurant from her home.  The foods are personally cooked by her, and each month she is able to earn an income of about 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP).

In 2007, she joined KIva field partner GDMPC so she could access loans. Alma has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP which she intends to use to purchase soft drinks and food items to sell in her restaurant. She hopes that the loan will help her expand her business and allow her to earn more for a better living.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and food items

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a 37-year-old widow who has three children.  She supports a total of six dependents. She has had a fish selling business for six years and her monthly income is about 27,000 Kenyan shillings (KES).  She intends to use this 80,000 KES loan, her second loan from Kiva field partner Kadet Ltd., to purchase more fish to sell.  Lucy hopes to be able to earn enough to buy plots of land for her children, and wants to excel at everything in life.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Sakum

texts.en:
Sakum, 57, is a field hand on area farms.  Her husband, Lun, is a 59-year-old construction worker. They have been married since 1979 and one son and one daughter; one of their children is married and lives away from home, the other one is a garment worker. Sakum and Lun live in a village along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia's capital.   Sakum is asking for a loan of $1,200 to expand her family's house, and to replace support pillars in the house.

Photo: Sakum and her husband Lun

loans.use: to pay for an addition to her house, and to replace support pillars in the house

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Celestina works on her rice farm, harvesting & selling rice. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.
Celestina  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Celestina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is a 60-year-old married woman who has 5 adult children. She lives in Bangko, Panaon, Mis. Occ., Philippines. She has spent 20 years of her life buying and selling coconuts from her home and also in neighboring places. Approximately, she makes a monthly income of PHP 3,000. 
In 2010, Rosie became an official GDMPC member. In her 4th loan cycle with the cooperative, she has requested PHP 10,000. She will use the money to buy more coconuts to sell. The more stock she has, the higher her returns. Rosie hopes to increase the selling price for coconuts in the future and to further expand the business to increase the family income.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 35 years old and is married to Erick. She has a family of seven people. She has been farming poultry for the past four years. Her monthly income is KES.5,000/=. This is her second loan. She will use the KES.40,000 loan to expand her business; she will buy more stock of poultry and poultry feed.

The profit that she will get from her poultry farming will be used in her business and to pay school fees. Her hope and dream for the future is to be able to provide well for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of poultry and poultry feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 30 years old and is married. She is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is taking good care of her 2 school-aged children. Selling ice candy and juices around the local community is Marife's small business. She has been doing this for 6 years already. She earns PHP 2,000 every month. 
To have access to financial services she joined GDMPC earlier this year. She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase snack items to sell such as hot cakes (pancakes) and banana cue (bananas fried in hot oil, coated with sugar). Marife hopes to expand her business and to earn more income to provide for her daily needs - especially those of her growing kids.

loans.use: To purchase hot cakes, banana cue and other snack items to sell.

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is 53 years old and is widowed. She is a dry fish vendor and a dairy farmer which she has been doing for over thirty years. Both her dairy and fish businesses are going well. She supports herself and two grandchildren.

This is her third loan cycle from KADET. With the money she plans to purchase more fish to sell. She hopes to use the profit from her sales to repay her loan and also to educate her grandchildren.

She hopes to support her grandchildren and to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna is 48 years old and lives in kauswagan, Plaridel. She is married with three children. 
Miraluna works in the fishing industry, catching fish for a living. She has been doing this for 30 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase spare parts for the pump-boat she uses for fishing  . 
Miraluna has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Miraluna hopes to build a concrete house.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the pump-boat she uses for fishing

loans.name: Iroda

texts.ru:
Ирода добросовестная и честная женщина. Она разведена и любящая мать 4 детей.   В 2005 году она начала купля продажей мелочевки и постепенно она начала продавать одежду.  Сегодняшний день она имеет свою лавку, и её бизнес идет успешно. Ирода мечтает о том, что когда-то она расширит свой бизнес и получит максимальный прибыль, что позволят ей, чтобы её дети учились в престижную школу и университетах. Она очень хочет, чтобы её дети выросли образованными и добросовестными. Ирода хотела бы получит займ в размере 1000$ США для покупки школьных униформ. Она надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать её. Спасибо! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Iroda is an honest and conscientious woman. She is divorced and a loving mother of 4 children. In 2005 she has started a trinket store and slowly expanded into sale of clothing. Currently she has her own store at the local market and her business is flourishing. Iroda dreams about expanding her business in order to maximize the income it can bring. This will allow her to send her children to an elite school and to university. She really wants to raise her kids into well educated and conscientious adults. Iroda would like to borrow 1000 USA dollars to purchase school uniforms for sale in her store for the starting school season. She hopes that KIVA lenders will be able to support her loan and she thanks all of them in advance.

loans.use: Purchase of school uniforms

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 47 years old and lives in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child. 
Nancy has a general store and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchase canned  goods, noodles, drinks and other products to increase her store inventory. 
Nancy has been a member of PMPC for 7 years. In the future, Nancy hopes to repair their house.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her store

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 45 years old. She is married with 5 grown children. She is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. While not her sole source of income, Lolita raises a variety of crops to make a living. She checks the crops and makes sure of their progress. She has handled the business for 6 years. Every month, her earnings are PHP 15,000. 
In 2008, Lolita joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. She has applied for a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase seeds/seedlings and young plants and to pay for land preparation. Lolita plans to widen her cultivated area to gain more income for the family and to plant more root crops.

loans.use: To purchase seeds/seedlings, young raised crops and pay for land preparation cost.

loans.name: Bẩy

texts.en:
Bẩy is a 43-year-old female living in a town in Yên Phong district - Băc Ninh province. She is married and has 5 adult children. Bẩy operates a family member's business in the food sector, making & selling rice products in the local community. Bẩy has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 6.000.000 VND a month.

In 2009, Bẩy joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Bẩy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8.288.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Bẩy is now requesting a new loan of 9.184.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital.  The will be her 3rd loan from SEDA. Bẩy plans to use the additional revenue generated to save as a reserve for future emergencies.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Bẩy là 43 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Yên Phong district - Băc Ninh province.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 5 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Bẩy Tham gia công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các sản phẩm từ gạo trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Bẩy thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Bẩy kiếm được khoảng 6.000.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2009, Bẩy đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Bẩy đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 9.184.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Bẩy dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  tiết kiệm cho những trường hợp khẩn cấp sau này.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Katsele

texts.en:
Katsele is a 30-year-old married mother of five. She is a dry fish vendor, a business that has been in operation for the past eighteen years.

She is a KADET client and this is her fourth loan. With the money she plans to purchase more stock of fish to sell. She hopes to use the profit from her sales to repay her loan and to also support her family.

Her hope is to expand her business and to be a good provider for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Kwembe Group

texts.en:
Anna, who is in her early 30s, is single with two children.  One of them goes to school. She has been running a fried fish business for 1 year now. She goes to the ferry fish market where fishermen sell fresh fish at 4a.m. She fries them and then takes them to sell at a place near her home, on the road side. She goes home when the fish are sold at around 9p.m. She is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy more fish to sell and has successfully repaid this loan. She wants a loan to increase her fish stock and to buy a display case for her fish business. Her dream is to one day be able to buy land.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Kwembe" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock and to buy a display case for her fish business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 51 years old. She is married with one child to care for. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. While not her only source of income, Remedios has been working on her farm for 1 year now. Every month she receives a total of PHP 5,000.
In 2007, Remedios joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for milling and to plow the field for the next production cycle. In the coming years she hopes to reap a very good harvest and is plowing and cultivating additional land to generate more income.

loans.use: To pay for milling and for plowing

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 30-year-old married man and the father of three children. He has been working as a mechanic since 1994. He is a hard-working man with a good reputation who seeks perfection in his business and in his customer service.
Fouad works hard on updating his business. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua to buy new tools and to make the finA. payment for his car.
He has been an A. Majmoua borrower for two cycles. He is a borrower of good standing and has proved to be a hard-working man. This was shown through his business improvements and through the updating of his tools.
Fouad is liked by most of his neighbors who represent almost 90% of his customers. They highly recommend dealing with him.
He is working hard on providing his children with the best education ever, in addition to a healthy and happy childhood.
Fouad is planning on expanding his business by opening a bigger garage in the future and adding new services.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his business

loans.name: Esmily

texts.en:
Esmily is a 33-year-old married mother of three children. She is a dry fish vendor, a business that has been in operation for the past sixteen years.

She is a KADET client and this is her fourth loan. With the money she plans to purchase more fish to sell. She hopes to use the profit from her sales to repay her loan and to also support her family.

Her main dream is to expand her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish to sell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 32 years old. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. The family is currently residing in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She has engaged in a motorcycle transport business activity to earn a living. She had this business for 3 years. Getting 5,000 PHP requires Jenelyn to have proper budgeting skills to cover her daily needs.

In 2009, she joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase motor tires and a head light to improve the service quality. Jenelyn hopes to improve the general living conditions of the family by sustaining and expanding the business venture she now handles.

loans.use: to purchase motor tires and headlight to improve the service quality

loans.name: Janessa

texts.en:
Janessa is 30 years old and separated from her husband with one child.  She lives in Calalinan, Siquijor, Siquijor.

She sells in a sari-sari (convenience) store to earn a living and has had this business for 6 months.  Each month, she earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Janessa has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative since July 13, 2011.  In the future, she hopes to have a savings deposit for her one child.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is a 24-year-old single lady. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines and owns a habal-habal (a two-wheeled motorcycle capable of carrying 2-4 passengers) to make additional income for the family. While not the only means of income, the family earns 10,000 PHP a month.

Earlier this year, Maricris had requested a loan of 10,000 PHP. The loaned amount will be used to purchase spare motor parts to keep it in good running condition. Growing or expanding the service-based livelihood is all she had longed for to give sufficient inflows for the family. Maricris wants to explore business projects to improve and test her capability of running more later.

loans.use: to purchase spare motor parts

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 28-year-old married woman who started working six years ago in order to help her husband in covering their expenses.

Zeinab is a hardworking woman. She started selling household appliances, but four months ago she added a new section in her shop which deals with food. In fact, she opened a grocery store which she believes will help a lot in increasing her family's income and will help in covering almost all of her child's needs.

Zeinab is a hardworking businesswoman and is smart enough to attract customers to buy from both shops although they might be not in need of what they are buying.

Zeinab is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua in order to support her grocery store for Holy Ramadan month with the best quality of dates, nuts, syrups and sweets requested during this period. She hopes that this month will have a positive effect on her and will help in planning a bright future for her family, especially for her child.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita is 52 years old and lives in Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena. She is married with four children.

Charita has a pig raising business and earns approximately 3,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7,000 to purchase feed and medicines for her piglets.

Charita has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Charita hopes to have savings from her business for her student allowance.

loans.use: to purchase feed and medicines for her pigs

location.town: Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is married with four children, all 15 years of age or older. She lives in Old Town in a 4-bedroom apartment with her children in the Bamenda Northwest region of Cameroon.

Her major challenges in life have been the difficulty she has faced in the cold hands of dearth and sickness and poverty, and, before joining GHAPE, inadequate capital to start up a business. She has also suffered greatly from ill health.  With this loan, she plans to buy beans, corn, rice, onions, cocoyam and firewood. She knows her business is going to succeed because she has acquired some basic training on finance and also because she has customers available to buy from her. 

Serah has also acquired some marketing techniques from GHAPE and she has chosen to diversify her business by investing some of her capital into her farm.  She has the support for her success. If this loan is granted, it will enable her to sell in her neighborhood at cheaper prices. She joined GHAPE in 2005, since then she has successfully borrowed and repaid loans three times.

She will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. Serah prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

loans.use: to buy beans, corn, rice and onions

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 60-year-old married man and has five sons and three daughters. Ahmad has a grocery store in addition to his work in agriculture. Ahmad wants to improve his grocery store by purchasing more basic goods such as sugar, rice, frozen foods, etc, but he doesn't have enough cash money to pay, so he needs a loan of $1,000 to complete the amount he has.

When Ahmad gets his FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay for more groceries up front and expand the grocery store which will consist of basic foods that have high customer demand, and that will lead to increasing his income and to better living conditions. Ahmad is photographed inside his grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase more basic groceries to improve the store.

loans.name: Nugzar

texts.en:
Nugzar is from the village of Erge, in the mountainous Adjara republic in Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife, Leila; his retired father;  3 sons (18, 17, and 15 years old); and a 13 year-old daughter. 

Nugzar and Leila lead the family's agricultural activities. In particular, they grow tangerines and various fruits and vegetables on 0.3 hectares of  land owned by the family.  Harvested products are sold to local greengrocery retailers. Nugzar and Leila work hard daily to get a good harvest. 

Nugzar requested credit to purchase fertilizer for tangerines and vegetables. After fertilizing the land, the family will get quality produce and sell it for a good price.  The income received will be used for purchasing household goods, in order to improve the living conditions of the children and other family members.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for tangerines and vegetables

loans.name: Mateo

texts.en:
Mateo is a 42-year-old married man. He has 2 grown children. The family lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Mateo has been a fisherman for 8 years. He paddles around fishing routes to earn a living. Mateo is always hoping for calm weather so he can go fishing frequently.  He makes a monthly income of approximately PHP 12,000 from fishing.

In 2007, Mateo joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. He has applied a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase fishing materials so he can continue fishing. This is the life he is accustomed to, and would like to enrich. Mateo plans to engage in seaweed production, which is also in high demand. In doing so, he can gain more income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials to continue fishing.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is single, 40 years old, and lives in La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.

Elsa owns a rice retail store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 6000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 3000 PHP to purchase sacks of rice.

Elsa joined PMPC this year, 2011. In the future, Elsa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice.

location.town: La Union, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Jenie Beth

texts.en:
Jenie Beth  is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Jenie Beth  has a pigpen and she sells mature & full-grown pigs. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Jenie Beth  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jenie Beth  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs she raises and sells.

loans.name: Annie Rose Paye Group

texts.en:
Annie Rose is married with three children. She is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Annie Rose is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer for the corn. 

Annie Rose has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Annie Rose hopes to send her children to school to finish a college degree. She is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her corn.

loans.name: Kasichana

texts.en:
Kasichana is a 49-year-old widow, mother of seven children, aged between three years and twenty years. She is a fish seller with a business that has been in operation for the last twenty years. 

This is her first loan from KADET and with the money she plans to purchase more fish to sell. She hopes to use the profit from her sales to improve her business and to also to support her family.

Her hope is to see her children grow and to have a better future.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime is 36 years old and married. He has an only child to care for. The family settled to make a living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jaime has been a fisherman for eight years, until the present. He has been paddling around fishing routes to make a living. Obviously, it is a difficult and risky thing to do, but he has to ignore what might happen in order to feed his family. He earns a total of PHP 5,000 a month from his fishing activity.

In 2010, Jaime joined GDMPC. He has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 from the cooperative to purchase materials needed to fix his fishing net. Tiny-holed fishing nets have a bigger chance to catch more. Jaime plans to engage in seaweed production to gain more income and improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to fix his fishing net.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 42 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children. 

Lorena has a shop that sells gasoline. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 50,000 to purchase more barrels of gasoline.

Lorena has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, Lorena hopes to expand the business to a nearby municipality.

loans.use: to purchase more barrels of gasoline.

location.town: Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en:
BilA. is a 31-year-old single man, who loves life, as he describes himself, that's why he insisted on working with beauty all around him. He translated his dreams through opening a flower shop six years ago to keep himself in a colorful place, filled with peace all around him and clean atmosphere.

BilA. is a hard-working man, who improves his business as much as he can, from time to time, to open a wider shop in the future. He hopes to make his dream come true through planting and harvesting his own flowers from his own nursery.

BilA. has been A. Majmoua borrower for two cycles, and he's requesting a loan from this Kiva partner, in order to prepare himself for the Holy Ramadan celebrations, where most people decorate their homes with flowers and enjoy their scent. They also visit cemeteries to check on lost beloved ones and decorate their tombs with the colorful flowers he sells.

BilA. is a man with a good reputation. Most of his friends enjoy dealing with him and are proud of his friendship.

BilA. also wants to do necessary construction on his own house which he is building to be ready when he can think of getting married in the future.

loans.use: To increase his capital for flowers for the Holy Ramadan celebration.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 56 years old and married. She is from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She has only one adult-aged child. She is raising bananas to make a living. She sells ripe bananas in the market to make money. Monthly earnings of PHP 4,000 are generated from this activity. She had this business for 15 years.

Earlier this year, Florencia joined GDMPC to have access to financial services. She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase manure and pay for weeding costs. She hopes to improve her production and sell her produce at a very good price. Florencia plans to buy a motorcycle for easy transport of goods.

loans.use: To purchase manure and pay for weeding costs.

loans.name: Mengel

texts.en:
Mengel is married with four children. Mengel is 35 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tampilisan,  Zamboanga del Norte.

Mengel sells snacks to earn a living and has this business for three years. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase ingredients for ice candy such as milk and two kilos of sugar.

Mengel has been a member of PMPC for more than a year. In the future, Mengel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for ice candy such as milk and two kilos of sugar.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 21 years old. She is now taking care of her one little angel. At an early age, Joan separated from her husband. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She owns and operates a retail store at home to make a living. Joan has now been running the business for two years. A total of PHP 3,000 is generated a month.
 
This year, 2011, Joan made the choice to join GDMPC to have easy access to financial services. Her first loan application at the cooperative is for PHP 5,000. The money is intended to purchase grocery items to sell. Joan has to sustain their livelihood much more now that she's the only one working for the family to keep going. Joan hopes to own a motorcycle soon to earn additional income.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in  Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has seven children, three of whom are in school.   Rebecca has a business selling sugar cane.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week.   

Rebecca sells her products in a market, retail. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bundles of sugar cane. She also generates additional income through working as a sweeper with the Kampala City council. The main business challenges for Rebecca include thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to   start growing sugar cane   and also to sell wholesale only.  

Rebecca lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bundles of sugar cane.

loans.name: Gerandia

texts.en:
Gerandia is a 49-year-old widowed woman. She has 3 adult dependents living with her in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is engaged in banana production to earn a living. Gerandia has been doing this for 15 years. With this kind of work,  she got the chance to send all her children to school. Approximately, she makes PHP 3,000 a month.

Earlier this year, Gerandia joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase young raised banana trees of a different type to plant. She hopes for a good production to gain more income. Gerandia plans to buy a motorcycle to transport goods easily.

loans.use: To purchase young raised banana trees of a different type to plant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost his business by buying stock like flour, sugar, oil, soap and many others.

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah, a married mother of five children who all attend school, lives in Uganda where she resides in a rented house with access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent. For the past seven years, Deborah has had a business selling green bananas. She works six days a week, retailing her products at the market.

Now requesting a loan of 500000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, Deborah faces the business challenges of thieves and transportation costs. Her goals include buying a plot of land, building a rental house, and purchasing a delivery van for transporting bananas.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en:
Jean Marie is a Rwandan rice farmer who is married and who has eight children. He has been a farmer for the past eight years, having learned rice farming from his parents. 

He will use the Kiva loan to help pay for labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and finally in harvesting activities. 

With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will increase his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Damien

texts.en:
Damien is a Rwandan rice farmer who is married and who has eight children. He has been a farmer for the past 27 years, learning rice farming from his parents. 

He will use this Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and finally for harvesting. 

With the profits from his farming he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will increase his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To suppor labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Aside from farming, Thelma engages in selling Avon products to earn additional income. She has operated this business for almost 15 years and usually earns a net profit of 9,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. She has utilized her income to pay the tuition fees and allowances of their four children. 

At the age of 59, she has seen all of her children finish their studies. She wants to continue managing the business to earn a living and save for their future. She is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy lotion, perfumes, roll on, face powder, jewelry, and shirts to sell in the village. 

In the future, Thelma aims to put up a general store in their house to display her products and sell fruits and vegetables. She believes that her strong determination will make it possible for her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy lotion, perfumes, roll on, face powder, jewelry, and shirts to sell in the village

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 23-year-old married mother of two. She is a dry fish vendor, a business that has been in operation for two years. 

She is a KADET client and this is her third loan to finance her business. With the money she plans to purchase more fish for selling. She hopes to use the profit from her sales to repay her loan and to also support her family. 

Her hope is to expand her business and to be a good provider for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for selling

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is married and has five children. She is 59 years old and lives in Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. 

Perla sells a variety of goods to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 2,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase more products for her general store. 

Perla has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, she hopes to have a brighter future with her children.

loans.use: to purchase more products for her general store

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia, a 48-year-old married woman, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where she has owned and operated a retail store to make a living for 10 years now. The store normally gives Virgilia a monthly income of PHP 3,000.

Having joined GDMPC this year to gain access to financial services, she has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional stocks of rice and animal feed to sell. When Virgilia saves enough money, she will buy an LCD television to watch during leisure times in order to keep updated on world events, real-life situations and weather conditions.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of rice and animal feed to sell.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is 27 years old. He is married with 2 school-aged dependents. The family lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is driving a two-wheeled motorcycle in his locality to make a living. Allan owns the said service and is very glad to earn 4,000 PHP a month.

Earlier this year, Allan joined GDMPC. His loan application of 5,000 PHP has been approved. The purpose of having the loan is to pay for the motorcycle renewal fee to resume his livelihood. Having it renewed, he can freely travel without being delayed by land transportation officers. Allan plans to acquire a motorcycle cab so there will be more chances of gaining enough for daily needs.

loans.use: to pay for the motorcycle renewal fee to resume his livelihood

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en:
Felicien is a Rwandan rice farmer who is married with 3 children. He has been a farmer for the past 8 years, and he learned rice farming from his parents.

He will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and lately in harvesting activities. With profits from his farming, Felicien wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Lourgen

texts.en:
Lourgen is 46 years old. She is married with 2 grown dependents. The family is living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Lourgen owns and operates a retail store at home to make additional income for the family. She has been running the store for 15 years. The store operations give her a montly income of 3,000 PHP.

Earllier this year, she became a member of GDMPC. She has applied a loan of 5,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase liquor supplies like Tanduay, San Miguel beer, etc. Lourgen plans that a portion of the income generated from this loan will be set aside to buy a new freezer for the store.

loans.use: To purchase liquor supplies like Tanduay, San Miguel beer, etc.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru:
Фируза ответственная и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и любящая мать 4 детей.  С детства она мечтала отрыт свой собственный бизнес, и всегда старалась в этом. Вот уже более 10 лет она занимается торговлей. Она начала этот бизнес с куплей продажей детской одежды, а постепенно перешла на продажу женской обуви. В бизнесе помогает её муж, и они дружно вместе работают. Фируза хотела бы расширить свой бизнес и  получить максимальной прибыли. С этой целью она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000$ США.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Firuza is a dependable and honest woman. She is married and is a loving mother of 4 children. Since her childhood she has dreamed to open her own store and has always worked towards that goal. And now, for more then 10 years she has been managing her own stall at the local market. She first started to sell children's clothes and slowly moved to sell women's shoes. Her husband helps her in her business and they work well together. Firuza would like to expand her business to maximize the income from it. For this purpose she is requesting a loan of 1000 USA dollars.

loans.use: to purchase of women's shoes for her store

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 32 years old, married and the father of one child, an infant. He and his family live in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where he has made a living for the last 10 years by providing transportation services on his motorcycle. He enjoys his work and is happy to provide it come rain or shine, and earns about PHP 4,000 a month. 

Earlier this year, Julius joined GDMPC as a way to improve his business and increase his income. He is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy tires and accessories that will allow him to earn a better living. If he can earn enough money, he would like to buy a television so that he can be better informed about what is happening in the world around him.

loans.use: To buy tires and accessories for a transportation business.

loans.name: Awatef

texts.en: Awatef is a 42 years old, single and has earned a living for the last 15 years by selling clothes. At the beginning, she had to struggle because it was illegal for women to work. She has fought to prove that women can work, be successful and do something other than raise children and be housewives. She has always insisted on making her own living and not depending on anyone to take care of her. She has received and repaid three previous loans from our organization and is applying for her fourth loan to buy new clothing which her customers use to celebrate the end of Ramadan. Her goal is to continue to be successful, open a new store and find new customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise customers wear to celebrate Eid, the end of Ramadan.

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil is 32 years old, single and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the last five years, he has earned a living by running a retail store out of his house. He earns about PHP 3,000 a month. Earlier this year, Ramil joined GDMPC as a way to improve his business. He is applying for this loan to buy more grocery items to sell to his customers. He plans to start saving so that he can buy a motorcycle, which will make it much easier for him to get around.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is 41 years old, single and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where she has earned a living for the last 10 years by running a retail store. She earns about PHP 3,000 a month, which allows her to meet her everyday expenses. Earlier this year, she joined GDMPC and is applying for her first loan, for PHP 5,000, to buy groceries and school and office supplies to sell to her customers. She hopes to earn enough money to renovate her house so that she has a better place to live in.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Susette

texts.en: Susette is 31 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel with her husband and three children. She earns about PHP 22,500 a month by selling a variety of snacks, and is applying for a loan to buy the ingredients she needs to make more of them to sell to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for the last five years, and would someday like to own and operate her own food stall.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make more snacks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hermilanda

texts.en:
Hermilanda, a farmer, is 69 years old and lives in Clarin in Misamis Occidental Province in the southern Philippines. She is married with six children.

Hermilanda has been a member of PMPC for two years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy lumber to complete construction on her house.

In the future, Hermilanda hopes to live a harmonious life.

loans.use: to buy lumber to complete construction on her house.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is 27 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Banigan, a part of Liloy in Zamboanga del Norte province in the Mindanao islands. Liezel has a newly-opened general store from which she earns 3,500 PHP monthly.

This year, Liezel became a member of PMPC. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her store. In the future, Liezel hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 45-year-old widow who lives in Clarin in Misamis Occidental Province in the Philippines. For the past twenty years she has sold snacks to the local community. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Earlier this year, Rosemarie became a GDMPC member. She has applied for a loan of 3,000 PHP from the cooperative to purchase more snack items to sell such as cheesecake, banana-cue (deep-fried bananas glazed with caramelized brown sugar), etc.

Rosemarie plans to use any profits to expand her business. She is planning to repair her house to create a more conducive place in which to work and live.

loans.use: to buy more snack items to sell such as cheesecake and banana-cue.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 48 years old, married and has six children. For the past five years she has raised and sold pigs.

This year Eva became a member of HSPFI. She has requested a loan of 11,500 PHP to buy pig feed. In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Amcha

texts.en:
Amcha is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of four children for whom she works hard to provide a good living. Amcha is a baker who makes saj bread, a traditional Lebanese bread cooked on a saj, much like an upside-down wok. It is also known as markouk, manakish or manaeesh bread. The dough, which is like a thin pastry, is topped with thyme, cheese or ground meat; some places use other ingredients to make it tasty and attractive.

Amcha used to work with her sister as partners, but her sister was getting too old for such hard work. Consequently, Amcha bought out her sister's part of the bakery and is now the sole owner.

Amcha's business increases during Ramadan. Once the daytime fast has been broken, most store owners open their shops for customers at night. People will eat at nighttime so they can fast during the day.

Amcha is an Al Majmoua client in good standing and has a good reputation. Her previous loans helped a lot in improving her social and financial situations. Amcha is now requesting a loan, her third from Al Majmoua, in order to decorate her bakery so as to attract customers. She hopes to maintain their loyalty.

loans.use: to decorate her bakery.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 46 years old, married and has three children. She lives in Zamora, a part of Aloran in Misamis Occidental Province in the Philippines.

For the past two years Elsa has raised pigs to earn a living. She has also been a member of PMPC for two years. She is requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase feed for her pigs.

In the future, Elisa hopes to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anvarshoh

texts.ru:
Анваршох четный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и любящий отец одного ребёнка.  Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур. Когда ему было 23 лет он начал выращивать картошку, морковь и лука и продолжает это. Таким путем он зарабатывает денег на содержание свою семью. Его жена помогает ему по посеву семена и переработки земли.  Он также занимается скотоводством. Анваршох хотел бы получит займ в размере 1100$ США для покупки скота, горюче смазочные материалы, минеральных удобрений и семена. Он заранее хочет, поблагодарит всех кредиторов за их поддержку и поощрение. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Anvarshoh is an honest and hardworking man. He is married and is a proud father of a child. Anvarshoh is a farmer and has been growing potatoes, carrots and onions since he was 23 years old. This is how he makes a living for his family. Anvarshoh's wife helps him to work the land and plant seeds. Both of them also raise cattle. Anvarshoh wold like to receive a loan of 1100 USA dollars to purchase more cattle as well as diesel fuel, fertilizer and seeds. He would like to thank in advance to all of his lenders for their support and encouragement!

loans.use: To purchase cattle, diesel fuel, fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen lives in Uganda. She is married with five children who all go to school. She takes care of additional family members (her sister). She owns a stall at the market selling fruits and vegetables at retail. Maureen has been in business for the last 20 years. She works seven days a week .She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of tomatoes, onions and cabbages. Her aspirations and goals are to educate her children up to university, own a delivery van to ease transport and to start growing tomatoes herself.  Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Maureen lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of tomatoes, onions and cabbages

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Clemencia has a rice farm that sells & harvest rice grains in due time. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,500 to buy fertilizers for the rice field. 

Clemencia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Clemencia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice field

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Nelia is working in her rice field where she harvests & sells rice grains. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice field.

Nelia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Nelia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice fields

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is a mother, and being a parent, it is her responsibility to send her children to school and prepare for their future. For almost nine years, Tessie has operated a sari-sari store, earning a net income of 6,000 PHP a month.

Due to financial difficulties, Tessie is aiming to improve her sari-sari store so as to increase her earnings to meet her family’s daily needs and to support the education of her daughter. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy beverages, candy, bread, soap, soft drinks and canned goods to sell in the village.

With her dedication to her work, Tessie believes that someday she can achieve her goals and make her dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell in the village.

loans.name: Qasem

texts.en:
Qasem is a 60-year-old man and married. He has six sons who work as Palestinian National Authority employees with decent salaries. Qasem wants to purchase seedlings to increase crop production, but he doesn't have enough money to pay for them so he is in need of a loan from FATEN in the  amount of $2,500.

When Qasem gets his FATEN loan (that is repaid easily on a monthly basis), he will purchase seedlings. After selling the crops his income will increase and that will lead to improving his work in agriculture and let the family have better living conditions. Qasem appears in the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural seedlings.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 42-year-old married mother of six children. For a year she has been a food kiosk owner.

Gladys is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES; this will be her second loan from KADET. With the money she plans to purchase more stocks of rice, flour and sugar for her kiosk. She hopes to use the profits from her sales to support her family and repay her loan.

Gladys’ hope is to expand her business and to have a wonderful, educated family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of rice, flour and sugar for her kiosk.

loans.name: Tuyoto

texts.en:
Tuyoto is 51 years old, married to Nateku and blessed with five children. For the last twenty years he has been a livestock trader, earning 10,830 KES a month.

Tuyoto was introduced to KADET through its staff. He is applying for his second loan from KADET of 70,000 KES, which he plans to use to purchase more livestock, including two cows, fifteen goats and other things. He will use his profits to buy a pick-up for transportation.

Tuyoto hopes to have a cattle ranch and sell the meat in Barma Market in Nairobi.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock, including two cows, fifteen goats and other things.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 42 years old and lives in the town of Bungohko in the Mbale region of Uganda.  He is married and has four children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Emmanuel has a small retail shop that sells hardware, which he has had for five years.         

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase hardware materials for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Emmanuel hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Emmanuel hopes to expand his business.  Emmanuel is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase hardware to sell

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda.  He is married and has four children. Three of his children are currently in school. George has a small retail shop that sells hardware items, which he has had for four years.         

To help expand his business, George has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase hardware materials for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, George hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, George hopes to expand his business.  George is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase hardware to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for making clothes for resale.

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en: Kassem is a 46-year-old married man who has worked painting homes and shops for 28 years. It is his only source for living and he works hard on keeping his customers very happy with his work in order to make sure that they will request him the next time. He is requesting a loan from A. Majmoua for the first time in order to buy new tools necessary for his business. He had a small accident in his car on his way to a place he had to paint, so he has to fix his car which transports him and his paint equipment to any place he gets a project. Kassem is a well-known man, an expert in his field, and most of his customers recommend him to each other. This is his high season so he has to stay ready to cover all his requests.

loans.use: To buy new, better tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory of socks, shirts, shorts,blouses

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru:
Гулшан умная, честная и добросовестная женщина. Она вдова и сама воспитывает троих детей. Она занимается купля продажей ювелирных изделий более 12 лет.  Данный бизнес она начинала с мизерной суммы денег. Гулшан одна воспитывает своих детей и ей трудно обеспечить их, и она всегда нуждается в поддержку.  Каждый день рано утро она уходит из дома и вечером вернется домой. Денег, которые она зарабатывает, хватает только на ежедневные расходы и ей хотелось бы получит займ в размере 5000 Сомони для покупки нового ассортимента ювелирных изделий, чтобы расширить свой бизнес и улучшить её жилищное условие.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Gulshan is a smart, honest and hardworking woman. She is a widow and is raising her three children alone. Gulshan has been reselling jewelry for the last 12 years and has started her business with a tiny amount of money, expanding slowly. She is raising her children on her own so it is hard for her to provide for them and she always needs support. Every morning Gulshan leaves home and comes back late at night. The money which she makes is only enough for day-to-day spending and it's hard for her to save for the future. For this reason Gulshan would like to take out a loan of 5000 Somoni to purchase more jewelry in bulk and expand her business, increasing her profits and improving the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new jewelry inventory for her store

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: A tricycle operator for almost seven years, Leonida, 60, did well enough to send her three children to school. She is a hard-working mother who endures the hardships of life for she  believes that her patience and sacrifices will bear good fruit someday. Now all her children are already graduated and employed. She wants to continue her business to earn and save for future emergencies. She is asking for a loan of P 10,000 to buy gasoline, wheels, and spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes that someday, her business will become more profitable to cope with all her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, wheels, and spare parts for her motorcycle transport business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goods (peanuts, soft drinks, rice, beer, etc.) for her shop.

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en: Norayr is 49 years old; he lives in Ddmashen village, Sevan area, with his wife and his son. Norayr’s son is now serving in the Armenian, and Norayr’s wife works as a nurse at an out-patient clinic. Norayr graduated from Yerevan Veterinary Institut and has worked as a veterinarian at his native village for about 25 years. Simultaneously with his work as a veterinarian he has been engaging in farming since 1992. Norayr’s wife helps him on farm and together they breed cows, sheep, and pigs. Norayr sells to Sevan market’s sellers, and thus keeps his family. This is Norayr’s second loan from Nor Horizon and he is asking for 600.000 AMD to buy 5 or 6 sheep, some piglets, and also fodder for his farm animals.

loans.use: To buy 5 or 6 sheep, some piglets, and animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell salon products (hair dyes, perfumes, and other hair products).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell products (peanuts, oil, rice, drinks and other items).

loans.name: Juan

texts.en: Juan is 30 years old. She is a married woman. She has four children, three of whom are in school. She has a business selling green vegetables in Kator in South Sudan. She has been running this business for five years. Juan requested this loan from BRAC South Sudan to purchase more green vegetables to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to expand her business and to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is 45 years married to Jane. He has been selling second-hand shoes for the last twelve years, making a monthly profit of KES.12,600. He has been loaned KES.10,000 with which he plans to buy ladies and men shoes to sell. With the anticipated profit, he plans to add more stock, and expand his business. In the near future he hopes to open a shoe shop.

loans.use: to  buy ladies and men shoes for sale

loans.name: Violeta

texts.pt:
Nasceu na Provincia de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, viuva e mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 15 a 28 anos de idade. Fez a 8ª classe e continua a frenquentar o curso noturno. vive na casa  dos serviços com a sua familia e sustenta mais duas netas enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nas despesas de casa.
Saiu de Gaza em missão de serviço, é enfermeira no posto medico do quartel militar ha mais de 34 anos e tem um salario de 9.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Ja fez emprestimo no BIM destinado a sua obra de construção da casa, o qual conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma colega que tambem é cliente e este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para sua obra  DE CONSTRUCAO DE CASA(areia, pedra, ferro,cimento, e outros ). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 11.000.00mt, 15.000.00mt, 20.000.00mt aplicados na habitação.  
Sonha em concluir a sua obra e sair da casa do estado, para oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Violeta was born in Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is widowed and has four children between the ages of 15 and 28. Violeta has finished eighth grade and continues to attend night school. She lives in military housing with her family and also supports two granddaughters by sending them money to help with household expenses.

She left Gaza on work assignment. She has been a nurse at the medical post for military headquarters for more than 34 years, and she earns 9,000 meticais per month. She uses this money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

Violeta got a loan from BIM to build her house, and she was able to pay it off without any problems. She learned about Hluvuku from a coworker who is also a customer, and this is Violeta's fourth Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 25,000 meticais to buy construction materials for building her house (sand, stone, iron, cement and other items). The earlier loans were for 11,000 meticais, 15,000 meticais and 20,000 meticais, and they were used for housing.

Violeta dreams of finishing her building project and leaving the state-provided housing so she can make her family more comfortable. To do this, she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her building project (sand, stone, iron, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Aivengo

texts.en:
Aivengo lives in the village of Natanebi, West Georgia. He is 65 years old and married. He lives with his wife Liana, 28-year-old son, daughter-in-law, and 4-year-old granddaughter.

Aivengo and Liana lead the agricultural business of the family. They have four milk cows and produce on average 80 kg of cheese per month to sell at a local open market. Along with the dairy, the income source of the family is tangerine and vegetable growing. They sell the harvested tangerines and vegetables locally. Average total income of the family is 900 Georgia Laris (GEL) per month. 

Aivengo requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and to treat his plants for parasites. At the end of the season, the family will get good harvest and sell it for a convenient price. Aivengo and Leila plan to reinvest part of the received profit in the agriculture and use the rest for financing daily family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and to treat his plants for parasites.

loans.name: Ilda

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Mafuiane, Distrito de Namaacha, Provincia de Maputo ao sul de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de idades entre 8 a 18 anos todos vaõ a Escola. Fez a 9ª classe e parou por falta de condinçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 3 enteados que vivem com ela.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, pratica agricultura ha mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimento de 35.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BCI).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos, Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma vizinha que também é cliente e este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende investir no agro-negocio (sementes, lavoura, adubos e outros). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 15.000.00mt,e 20.000.00mt tambem aplicados na agricultura.  
Sonha em concluir a sua obra e mobiliar para oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ilda was born in Mafuiane, Namaacha District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children between 8 and 18 years old; all the children go to school. Ilda finished ninth grade and quit school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and also supports three stepchildren who live with her.

She has never left Maputo. Ilda has been a farmer for more than ten years and has an income of 35,000 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BCI).

She has never had a loan from other banks. Ilda learned about Hluvuku through a neighbor who is also a customer, and this is her third Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 25,000 meticais to invest in her agro-business (seeds, ploughing, compost and other expenses). The previous loans were for 15,000 meticais and 20,000 meticais, and they were also used for agriculture.

Ilda's dream is to finish her house and furnish it so she can make her family more comfortable. To do this, she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to invest in her agro-business (seeds, ploughing, compost, etc.).

loans.name: Chale

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Beira, provincia de Sofala, centro de Moçambique, casado e pai de 6 filhos de idades entre 8 a 29 anos de idade 4 destes ainda vaõ a Escola. Fez a 6ª classe e parou por falta de condinçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a mãe, o irmão e 2 primos que vivem com ele.
Saiu de Sofala para Maputo a procura de emprego, é carpinteiro ha mais de 10 anos e tem um rendimento de 15.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que também é cliente e este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material PARA CONSTRUCAO DE UMA CASA PARA RESIDENCIA (areia, cimento, ferro, pedra, e outros.). Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 10.000.00mt, 10.500.00mt, e 13.000.00mt aplicados na habitação.  
Gostaria de concluir a sua obra e comprar um carro para ajudar a transportar o material para a sua carpintaria, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Chale was born in the city of Beira, Sofala Province in central Mozambique. He is married and has six children between 8 and 29 years old; four of them go to school. Chale finished sixth grade and quit school because of financial problems. He lives in his own house and supports his mother, his brother and two cousins who live with him.

He left Sofala to move to Maputo in search of a job. He has been a carpenter for more than ten years and has an income of 15,000 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (at BIM).

Chale has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer, and this is his fourth loan. He is asking Hluvuku for 20,000 meticais to buy materials FOR HOME CONSTRUCTION (sand, cement, iron, stone and other items). The first loans were for 10,000 meticais, 10,500 meticais, and 13,000 meticais and were for housing.

Chale would like to finish his house and buy a car to help transport materials for his carpentry work. To do so, he intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy materials (sand, cement, iron, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a 39-year-old married man and father of four children who are his whole life, as he describes them. 

Ibrahim opened a grocery store four years ago because he was very tired of his previous work, which was lifting things from place to another. He started to have back pain, so he decided to change his way of living and started a new business to help change his family's social and financial situation.

Ibrahim is a hard worker and is beloved by most of his neighbors. He dreams of opening a big supermarket in the future, where he can sell different kinds of goods to attract different customers coming in.

Ibrahim is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise for the holy month of Ramadan, and to do necessary maintenance and decoration in his shop to attract new customers.

He hopes he can provide his family with all the things they need and more, and to stay healthy to improve his life.

loans.use: To increase his merchandise for the holy month of Ramadan.

loans.name: Magret

texts.en: Margret is 39 years old. She has six children, all of whom are in school. She is a widow. She has been running this business for three years. Margret took a loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more onions and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Arshaluys

texts.en:
Arshaluys is 58 years old and lives in Vanadzor city. He is married and has a son who lives separately with his own family.

Arshaluys is a builder, but for the last seven years has been selling jewelry in a rented place in Vanadzor market. Arshaluys sells gold chains, rings, bracelets, and earrings that he buys from Yerevan two or three times a month.

Thanks to his occupation, Arshaluys funds his family. He says jewelry is in a popular demand on high days and holidays, and he is very glad that his merchandise is used for significant events, such as engagements, weddings, birthdays and christenings.

Arshaluys is requesting a $3,000 loan to buy some gold chains, rings, and bracelets for his business.

loans.use: To buy some gold chains, rings, and bracelets for his business.

loans.name: Horacio

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome ao sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos de idades entre 9 a 21 anos de idade. Fez a 9ª classe e parou por falta de condinçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 2 primos que vivem com ele.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, pratica agricultura ha mais de 18 anos e tem um rendimento de 10.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que também é cliente e este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende investir no seu agro-negocio (agricultura) para compra de sementes, adubos, fertelizantes e outros para aumentar o seu rendimento. Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 11.000.00mt, e 13.800.00mt,ambos para o agro- negocio.  
Sonha em comprar um trator para ampliar o seu negocio, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
