Horacio was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is married and has four children between 9 and 21 years old. He finished ninth grade and quit school because of financial problems. Horacio lives in his own house with his family and also supports two cousins who live with him.

He has never left Maputo. For more than 18 years he has worked in agriculture and has an income of 10,000 meticais per month. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account.

Horacio has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer, and this is his third Hluvuku loan. He is asking for 20,000 meticais, which he will invest in his agribusiness (agriculture) to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer and other items to increase his income. The first loans were for 11,000 meticais and 13,800 meticais, both for the agribusiness.

Horacio dreams of buying a tractor to expand his business. To do so, he intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to invest in his agribusiness (agriculture) to buy seeds, compost, fertilizer and other items.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is from the village Gvara, Kobuleti District, Seaside of Georgia. He is 41 years old and married. He lives with his wife Tea, 14-year-old son, and 7-year-old daughter. His children go to school.

David owns a small grocery shop in the village and works there. Tea leads the agricultural activities of the family. In particular, they have tangerine and nut trees and sell harvested products in the local open market. 

As it is now tourist season on the seaside, David has requested credit for increasing the assortment of the products in his store, in order to attract as many customers as possible. It will positively impact the family’s income. David and Tea will use the profit they receive to purchase new goods for their children, especially for the new season at school.

loans.use: to purchase products to increase the stock at his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell NATURAL/LOCALLY AVAILABLE construction materials (reeds, stakes, etc.).

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 32 years old, married, and not yet blessed with children. He runs a carpentry service, and has been in this business for the last five years. He earns a monthly income of  KES. 8,500.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member. He is applying for his third loan of KES.40,000 from KADET, which he plans to use to buy a circular saw, timber, and many other supplies. He will use the extra profit to open a big showroom for furniture at Mlolongo.

loans.use: To buy a circular saw and timber.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome ao sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 1 filho de 18 anos de idade e vai a escola. Fez a 7ª classe e parou para se dedicar ao negocio para melhorar as condicoes de vida. Vive a casa propria com o seu filho e sustenta mais 2 irmãos que vivem com ela.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, é negociante ambulante ha mais de 12 anos e tem um rendimento de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que também é cliente e este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende investir no seu negocio de compra e venda de carne. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 20.000.00mt, destinado a sua obra DE CONSTRUCAO DE UMA CASA.  
Sonha em concluir a sua obra, ampliar o seu negocio para obter mais lucros,e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Apolinaria was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is single and has an 18-year-old son who goes to school. She finished seventh grade and quit school to focus on her business and improve her living conditions. She lives in her own house with her son and supports two siblings who live with her.

Apolinaria has never left Maputo. She has been a traveling businessperson for more than 12 years and has an income of 5,000 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account (at BIM).

She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer, and this is her second Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 20,000 meticais, which she will invest in her business buying and selling meat. The first loan was for 20,000 meticais and was for home construction.

Apolinaria dreams of finishing her construction project and expanding her business to earn more profit. To do so, she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell beef.

loans.name: Akbar

texts.ru:
Акбар честный и добросовестный молодой муж. Поле окончание общеобразовательной школы он не смог поступит в ВУЗ и продолжить учебу по семейным обстоятельствам. Когда он был маленьким, его отец и дед занимались скотоводством, и он помогал им. Он научился данному бизнесу от своих предков и стал специалистом в этой сфере бизнеса. Более 4 лет он занимается скотоводством, чтобы зарабатывать на свою жизнь и у него дела идет хорошо. Данный бизнес является его единственным доходам, который он зарабатывает на содержание свою семью. Акбар хотел бы получит кредит в размере 1000$ США для покупки скота и расширение бизнеса. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Akbar is an honest and conscientious young husband. Due to his family situation he was not able to go to college after finishing (high) school. However, since he was little, his father and grandfather have been raising cattle and he has always helped them. Akbar has learned a lot from his family and is very knowledgeable in taking care of livestock. He has been taking care of his own herd for the last 4 years and his cattle sale business is doing well. The herd is also the sole source of income to support his own family and Akbar would like to take out a loan of 1000 US dollars to purchase more calves and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and sell beef.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 36 years old, married to Eunice but has no children yet. For the last five years he has been operating an electronics business and making a monthly profit of 19,500 KES.

This is John’s fourth loan from KADET. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES, which he plans to use to buy more plugs, chargers, batteries, fuses, etc.

With the anticipated profits, John plans to expand his business. In the near future he hopes to open a big electronics shop in the CBD (Central Business District).

loans.use: to buy more plugs, chargers, batteries, fuses, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for home construction (cement, blocks, iron, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Emmilia

texts.en: Emmilia is 30 years old. She has two children. One of her children is in school. She is married. She has been in this business for two years and she says that the extra income from this loan will help her too build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase more bread and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Tete ao norte de Moçambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 vão a escola. Fez a 3ª classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a  sua familia e sustenta o seu neto que vive com eles.
Saiu de Tete para Maputo a procura de emprego, é pensionista e pratica agricultura para consumo familiar a 20 anos e tem um rendimento de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria com ajuda da sua pensao.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que também é cliente e este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 21.500.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao DE CASA PARA HABITACAO (areia, cimento, blocos, ferro, pedra, e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 17.000.00mt aplicado tambem apara obra.   
Sonha em concluir a sua obra e abrir uma mini-mercearia, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Florinda was born in Tete Province in northern Mozambique. She is married and has four children; three of them go to school. Florinda finished third grade and quit school because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her grandson, who lives with them.

She left Tete to move to Maputo in search of a job. Florinda receives a pension and has farmed for her family's consumption for 20 years. She has an income of 5,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account with the help of her pension.

Florinda has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer, and this is Florinda's second Hluvuku loan. She is asking for 21,500 meticais to buy home construction materials (sand, cement, blocks, iron, stone and other items). The first loan was for 17,000 meticais and was also used for her house.

She dreams of finishing her house and opening a small grocery store. To do this, she intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy home construction materials (sand, cement, blocks, iron, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Lukia

texts.en:
Lukia lives in Uganda and is married with three children who all go to school. She lives in her own house which has piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include power and food.

For the last ten years Lukia has sold secondhand clothes from her home, working six days a week. Her major challenges include those of transportation and the ever-increasing price of clothes in Uganda.

Lukia has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. Her aspirations and goals are to start importing those bales from Dubai and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more bales of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
From Uganda, Rose is single with three children, all of whom go to school. She lives in a rental which has piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include rent, utility bills and food. Rose’s two major business challenges are transportation and the rainy season, which makes movement difficult.

Rose sells charcoal on a retail basis at the market, working six days a week. She has been in business for the last ten years. She is requesting a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goal is to start selling her charcoal on a wholesale basis.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Paulino

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Milange, provincia da Zambezia ao norte de Moçambique, casado e pai de 7 filhos dos quais todos são maiores de idade. Fez a 3ª classe e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a  sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu da Zambezia para Maputo no tempo da guerra, é pensionista do Ministerio da Defesa ha mais de 20 anos e recebe  4.115.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de um amigo que também é cliente e este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 21.500.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao DE CASA PARA HABITACAO (chapas, cimento, areia, ferro, pedra, e outros). O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 15.000.00mt,para mesma finalidade.   
Sonha em concluir a sua obra e mobiliar para oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Paulino was born in Milange, Zambezi province, in northern Mozambique.  He is married and has 7 children, 2 of whom are adults.  He completed school through the 3rd grade but had to drop out due to a lack of financial resources.  He owns the home where he lives with his family and he does not support anyone else.  

He left the Zambezi province for Maputo during the war.  He has been a pensioner of the Ministry of Defense for more than 20 years and receives 4.115.00mt per month which he uses for household expenses and savings in his bank account (BIM).

He has never had a loan in other banks.  He learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client.  This is his second loan with Hluvuku, for the amount of 21.500.00mt, which he will use to purchase construction materials to build a room in his home (metal panels, cement, sand, iron, stones, etc.).  The first loan was for 15.000.00mt, for the same purpose.

He dreams of finishing his home and furnishing it in order to make it more comfortable for his family.  He plans to ask Hluvuku for additional loans for this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a room in his home (metal panels, cement, sand, iron, stones, etc.)

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab, from the village of Tskaltsminda, Guria Region, is 37 years old and lives with his mother, elder brother and two children – a 17-year-old-daughter and 12-year-old son, both of whom go to school.

All adult family members are involved in family agricultural activities, growing tangerines, nut trees and various vegetables on their own plot of land. The harvested products are sold locally. In addition to the family business, Zurab also works for the village water supply entity, earning a salary of 400 Laris per month. Total average monthly income of the family comes to 600 Laris.

Zurab has requested a loan to start up a dairy business that will require purchasing a milk cow to start producing cheese which will be sold at the local market. The new business initiative will increase the income of the family and allow them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica, who lives in Uganda, is a married mother of four children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of her sister. Veronica lives in her own house that has access to neither piped water nor electricity. Veronica has been selling rice wholesale in a rented shop for less than a year, working seven days a week. She also does some sewing which brings in additional income.

Veronica has requested a loan of 1500000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of rice. Her goals are to start going to the town of of Jinja for rice and also to build rental houses. Veronica’s major business challenges are seasonality and the ever-increasing price of rice. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to repair machines and metalwork materials.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude lives in Uganda. She is single with two children, both go to school. She has one additional family member. Gertrude sells milk. She has been in business for the last 7 years and sells her product at the market. She works 6 days a week. She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more jerrycans of milk. 

Gertrude generates additional income through hiring out her motorcycle. Her goal and aspiration is to educate her children. Her major challenge is transportation and seasonality. She lives in her own house and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more jerrycans of milk

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Uganda. She is married with 6 children and 3 are in school. She owns a liquor store and sells from home on a wholesale basis. She has been in business for the last 20 years. She works 6 days a week. Teddy also operates a restaurant as an additional source of income. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy utensils for her restaurant and also to buy more jerrycans for her liquor store. 

Her goal and aspiration is to buy a plot of land. Her major challenges are transportation and defaulters. Teddy lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include water and electricity.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans for her liquor store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products for sale (peanuts, rice, cooking oil, flour, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.ru:
Курбон целеустремленный и честный человек. Он женат и любящий отец двух дочерей.  Он занимается купля продажей женской одежды и детской обуви.  Раньше он торговал канцелярские товары: ручки, карандаши, тетради и разноцветные бумаги для школьников. Потом постепенно перешел на этот вид бизнеса и  более 4 лет он занимается купля продажей женской одежды и детской обуви. Сегодняшний день Курбон хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. С этой целью Курбон запрашивает займ в размере 5000 Сомони. Он надеется что кредиторы будут поддерживать его. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Kurbon is an ambitious and honest man. He is married and is a loving father to his two daughters. Kurbon has a business selling women's clothes and children's shoes at the local market. In the past he has also sold office supplies: pens, pencils, notebooks and color paper for the school children. Then he slowly moved into clothing and has been selling women's clothes and children's shoes for the last 4 years. Currently Kurbon wants to expand his business and maximize his profits from it. For this purpose Kurbon would like to take out a loan of 5000 Somoni and he hopes KIVA lenders will support him.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in bulk

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome ao sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 5 filhos dos quais todos vão a escola. Fez a 4ª classe do antigo sistema e parou por falta de condiçoes financeiras. vive na casa propria com a  sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo, é negociante e pensionista ha mais de 20 anos e tem uma pensão de 2.200.00mt por mês e um rendimento do seu negocio de cerca de 4.000.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma vizinha que também é cliente e este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (cervejas, arroz, oleo, vinhos, refrescos, e outros ). O primeiro emprestimo foi de : 15.000.00mt, também para o negocio.  
Sonha em ampliar o seu negocio e concluir a sua obra, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Ana Maria was born in the city of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique.  She is single and has 5 children, all of whom attend school.  She completed school through the 4th grade under the old system but dropped out due to a lack of financial resources.  She owns the home where she lives with her family and she does not support anyone else.  

She has never lived anywhere other than Maputo.  She has her own business and has been a pensioner for more than 20 years.  She has a pension of 2.200.00mt per month and earns 4.000.00mt per month from her business.  She uses the money to cover household expenses and for savings in her bank account.  

She has never had a loan with another bank.  She learned about Hluvuku through a neighbor friend who is also a client.  This is her second loan with Hluvuku, in the amount of 20.000.00mt, which she will use to purchase products (beer, rice, cooking oil, wine, soft drinks, etc.)  The first loan was for 15.000.00mt, also for her business.  

She dreams of expanding her business and completing construction.  She intends to request additional loans from Hluvuku for this purpose.

loans.use: to purchase products for sale (beer, rice, cooking oil, wine, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista lives in Uganda. She is single with 4 children and all go to school. Teopista sells roasted maize from home on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 7 years and works 7 days a week. She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more fresh maize. 

Her goals are to build her own shop and also expand her business. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Teopista lives in a rented house. The family does not have access to piped water or electricity. Her monthly expenses are rent, medication and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fresh maize for roasting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials for a room in her home (cement, sand, stones, glass, etc.)

loans.name: Gloria

texts.pt:
Nasceu na provincia de Maputo, casada e mãe de 4 filhos de idades entre 2 a 14 anos de idade. Fez a 7ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. vive na casa propria no distrito de Boane com a  sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguem.
Nunca saiu de Maputo provincia, é negociante ha mais de 7 anos e tem um rendimento de 5.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum atravez do xitique (sistema tradicional de poupanca rotativa) e algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que também é cliente e este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 13.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos ( massa, oleo, arroz, feijão, açucar, e outros ).  
Sonha em concluir a sua casa e manter o bom ritmo do seu negocio, e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Gloria was born in the city of Maputo in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. She’s married and mother of 4 children between the ages of 2 and 14. She completed 7th grade and stopped due to a lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She has never left the Maputo province and has been a businesswoman for more than 7 years. She has an income of 5,000 meticals (MZN) a month which she spends on household expenses and saves through ‘xitique’ (traditional system of rotational savings) as well as in her bank account.

She’s never had loans from other banks. She heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client and this is her first loan with Hluvuku for the value of 13,000 MZN, with which she intends to buy products (pasta, oil, rice, beans, sugar and others).

She dreams of finishing her house and maintaining a good rhythm in her business, for which she intends to solicit more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase products (pasta, oil, rice, beans, sugar and others)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy materials for the construction work on the house in which she lives (sand, stone, blocks, iron, sheet materials and others).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy girls' dresses, ladies' wear, t-shirts, sweaters, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase materials for the construction work on the house in which he lives (sand, stone, blocks, iron, sheet materials and others

loans.name: Tohir

texts.ru:
Тохир образованный и трудолюбивый человек. Он женат и любящий отец 2 детей.  Тохир хочет, чтобы его дети выросли в хороших условиях жизни, и он старается обеспечить все нужды своих детей. Более 5 лет он занимается производством сахара.   Он перевозит сырьё и материалы из других районов и производит в своем цехе. Его цех находится в своем местном районе, и он единственный, который занимается в данном бизнесе. У него в цехе работают 3 человека и там современная оборудование, который производит сахар. Тохир хотел бы получит займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки оборудование. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Tohir is an educated and hardworking man. he is married and a proud father of two children. Tohir wants to provide the best living conditions for his kids and take care of all of their needs. He has been making sugar for the last 5 years. Tohir purchases raw materials (sugar beets) from the surrounding regions and converts them into sugar cubes in his own plant. His sugar plant is local and he is the only person with a sugar making business in the area. His plant employs 3 people and has modern sugar making equipment. Tohir wants to take out a loan of 3000 US dollars to purchase additional equipment for his plant.

loans.use: to purchase equipment

loans.name: Maria F

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Dsitrito e Manjacaze, Provincia de Gaza, sul de Mocambique, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos todos vao a Escola. Fez somente 4ª classe e nao continuou devido as dificuldades financeiras por parte dos progenitores. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a mãe que vive com ela.
Saiu de Manjacaze para Maputo a procura de melhores condicoes de vida, é negociante ha mais de 10 anos vende produtos diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 7.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Ja fez emprestimo numa cooperativa de credito (J.J.LS) e foi para o comercio o qual conseguiu pagar sem dificuldades. Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente e este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de13.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (amendoim, refrescos, arroz,cervejas, e outros ) para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 9.600.00mt e 15.000.00mt para a mesma finalidade. 
Pretende ampliar o seu negocio para obter mais lucros, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Maria was born in the District of Manjacaze, Province of Gaza in the south of Mozambique, is single and the mother of 4 children who all go to School. She completed 4th grade and did not continue her education due to her parents’ financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her mother who lives with her.

Maria left Manjacaze for Maputo looking for a better quality of life. She has been a merchant for more than 10 years and sells various products with an income of around 7,500 meticals (MZN) a month which she uses for household expenses and saves in her bank account.

She has already had a loan for her business from a credit cooperative (J.J.LS) which she paid back without difficulties. She learned of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client and this is her third loan from Hluvuku for the amount of 13,000 MZN, with which she intends to purchase products (peanuts, beverages, rice, beer and others) to increase her stock. Her previous loans were 9,600 MZN and 15,000 MZN and had the same purpose.

She intends to expand her business in order to obtain more profits and for this she plans to solicit more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase products for sale (peanuts, beverages, rice, beer and others).

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса родилась в 1952 г. в городе Капан. Она замужем и имеет двух сыновей: старшему 28 лет, младшему 27. Муж работает мастером в мебельном цехе. Старший сын Ларисы женат и живет отдельно, младший сын проживает в Российской Федерации.
С 2002 года Лариса занимается собственным бизнесом: продает женскую, мужскую одежду и обувь в арендованном торговое месте на Капанской городской ярмарке.  Лариса приобретает товары из Еревана один раз в месяц. Она работает  без выходных и по мере возможностей помогает мужу содержать семью.
Ларисе необходим кредит на сумму 300.000 драм для приобретения осенней одежды в преддверии начало нового студенческого учебного года.
Данный кредит является для Ларисы 9-ым по счету и она никогда не задерживала выплат по кредиту.
texts.en: Larisa G. was born in 1952 in the city of Kapan. She is married and has two children - the oldest is 28 years old and the youngest - 27. Her husband works as a master cabinet maker in the locale furniture factory. Larisa's older son is married and lives with his own family and the youngest son is working in Russia. Since 2002 Larisa has been managing her own business: she sells women's and men's shoes and clothes in a rented market stall at the Kapan's city market. Larisa travels to the capital city of Erevan once a month. She does not take weekends off and so helps her husband and her family's income. Larisa needs a loan of 300,000 dram to purchase clothing for the fall season in preparation for the starting college school year. This is Larisa's 9th loan with KIVA and she has never been late to pay back her debt.

loans.use: to purchase fall season young adult clothes for resale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade de Inhambane, provincia de mesmo nome, sul de Mocambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos ja crescidos, os 2 mais novos vao a Escola. Fez somente 8ª classe e nao continuou devido as dificuldades financeiras por parte dos progenitores. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e nao sustenta mais ninguem.
Saiu de Inhambane para Maputo a procura de emprego, actualmente é negociante ha mais de 10 anos vende produtos de primeira necessidade diversos e tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimo em outros bancos, conheceu Hluvuku atravez de um amigo comerciante que tambem é cliente desta instituicao. Este é o seu quarto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 15.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (feijao, farinha, amendoim, refrescos, arroz,cervejas, e outros ) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 8.000.00, 11.000.00 e 15.000.00mt todos aplicados no comercio. 
Pretende ampliar o seu negocio para obter mais lucros, sonha em comprar um mini-bus para transporte publico,  para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Francisco was born in the city of Inhambane, in the province of the same name in the south of Mozambique. He is married, the father of 4 children who are already grown up, the two youngest go to School. He completed 8th grade and did not continue his education due to his parents’ financial difficulties. He lives in his own house with his family and does not support anyone else.

Franciso left Inhambane for Maputo looking for work. He has currently been a merchant for more than 10 years and sells various essential products with an income of around 4,500 meticals (MZN) a month which he uses for household expenses and saves in his bank account.

He has never had loans from other banks and he learned of Hluvuku through a merchant friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his fourth loan with Hluvuku for the amount of 15,000 MZN, with which he intends to purchase products (beans, flour, peanuts, beverages, rice, beer and others) to increase his stock. His previous loans were for 8,000 MZN, 11,000 MZN and 15,000 MZN, all for his business.

He intends to expand his business in order to obtain more profits and he dreams of buying a mini-bus for public transport, for which he plans to solicit more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: purchase products for sale (beans, flour, peanuts, beverages, rice, beer and others)

loans.name: Virginia

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Boane, provincia de Maputo, sul de Mocambique, Viuva e maê de 8 filhos ja crescidos, um deles vai a Escola. Fez somente 4ª classe do antigo sistema e nao continuou porque na altura apenas havia esse nivel. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta 2 filhos que vivem com ela.
Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, trabalha como modista e activista da associacao KHINDLIMUKA ha mais de 8 anos onde tem um rendimento de cerca de 4.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Ja teve emprestimo em outros bancos, conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga da associacao que tambem é cliente desta instituicao. Este é o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao DE CASA PARA HABITACAO(pedra, cimento, areia, blocos e outros) para dar continuidade com a melhoria da sua casa. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 4.000.00, 10.000.00, 10.000.00 e 10.000.00mt aplicados para mesma finalidade. 
Pretende concluir a sua casa para oferecer melhor conforto a familia assim ira solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Virginia was born in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is widowed and has eight grown children; one of the children goes to school. Virginia only finished fourth grade in the old system and did not continue because at that time there was no higher grade. She lives in her own house with her family and supports two children who live with her.

She has never left her hometown. For more than eight years she has worked as a dressmaker and an activist for the Khindlimuka Association, and she earns around 4,500 meticais per month. She uses the money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account.

Virginia has had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend in the association who is also a customer of this institution. This is Virginia's fifth Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 10,000 meticais to buy home construction materials (stone, cement, sand, blocks and other items) to continue improving her house. The previous loans were for 4,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais, 10,000 meticais and 10,000 meticais. All were used for the same purpose.

Virginia intends to finish her house in order to make her family more comfortable, so she will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy home construction materials (stone, cement, sand, blocks, etc.).

loans.name: Margarida

texts.pt:
Nasceu na cidade da Matola , provincia de Maputo, sul de Mocambique, casada e mãe de 4 filhos todos a frequentar a Escola. Fez 10ª classe e naõ continuou devido a dificuldades financeiras. vive na casa propria com familiares e sustenta seis pais enviando algum valor para ajudar nas despesas de casa.
Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é negociante ha mais de 6 anos e vende produtos diversos. Não tem empregados e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo em outros bancos, conheceu Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituicao. Este é o seu primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 30.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar produtos (peixe, carne, arroz, farinha, oleo, refrescos, sumos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Pretende construir uma mercearia para melhorar a sua actividade comercial, assim ira solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Margarida was born in the city of Matola, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has four children; all of them attend school. Margarida finished tenth grade and did not continue because of financial problems. She lives in her own house with relatives and supports her parents by sending them some money to help with household expenses.

She has never left her hometown. For more than six years she has been a businesswoman selling various products. She has no employees and earns about 7,500 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. She also saves some money in her bank account (at BIM).

Margarida has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through a friend who is also a customer of this institution. This is Margarida's first Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 30,000 meticais to buy products (fish, meat, rice, flour, oil, soft drinks, juices and other items) in order to increase her inventory.

She intends to build a grocery store in order to improve her business, so she will ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy and sell products (fish, meat, rice, flour, oil, soft drinks, juices, etc.).

loans.name: Mine

texts.en:
Mine Ayaş is married and has three children. Her oldest child is 18 years old and her youngest is 2 years old. She has been working as a tailor for a very long time. Mine is living in a big village so she started with sewing up baggy trousers for her village. These trousers are traditional clothing of Mine's village. After that, she wanted to improve herself and began to look for new jobs in the town. Later on, she found a new job but her sewing machine was inadequate for her and her capital was not enough for her to obtain a new sewing machine. Mine's sister-in-law encouraged her to apply to Maya because she had already applied and used her loan from Maya. As a result, Mine applied to Maya and took out her loan. Now she is very thankful to Maya because her job is going very well.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Volunteer

Mine Hanım evli ve üç çocuğu var. Çocuklarından en büyüğü 18 ve en küçüğü 2 yaşında. Mine Hanım terzileğe köyünün geleneksel kıyafeti olan şalvar dikme ile başlamış. İşlerini ilerletmek için şehirde iş araştırmaya başlamış ve bir fason dikiş işi bulmuş. Ancak kullandığı makine kara düzen çalışmaktaymış ve bu iş için yetersizmiş. Mine Hanım'ın sanayi tip bir makine kullanması gerekmiş ancak elindeki para bu makineyi almaya yetmemiş.Kazancı biriktirmeye yetmeyen Mine Hanım görümcesinin önerisiyle Maya'ya başvurmuş ve ilk kredisini almış. Şuanda işleri gayet iyi giden Mine Hanım Maya'ya çok teşekkürlerini iletiyor.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr:
Cliente de 43 ans célibataire avec 5 enfants dont l'age varie entre 7 a 24 ans, tous sont scolarises, dont 2 a l’université
Étant déjà a son  troisième cycle, elle a remboursée avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables durant les 2 premiers cycles, ses ventes ont beaucoup augmentées, a l'heure actuelle , elle a des recettes de 50.000 a 100.000frs par jour.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle va acheter des cartons de tomates, des boites de conserves de la macédoine, cartons de mais doux, des saucissons sec, des cartons de cassoulets. 
Elle a pour ambition d'ouvrir une boutique d'alimentation pour abandonner son étalage , puisque pendant les pluies , elle n'arrive pas a vendre, c'est pour cela qu'avec ses bénéfices elle a commencer a acheter des tôles , du ciment et a prendre a charge la scolarité de ses enfants
texts.en:
Forty-three years old and single with five children between the ages of seven and 24 who are all in school (two of whom are in college), this client is in her third loan cycle. She has successfully repaid her first two loans, and has saved a considerable amount. Her sales have increased greatly, and at present, her revenue is between 50,000 and 100,000 francs per day.
 
With this new loan, she will buy boxes of tomatoes, cans of fruit and vegetable salad, boxes of sweetcorn, dried sausages, and boxes of cassoulet [meat and bean stew]. 

She aims to open a food shop in place of her stall, since she cannot sell when it rains. It is for this reason that she has begun to use her earnings to buy sheet metal and cement, and why she has taken charge of her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy boxes of canned goods such as peeled tomatoes, fruit and vegetable salads, sweetcorn, and dried sausages.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy, a 36-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has three children, two sons and one daughter. Her husband is a bricklayer. Thuy runs a general store that sells a variety of basic goods and many kinds of rice to people in the local community. She started this business in 2007. 

Thuy requires a loan to purchase rice, animal feed, and a range of different products, including basic packaged foods and beverages, to stock her store. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes her business will run smoothly and she can earn additional income to support her children.

loans.use: to purchase basic packaged foods and beverages to stock her store

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother and sisters). Rose has a business of a retail shop where she sells her products. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Rose has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through a restaurant. 

The main business challenges for Rose include defaulters and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully-stocked shop and to sell wholesale only. Rose lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong, a 46-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and four children. Her husband is a bricklayer. Huong earns an income to support her family by operating a general store in front of her house. The products that Huong sells include detergent, shampoo, toothpaste, and snack foods. She has been running her store since 1998.

She requires a loan to purchase a greater variety of basic goods and common household products, such as beverages and snack foods, to stock her store and offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes that will permit her to earn more income and save money for family emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase basic products, such as beverages and snack foods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn to make banku to sell

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is 56 years old. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and six children; five sons and one daughter. Hai earns an income to support her family by running a shop in front of their house selling women's and children's clothes, beauty products and souvenirs. Hai began her business in 2001.

Hai would like to take a loan to expand her business by purchasing more clothes, cosmetics and souvenirs to provide better products for her customers. She believes that the loan will enable her to purchase better quality products at more competitive prices and increase the income that she earns from her business. She hopes that this, in turn, will enable her to better provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase women and children clothes, cosmetics and souvenir products.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a farmer. She retails in different types of secondhand bedsheets at Abura, which she has done for 14 years. Her marital responsibility towards her home is to assist her husband to pay school fees and utility bills. Abena will use the loan to purchase bails of secondhand bedsheets for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to build a shop.

loans.use: to purchase bails of secondhand bedsheets for resale

loans.name: Rosa Fidelina

texts.es: Rosa Fidelina D. cuarenta y siete años D. edad vive con su hijo D. 18 años en su casa. Ella se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad en una pequeña tiendita que ha logrado establecer en su hogar D. residencia. Ya tiene varios años D. contar con este negocio y es el que le ha permitido llevar el pan D. cada día a su hogar ya que no cuenta con otra fuente D. ingresos. Rosa es muy conocida en la zona y su tienda es muy visitada ya que los clientes la prefieren por ser un lugar donD. encuentran todo lo que buscan y porque Rosa siempre los atienD. con una sonrisa. Además tiene  la ventaja D. que no cuenta con mucha competencia en la zona. El sueño D. Rosa es comprar productos al por mayor para surtir su tienda y poder abastecer a mas clientes D. manera que estos siempre encuentren lo que buscas. Para esto ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar productos D. tienda como: granos básicos, golosinas, detergente, condimentos, pan dulce, aceite, y D. mas productos que permitan atraer a mas clientes. Con esto espera lograr su sueño y así tener acceso a una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Fidelina is 47 years old and lives at home with her 18-year-old son. She sells basic necessities from a small store located in her house. Rosa has been in business for several years and it has allowed her to proviD. for her daily household needs since she has no other source of income. She is well-known in the area and her store is frequented by customers who want to shop at a place where they can find everything. Rosa always welcomes her customers with a smile. In addition, she has the advantage of not having much competition in the area. Her dream is to buy products in bulk so that she can restock her store and supply more customers with what they need.

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral in order to buy products for her store such as basic grains, candy, detergents, condiments, sweet bread, oil, and other products that will help her attract more customers. With this she hopes to achieve her dream and be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, detergents, condiments, sweet bread, oil, and other products.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 55 years old. She is married and and lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband. They run a store in front of their house to sell a range of basic goods, foods, beverages and milk. 

Lien started her business in 2000 in order to generate a stable daily income for her family. She is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity and range of products such as confectionaries, milk and beverages for her business. She hopes that through the loan, her business will be able to attract more customers and generate a higher income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy confectionaries, milk and beverages as stock for her general store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy iron metals to produce a large quantity of hoes, cutlasses, and buckets for sale.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: The shop above is owned by Efua. She sells provisions such as toffees, biscuits, candles, macaroni, etc. She is married and has eight children. Her husband is a farmer. Efua assists her spouse in providing for the basic needs of their family. The loan will be used to acquire additional provisions for her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to acquire additional provisions for her shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 49 years old. She has six children, all of whom are in school. She is married. She has a business selling charcoal firewood in Kator in South Sudan. She has been running this business for four years. She can also earn income from selling beer. Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hope of expanding her business and building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 41-year-old married woman with one son. Her husband is a worker in a local company. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.

Phuong owns a restaurant that sells many kinds of dishes to customers in her community. Phuong has been involved in this business for six years. She would like to take out a loan to purchase more beverages and many kinds of seafood to sell to her customers. This will enable her to earn more money to cover the cost of her family's expenses, and to save capital to reinvest in her business. She hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase beverages and many kinds of seafood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Gai

texts.en:
Gai is a 51-year-old married woman with four children, two sons and two daughters. Her husband is a taxi driver. Gai lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Gai supports her family by earning an income raising and selling pigs, frogs, chickens and ducklings. She has done this since 2000. She would like to take out a loan to buy animal feed and more animals to increase the size of her business. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and cover the education costs of her children.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, chickens, ducklings, pigs and frogs for raising and selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plantains, red peppers and other food stuffs to meet the demands of her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, baking ingredients, and cocoa drink for resale

loans.name: Rosa Mirian

texts.es: Rosa Mirian resiD. en casa propia con su esposo y su hija. Ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta D. pupusas, plato típico D. este país, ya tiene muchos años D. dedicarse a este negocio y gracias  a Dios y su trabajo ha logrado mantenerlo activo. Su sueño es ver su negocio florecer en el cual muchas personas puedan llegar y deleitar sus ricas pupusas. Para esto necesita invertir en mayor cantidad D. insumos para poder tener una mayor oferta que le permita cubrir y satisfacer a una mayor demanda.  Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar los insumos necesarios que le permitan cumplir su sueño. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra D.: maíz, arroz, chicharon, queso, tomates, cebolla, repollo, etc. tiene plena confianza que logrará su objetivo y su vida y la D. su familia tendrán acceso a una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Rose Mirian lives in her own house with her husband and her daughter.  She makes and sells pupusas, a traditional dish of this country (pupusas are stuffed corn tortillas).  She has been working in this business for many years now, and thanks to God and her hard work, has managed to keep herself busy. 

Her dream is to see her business flourish, and become a place where many people can come and enjoy her delicious pupusas.  For this, she needs to buy a greater quantity of ingredients, to be able to have a larger supply, in order to meet and satisfy a larger demand. This is the reason she is applying to INTEGRAL for this loan; to buy the necessary ingredients that will permit her to fulfil her dream. She will use the loan to buy corn, rice, roast pork, cheese, tomatoes, onions, cabbage etc. 

She is fully confident that she will achieve her goal, and that both she and her family will have access to a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy corn, rice, roast pork, cheese, tomatoes, onion, cabbage etc.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en:
Oanh, a 30-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two daughters. Her husband works as a laborer in the local community. Oanh earns an income to support her family by selling many kinds of beads and hair pins in a market. She has been in this business for three years.

Oanh requires a loan to purchase a range of different products, including beads, pins, and assorted hair and beauty accessories, to provide for her customers. She hopes that will permit her to attract more customers, to earn more income, and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase women's beauty accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to procure more ceremonial cloths to sell.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.fr:
Client de 51 ans, marie et pers de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 18 et 22 ans, et tous vont a l’université.
Étant déjà au troisième cycle de prêts , il a rembourse avec succès et a eu a faire des épargnes considérables, ses recettes ont augmentes de 50.000frs a 120.000 frs par jour.
Avec ce nouveau prêt , c'est a la veille de la rentrée scolaire, il veut renforcer le stock de ses fournitures de bureau comme des cartons de cahiers, des stylos, lots des registres, des règles,des crayons, papiers rames et tous ce dont les clients ont besoin.

Tres ambitieux, il compte ouvrir une papeterie a l'avenir  pour soutenir les études de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This client is 51 years old, married, and is the father of four children who range in age from 18 to 22, all of whom are in college. Already in his third loan cycle, he has successfully repaid prior loans and has saved a considerable amount. His income has increased from 50,000 francs per day to 120,000 francs per day. 

With this new loan, on the eve of the beginning of the school year, he wants to increase his stock of office supplies, such as boxes of notebooks, pens, batches of record books, rulers, pencils, reams of paper, and everything his clients need. 

Being very ambitious, he plans to open a stationary store in the future to support his children's studies.

loans.use: to buy batches of notebooks, batches of record books, boxes of rulers, pencils, and pens

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua cooks banku, which is made from maize, and she serves it with fried fish and hot red pepper sauce in Abura. She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a farmer. As part of her responsibilities, she pays the school fees of her children. Her loan will be used to obtain fresh fish to fry and maize to cook. Her future plan for her business is to build a shop.

loans.use: to obtain fresh fish to fry and maize to cook.

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives with two children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Ngan and her husband support their family by running a shop to sell construction materials, such as water pipes, connecting tubes, screws, bricks, paint, and sanitation equipment. This business was started in 2002. Ngan intends to take a loan to invest capital in her business by purchasing a greater quantity and range of construction materials to stock in her store.

Ngan hopes that the loan will enable her to generate more income and to improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To buy construction and sanitation equipment, such as water pipes, to stock her store.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is a seamstress. People bring their cloth to her, choose a style from the catalog, and she sews items to suit their tastes. She wishes to also display some cloths and to buy other sewing materials in order to sew for her customers and later take the money from them. She is single. The loan will be used to acquire sewing materials. Her increased profits will be used to acquire electrical machines.

loans.use: to acquire sewing materials.

loans.name: Dolores Cruz

texts.es: Dolores Cruz de treinta y cinco años de edad habita en su casa con su esposo de 38 años y querida madre.  Ella se dedica  a la venta de lociones y prendas de vestir. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante en las principales zonas  donde ella habita. Trabaja duramente para sacar adelante a su familia y no se cansa de recorrer la zona ofreciendo sus productos con el objetivo de lograr vender toda su mercadería y llevar el pan de cada día a su familia. Es muy conocida en la zona y gracias a su carisma ha logrado establecer muchos clientes fijos que siempre solicitan sus productos ya que  cuenta con variedad y con precios accesibles. Su sueño es ver florecer su negocio,  abastecer a una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar sus niveles de venta y por lo tanto sus ingresos. Esto la ha hecho tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de lociones y prendas de vestir que le permitan lograr su objetivo y así poder aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dolores Cruz is thirty-five years old, and lives in her home with her ​​husband, aged 38, and beloved mother.  She sells lotions and clothing.  She makes her sales as a street vendor in the main areas where she lives.  She works hard to move her family ahead in life, and does not get tired of traversing the area offering her products, with the goal of selling all her merchandise and earning the daily bread for her family.   She is well known in the area. and thanks to her charisma she has many regular customers who always request her products because she provides variety and affordable prices. 

Her dream is to see her business flourish, and to stock up for increased demand that will allow improve her level of sales and therefore her income. This is why she has made the decision to apply for this loan through INTEGRAL, so as to buy a variety of lotions and clothing that will allow her to achieve her goal so she can aspire to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lotions and clothing.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is 35 years old. She is married with five children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling soft drinks like soda and cold water in Kator in South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business and building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more soda, cold water and beer to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh fish and corn for making banku.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Efua is married to a farmer and has seven children. She prepares "etew," the local name of banku, which is made from corn. The price of maize keeps increasing, and Efua wants to buy more bags to store to help her make enough profit from the sale of etew. The loan will be used to buy bags of maize.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en: Rosaline is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 40 years ago in Makeni city, Rosaline is married and has five children. Rosaline sells palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), salt, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), pepper, etc. She has been doing this business for many years now. Rosaline will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to expand her business; she will buy firewood, biscuits, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.use: to buy firewood, biscuits, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of pure alpaca wool in all its varieties to use in his weaving.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi sells provisions and polythene bags, amongst other items, in a shop in Abura. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a teacher. The loan will enable Naomi to purchase other types of polythene bags to meet the demands of her customers. She responsibly assists her spouse in paying utility bills. She anticipates saving money toward the university education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase other types of polythene bags to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Aida Del Carmen

texts.es: Aida del Carmen D. veinticinco años D. edad, resiD. con su esposo e hijo en casa familiar. DesD. hace mucho tiempo ella  y su esposo  poseen una panadería en la cual trabajan D. la mano para salir adelante. Aida se encarga D. la fabricación del pan dulce mientras que su esposo se encarga D. venderlo. Esta panadería es su principal fuente D. ingresos por lo tanto necesitan seguir manteniéndola activa por mucho más tiempo. Aida es muy conocida en la zona donD. resiD. y cuenta con mucha clientela  ya que siempre ofrece buenos precios, calidad y sobre todo variedad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora  la cual no pierD. oportunidad para hacer negocio. Con el fin D. ver florecer a un  mas su negocio ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra D. los insumos necesarios en la fabricación del pan, como: harina, levadura, azúcar, leche, bandejas, etc. D. esta manera espera lograr atraer a más clientes que le permitan aumentar su nivel D. ventas y D. ingresos para tener acceso a una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Aida del Carmen is twenty-five years old.  She lives with her husband and son in the family home. For a long time, she and her husband have owned a bakery where they work hand in hand to move forward in life.  Aida is responsible for making sweet breads while her husband is in charge of selling.  This bakery is their main source of income so they need to continue to keep it active for a long time.  

Aida is well known in the neighborhood where she lives, and can count on many clients as she always offers good prices, quality and above all variety.  She is an enterprising woman which misses no opportunity to do business.  With a view to seeing her business flourish further, she has decided to apply for this loan through INTEGRAL to invest in purchasing necessary supplies for the manufacture of bread such as flour, yeast, sugar, milk, trays, etc.   In this way she hopes to attract more customers, which will allow her to increase her level of sales and income to have access to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, milk, trays, etc.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells provisions such as toilet paper rolls, tins of milk, milo (malted milk), eggs, toffees, and canned tomatoes in Abura. She is married to a cocoa sprayer. The income she makes from her sales is used to help take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions to supply her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more provisions to supply her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy powdered cassava, fish, meat, and other ingredients to cook for sale.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 38-year-old married woman. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City with two children and her husband. Her husband works in a business that sells video tapes and discs.  

Mai has owned a clothing store that sells shirts and blouses for women and children for nearly five years. She would like to take a loan to expand her business by buying a greater range of clothing to sell to her customers in the local community. 

She hopes that with a greater range of products, she will be able to attract more customers to her store and earn more money to cover her family's living expenses.

loans.use: To expand her business by buying a greater range of clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire other kinds of powdered soap to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Rosario De Fátima

texts.es: Rosario de Fátima de cincuenta y seis años de edad, reside en su casa con su hija y dos nietos. Rosario ha hecho de su casa un negocio. Ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ricas pupusas que día a día ofrece a sus clientes con mucho entusiasmo. Rosario es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y dedicada en su negocio. Muchas personas la conocen y dan referencia de ella y da las deliciosas pupusas que ofrece. Para Rosario lo más importante son los clientes, por lo que se preocupa en atenderlos de la mejor manera posible esto ha hecho que muchas personas la prefieran ya que siempre tiene una sonrisa y mucho entusiasmo para atender su negocio. Desea ampliar la capacidad de su negocio de tal manera que pueda cubrir una mayor demanda. Para esto necesita invertir en mayor cantidad de insumos que le permitan lograr su objetivo. Esto la ha hecho tomar la decisión de solicitar a INTEGRAL este crédito para comprar los insumos necesarios como: maíz, arroz, queso, frijoles, tomates, repollo, etc. con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosario de Fátima is fifty-six years old, and lives in her house with her ​​daughter and two grandchildren.  Rosario has created her business from her home. She works preparing and selling rich pupusas (stuffed tortillas), that she offers daily to her customers with great enthusiasm. 

Rosario is an enterprising woman, hardworking and dedicated to her business.  Many people know her and recommend her and her delicious pupusas. For Rosario, the most important thing is her customers, which is why she focuses on attending to them in the best way possible.  This has caused many people to prefer her, because she always has a smile and great enthusiasm for tending to her business.  

She wants to expand the capacity of her business so she can meet increased demand.  For this she needs to invest in more ingredients that will allow her to achieve her goal.  This is why she has made the decision to request the loan through INTEGRAL, so as to buy the necessary ingredients such as corn, rice, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc., in order to increase her sales and income which will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, cheese, beans, tomatoes, cabbage, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 30 years old and married with six children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling green vegetables and tomatoes in Kator in South Sudan. She has been running this business for three years. Mary took a loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business and building a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more green vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes to resell.

loans.name: Noel Nestor

texts.fr:
Client de 48 célibataire  et père de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 6 ans et 18 ans, Ayant déjà bénéficié de plusieurs prêts de Hope , il est aujourd'hui a son troisième cycle de prêt, ses ventes ont augmentes de 80.000 a 120.000 frs par jour, il a eu a faire des épargnes considérables et a rembourser sans difficultés , et avec ses bénéfices , il est entrain d’élargir son activité du jour au jour.

Avec ce troisième prêt il va acheter des  tuyaux PVC, des câbles et fils électriques, des ampoules, des robinets,vices, pointes et tous ce dont ses clients ont besoin.
Il tient a atteindre son objectif celui d'ouvrir une quincaillerie et aller en Afrique de l'est et en Asie pour s'approvisionner
texts.en:
Our client, aged 48, is unmarried and the father of four children who range in age from 6 to 18. Having already benefited from several HOPE loans, he is now on his third loan cycle. His sales have increased from 80,000 to 120,000 francs per day. He has saved a considerable amount of money and has repaid without difficulties. With his profits, he is in the process of expanding his business from day to day. 

With this third loan, he is going to buy PVC pipes, cables, electrical wires, light bulbs, faucets, screws, sparkplugs, and anything his customers need. He is intent on achieving his goal of opening a hardware store and going to East Africa and to Asia for his supplies.

loans.use: To buy PVC pipes, faucets, electronic equipment, light bulbs, and cables

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income by repairing  motorbikes for customers. 

Dung supports her family by earning an income selling food to people in her community. She started her food stall five years ago and she sells many kinds of dishes, especially dishes for breakfast such as chicken soup and noodles. She intends to take out a loan to begin a second business supplying cooking gas to people in her community. With the loan she intends to buy a supply of gas cylinders to sell in the community and then provide a service replacing and refilling the cylinders as required.  

She hopes that through the loan she can earn more money with her new business and can save enough money to ensure a good education for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy gas cylinders to resell to people in the local community.

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es: María del Rosario de cuarenta y ocho años de edad, reside en su casa con  cuatro hijas y dos hijos, cinco de los cuales se encuentran estudiando. María es un ejemplo de mujer y de madre ya que por mucho tiempo ha trabajado duramente para sacar adelante a su querida y numerosa familia. Ella posee un puesto en el Mercado Central de la zona donde habita en el cual vende pan dulce, pan francés y tortillas. María es muy conocida en la zona ya que es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable. Gracias a su carisma ha logrado ganarse a los clientes y cada día la demanda de rico e higiénico pan y tortillas es mayor. Ella sueña con dar a sus  hijos el estudio para que un día puedan valerse por sí mismos y puedan accesar a una mejor calidad de vida. Esta es la razón por la que sigue luchando para que su negocio sea el número uno y pueda seguir dándole los frutos para sacar adelante a su familia. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de pan, maíz, leña, etc. con el fin de tener variedad y cantidad de pan dulce, pan francés y tortillas; para que los clientes siempre encuentren lo que buscan y sigan prefiriéndola. Confía en Dios que los resultados serán positivos y logrará su objetivo.
texts.en: María del Rosario is 48 years old, and lives in her home with four daughters and two sons, five of whom are students.  María is a stand-out woman and mother, and has worked very hard for a long time to help her large family.  She has a stand in the central market in the area where she lives where she sells sweet bread, French bread, and tortillas.  María is well-known in the area as a hard-working and responsible woman.  Thanks to her charisma, she has built up a base of customers and the demand for tasty and hygienic bread and tortillas grows each day.  She dreams of giving her children the education they need so they can one day support themselves and attain a higher quality of life.  This is the reason she keeps fighting so that her business will be number one and she can keep giving her family what they need to get ahead.  This is what motivated her to ask for a loan from Integral to buy an assortment of bread, corn, firewood, etc., in order to have more variety and a greater quantity of sweet bread, French bread, and tortillas so that her customers always find what they are looking for and keep preferring her.  She trusts in God that everything will turn out well and she will meet her goals.

loans.use: to buy a variety of bread, corn, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a greater variety of food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Ismael Armando

texts.es: Ismael Armando de treinta años de edad vive con su madre y hermanos. El posee un taller de carpintería el cual es muy visitado por las personas del lugar pues su trabajo es de muy buena calidad, elabora mesas, sillones, y diferentes muebles con estilos al gusto del cliente además les ofrece un excelente servicio siempre satisface a la clientela; para Ismael lo más importante es el amor que le pones a tu trabajo y la dedicación es por eso que se decidió a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar madera de diferentes tipos y otros accesorios. Ismael Armando tiene la confianza de que su trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia una vida plena con seguridad económica.
texts.en:
Ismael Armando is 30, and lives with his mother and siblings.  He has a carpentry workshop that is much visited by local people since his work is of very good quality. He makes tables, chairs, and custom-made furniture.  He gives excellent service, and always satisfies his customers. 

For Ismael, the most important thing is the love and dedication he puts into his work. That's why he decided to apply to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy different types of wood, and other materials. 

Ismael Armando is confident that his work will allow him to give his family a full life, with financial security.

loans.use: To buy wood and other materials.

loans.name: Muoi

texts.en:
43-year-old Muoi lives with her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. The couple have two children, one son and one daughter. Her husband works as a labourer for a rubber production factory. 

Muoi has tried to support her family by selling food for lunch on her street for 12 years. This work provides her and her family with a daily income to meet the family's basic living expenses.

Muoi would like to take out a loan to expand her business by purchasing a larger quantity of food to sell to her customers and by buying new furniture for her stall. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family and save for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy food and new furniture for her stall.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is 53 years old and married with five children, two sons and three daughters. Her husband is a driver. 

Thu established a stall to sell food in the local community ten years ago. She plans to get a loan partly to invest capital in her business by purchasing more food and partly to buy new furniture for the stall to better serve her customers. 

She hopes that the loan will assist her to earn more income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy food and furniture for the stall.

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es: Ana Daysi D. treinta y cuatro años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos, en una zona D. mucho trafico D. personas. Ella tiene una venta D. comida rápida, tortas, tacos, hamburguesas, emparedados, entre otros. Todos con un sabor inigualable, su comedor  es muy conocido en la zona pues es higiénico con comida D. calidad y a precios accesibles; Ana está llena D. ilusiones, para ella trabajar por sus sueños es lo que hace su vida más interesante, quiere ver crecer su negocio es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, carnes, verduras, bebidas, embutidos entre otros. Ana Daysi tiene fe que con su esfuerzo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Ana Daysi is thirty four years old. She lives with her life's companion and their children in a highly trafficked area. She sells fast food such as sandwiches, tacos, hamburgers, cakes and more. All of them are unsurpassed and her restaurant is well known in the area for being clean and having accessible prices. Ana has a lot of dreams. For her, working for her dreams is what makes life interesting. She wants to see her business grow and that is why she asked INTEGRAL for a loan. This will allow her to buy basic grains, meat, vegetables, beverages and cold cuts, among others. Ana Daysi has faith that with hard work she will be able to give her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, vegetables, beverages and cold cuts.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 43 and singL.. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.  

Lan has been earning a living by operating a general store from the door of her house for the past ten years. She sells a variety of basic goods, such as sugar, confectioneries, beverages, milk and basic household necessities. 

Lan would like to borrow money to expand her business by buying more products in bulk. She hopes that this will enabL. her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy more general goods and basic household necessities to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en:
Minh is a 43-year-old woman and lives with her three children in Ho Chi Minh City.
