Minh has been earning a living by operating a general store from the door of her house for the past three years. She sells a variety of basic goods, such as sugar, stationery, and basic household necessities. 

Minh would like to borrow money to buy a greater variety of products to sell and hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sugar, stationery, and basic household necessities to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beans, rice, corn, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 57-year-old married woman with a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

For the past three years, Nga has been making an income to support her family by selling soft drinks, drinking water, confectionery, eggs and basic household items. She would like to take out a loan to buy more of these items to sell to her customers and to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to earn more money to cover the cost of her family's expenses. 

Nga hopes that in the future she can save more money to improve her family's living conditions and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, food and basic goods to sell.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy and her family live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is 50 and has two daughters. Her husband works as a bricklayer.  

Thuy has been earning a living by operating a general store from the door of their house for the past three years. She sells a variety of goods, such as sugar, confectionery, soft drinks and basic household necessities. 

She would like to borrow money to expand her business by purchasing a greater variety of basic goods, foods and beverages to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy confectionery, food, beverages and basic household necessities to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Immer

texts.es: Immer de treinta y tres años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y su hija. El posee una tienda con la cual obtiene los recursos para sostener su hogar, últimamente se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues Don Immer siempre tiene lo que las personas necesitan, productos de buena calidad y por supuesto a un buen precio; el esfuerzo y coraje en el trabajo son la clave del éxito para Immer, es por eso que está decidido a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar golosinas, bebidas, carnes, embutidos, cereales entre otros al por mayor y así poder maniobrar mayor margen de ganancia y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y al mismo tiempo tendrá la oportunidad de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Immer, 33, lives with his life partner and their daughter.  He has a store where he earns resources to support his home.  Lately, Immer has acquired quite a few customers because he always has what they need; good quality products at, of course, good prices.  Effort and passion for work are keys to Immer’s success.  

This is why he’s decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for him to buy snacks, beverages, meats, cured meats and cereals, among others, at wholesale so that he can manage a larger profit margin and meet customer demand while at the same time providing his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages, meats, cured meats, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Antel

texts.en:
Antel is a 32-year-old married man with four children living in his own house in Kamwenge, Uganda. The responsibility to look after his family rests on him and his dream is to educate his children to higher levels of learning. 

Antel has been running a retail shop for six years and with the income generated he has been able to meet the needs of his family. His major challenge is his customers' unsettled debts. His dream is to have a wholesale shop and also diversify into phone accessories and charging.

Antel needs the loan to buy a solar panel for charging phones.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel for charging phones.

loans.name: Asiki

texts.en:
Asiki is 35 years old and married with three children and with no other dependents, living in a permanent house which he owns in Masindi, Uganda. His family goal is to start a business for his wife to add on to the family income and educate his children up to university. He deals in taxi transport and he has been in the business for 12 years. 

Asiki started by driving someone's taxi and later bought his own through loan borrowing. Hardships met in the business are bad roads that lead to break-downs and high fuel prices. In spite of these, he longs to own four taxis.

Asiki intends to use the loan facility to add on his savings and purchase a taxi.

loans.use: To  add on his savings  and purchase a taxi.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 46-year-old married man with four children. To earn a living, he operates a retail shop. He has been in the business for 11 years. He has managed to retain his business through the financial support of Faulu Kenya. Frederick also farms to supplement his family’s income.

Fredrick hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future. He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy rice, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa es D. la zona D. San Lorenzo, está integrado por 17 mujeres, todas ellas son muy unidas y trabajadoras. Se unieron con un objetivo en común, que es el D. procurar mayores ingresos para cada uno, además D. eso desean fomentar en crecimiento D. cada una D. las miembros por medio del trabajo y la mutua cooperación.
La Señora Nila tiene una heladería, por medio D. este trabajo ella pueD. solventar los gastos que día a día surgen en el hogar. Hace ya unos años que se dedica a esta profesión por lo que tiene ya una clientela bien definida. Tiene siempre mucha demanda. Uno D. sus sueños es poder ampliar su local para ofrecer más comodidad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. distintas variedades D. helados, con lo que satisfará la demanda D. su clientela. Ella está muy agradecida a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Guapa” committee is from the San Lorenzo zone; it has 17 women members who are all very united and hardworking.  They joined together with a common goal: to obtain higher income for each one of them.  In addition to that, they want to encourage each one of the members through work and mutual cooperation.

Nila has an ice-cream shop.  She’s able to meet daily household expenses through this business.  She’s been in this occupation for several years now and has a well-defined base of regular customers.  She has high demand.  One of her dreams is to be able to expand her locale to proviD. increased comfort for her customers.

She asks for the loan to buy assorted ice-cream treats to meet customer demand.  She is very grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it provides her.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream to resell.

loans.name: Harison

texts.en:
Harison is 43 years old, married and a father of four. For ten years, he has been tailoring to earn a living. He has employed three people to assist him in the business. Previously, he was employed. He also does farming for more income generation.  

Harison has witnessed a lot of growth in his business, through the financial support from Faulu Kenya. Now, he hopes to expand his business further. He needs 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en: Alfred is 40 years old, married, and has 3 children. He lives in his own house in Masindi Uganda. Alfred's dream is to educate his children up to university level. He operates a pub and he has been in the same business for 14 years. He started the business with 1 pub, selling local brew (waragi) but now has four outlets dealing in beers and sodas. His hardship in business is high fuel prices, since he uses a generator. His dream is to own a bar. The purpose of the loan facility is to buy crates of sodas and beers to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of sodas and beers to sell.

loans.name: Gorrette

texts.en: Gorette is a 38 year old single lady. She has one child and is living in a rented house in Fort Portal Uganda. Her dream is to buy land and construct her own permanent home. Gorette runs a drug shop and has been doing so for the last seven years. Her major challenge is delayed debt settlement. This has made her run short of capital for restocking. Her dream is to operate a pharmancy. Gorette needs the loan to buy drugs to resell.

loans.use: to buy drugs for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 2 bales of school uniforms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and sugar.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 27-year-old business man. He sells mobile-phone accessories to earn a living. He also sells clothes for more income generation. He has been running his business for two years. Previously, he was operating a grocery shop.  

Daniel dreams of expanding his business in order to attract more customers. He has requested a loan for 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es: Socorro, D. cincuenta y cinco años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida. Ella posee una tienda D. artículos D. primera necesidad la cual es muy visitada por las personas del lugar, pues la zona es muy concurrida, últimamente ha tenido más demanda por parte D. sus clientes ya que ella siempre tiene lo que ellos necesitan y a un buen precio, además les da un excelente servicio; para Socorro la alegría en su trabajo y la dedicación son la clave del éxito es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, sopas, cereales, condimentos entre otros y así incrementar la variedad D. sus productos e inventario. Socorro tiene la confianza D. que su duro trabajo le dará la oportunidad D. darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Socorro, 55, lives with her life partner.  She has a grocery store that is quite popular with local residents because the area is very crowded.  Customer demand has grown lately because she always has what they are looking for at good prices.  Besides, she gives them excellent service.  For Socorro, joy in working and dedication are keys to her success.  

Because of this, she’s asking INTEGRAL for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy basic grains, snacks, soups, cereals and condiments, among others, to increase stock variety and inventory.  Socorro trusts that her hard work will allow her to proviD. her family with better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, soups, cereals and condiments.

loans.name: Leandre Martin

texts.fr:
Client de 50 ans, marie et père de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 17 ans, il  commence son activité  il y'a bientôt 23 ans avec l'alimentation ,durant les deux premiers cycle il a investi pour l'alimentation maintenant avec ce troisième  prêt ,  il élargit son activité  en ouvrant une boutique  des vêtements de friperie et de chaussures en cuir  pour enfants et adultes.
Ses ventes ont vraiment augmentes de 20.000frs a 100.000frs,il a une forte clientèle, sa stratégie est de vendre a credit et au comptant pour vite écouler sa marchandise .

Il est très ambitieux, sa vision est d'avoir une grande boutique pour faire de grands bénéfices pour subvenir aux études de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This customer is 50 years old, married and a father of four children aged 3 to 17. He started his business almost 23 years ago selling food products. His first two loan cycles were invested in food, but with this third loan he wants to extend his activities by opening a shop of second-hand clothes and leather shoes for children and adults.
His sales have really gone up from 20,000 XAF to 100,000 XAF. He has many customers, his strategy being to sell cash or credit to quickly turn over his merchandise.
He is very ambitious and his vision is to have a large store to make large profits and to support his children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy bundles of second-hand shirts, pants and leather shoes.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 49 years old and blessed with four children. For eleven years, she has been operating a cafeteria. She was previously employed, before she went into the business. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to manage her business. This is because she has been trained in business management skills.

Margaret dreams of owning a big hotel in the future. She needs 30,000 Kenya shillings to expand her business premises.

loans.use: to expand her business premise.

loans.name: Tindyebwa

texts.en: Tindyebwa is a thirty-eight year old married man with a child, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family rests on him and his desire is to educate his child. He has been selling cassava to the nieghbouring districts for seven years. With the proceeds, he has been able to maintain his family. He has challenges of limited funds to meet the high demands. His desire is to own outlets in the different districts. Tindyebwa needs the loan to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his child.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet lives in Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, three of whom are in school. Annet has a business of a liquor store. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Annet sells her products from home, by means of retail. Annet has requested a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use these funds to buy more jerrycans of local gin. She also generates additional income through a restaurant. The main business challenge(s) for Annet include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business include expanding to the districts of Kasese for Local Gin. Annet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more jerrycans of local gin.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 26 year old man renting a 2-roomed house in Masindi, Uganda. He has a dream of building his own house for business and residential purposes. Robert sells new shoes and he has been in the business for 3 years. He started by working for someone for earned income, which enabled him to start his own business. Hardships in the business are high costs of transporting new stock to his shop. His dream is to set up a boutique.The purpose for the loan facility is to buy more attractive shoes, especially for ladies.

loans.use: to buy more attractive shoes, especially for ladies.

loans.name: Porvenir Group

texts.es:
El comité Porvenir es D. la ciudad D. San Lorenzo, ellas son señoras muy luchadoras y unidas, que trabajan por la obtención D. mayores ingresos para sus familias, para que D. esa forma puedan tener una vida digna y decorosa. Actualmente el comité se halla conformado por 17 mujeres, quienes trabajan en un ambiente D. respeto y mutua cooperación.
La Señora Maria se dedica a las ventas desD. hace ya mucho tiempo, venD. todo tipo D. artículos, como ser frazadas, cubiertos, abrigos, zapatos y demás. Gracias a su trabajo pueD. sobrellevar los gastos D. la casa y también pueD. darle una vida mejor a sus familiares quienes D. ella dependen. Comenta que uno D. sus mayores sueños es poder abrir un local propio donD. pueda ofrecer sus productos a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. frazadas, zapatos, abrigos y demás con lo que podrá abastecerse y así satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
The "Porvenir" (Future) group is in the city of San Lorenzo. They are a group of very determined and united women, working to earn more income for their families, so that they can have a decent and dignified life.  Currently, the group is maD. up of 17 women, who work in an atmosphere of respect and mutual cooperation. 

Maria has been working in retail sales for many years now. She sells all types of articles such as blankets, cutlery, coats, shoes, and other items. Thanks to her hard work, she is able to meet household expenses, and also give a decent life to her family members who depend on her.

She says that one of her greatest dreams us to be able to open her own store, where she can sell her products. She is applying for a loan to stock up on blankets, shoes, jackets, and other things. In this way, she can satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: compra de zapatos, sabanas, frazadas y demás para la posterior venta.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo y sus hijos ya independientes, administra una cafetería y una venta D. hotdog,  negocios que surgieron por su propia iniciativa, trabaja todos los días y no tiene un horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
Ella nesecita un préstamo para la compra D. mercadería necesaria para la cafetería y la venta D. hotdog como lo son salchichas, aderesos, pan, cafe, gaseosas y jugos, esta compra le ayudara a aumentar el inventario del negocio y sus ingresos.
Su objetivo es poner varias ventas D. hotdog para ser una micro empresaria y mejorar sus ingresos para el bienestar D. su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and children who are now independent.  She runs a cafeteria and sells hotdogs.  The businesses arose through her own initiative.  She works every day and does not have a fixed schedule to take care of customers.

She needs a loan to buy needed merchandise for the cafeteria and hotdog sales like: sausages, dressings, bread, coffee, soft-drinks and juice.  This purchase will help her increase the business’ inventory and her income.

Her goal is to set up several hotdog stands and become a micro businesswoman and to improve her income for her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her café.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en: Milly lives in Uganda. She is single and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Milly has a business of selling used clothes. She has been in this business for 8 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Milly sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Milly has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO. She will use the loan funds to buy more bales of used clothes. The main business challenge(s) for Milly include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing clothes from Dubai. Milly lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 42 years old and married with three children.  He sells timber and plywood to earn a living.  He has been in the business for more than 10 years. He has managed to employ two people in his business.  He also owns a car, which he uses for his transport business.  In addition, he earns extra income from his rental houses.

Moses is grateful to Faulu Kenya because he has been able to boost his business.  He hopes to expand his business further.  He has requested 50,000 Kenya shillings to buy timber.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice lives in Uganda.  She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her in-laws).  Eunice  has a business selling used shoes. She has been in this business for eight years and she works seven days out of every week. Eunice sells her products at the market at retail. Eunice has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used shoes. The main business challenge(s) for Eunice include thieves and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing shoes from Dubai and to buy her own plot in order to build her own house. Eunice lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes

loans.name: Moise

texts.fr:
Client de 49 ans, marie et père de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 3 et 18 ans. Il y’a bientôt 7 ans qu’il s’est lancé dans la vente des produits divers et manufacturés pour prendre soin de sa famille.
Ses ventes journalières sont de 15.000frs a 30.000frs par jour., il s’approvisionne dans les grands magasins de la place et parfois il va a Kinshasa pour acheter de cartons de lait cowbell, sac de sucre, de l’huile des cartons de savon, des bidons d’huile et autres produits de première nécessité.  
A l’octroi de son prêt il va renforcer le stock de ses produits et élargir sa boutique.
Très entreprenant, il veut à la longue faire la vente en gros et la vente en détails des produits divers.
texts.en:
This client is 49 years old. He is married and the father of four children aged between 3 and 18. In order to support his family, he has been selling diverse manufactured goods for nearly 7 years.
His daily sales total between 15 000 - 30 000 francs. He gets his supplies from local department stores and occasionally travels to Kinshasa to buy cartons of Cowbell milk, bags of sugar, boxes of soap, cans of oil and other staple goods.
This loan will be used to replenish his stock and expand his store. A very enterprising man, the client´s long term plans include the wholesale and retail of a range of assorted products.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap, cans of oil, sacs of rice and cartons of milk

loans.name: Arlen Ydania

texts.es: Arlen Ydania comenzó su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general hace 8 años, ella es maestra de educación primaria con lo poco que tenia de su salario fue comprando ciertos productos a pesar que no eran muchos logro obtener clientes. La lucha constante y el empeño de querer salir adelante han hecho de arlen una futura empresaria. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de gorras, bolsos, calzados, manteles, cortinas, ropa interior y oro laminado.
texts.en: Arlen Ydania started her business, which is general merchandise sales, 8 years ago.  She is an elementary school teacher and used what little was left from her salary to gradually buy certain products.  Despite not having very many she still was able to acquire customers.  Constant struggle and her dedication to get ahead in life have turned Arlen into a future businesswoman.  Because of this, she’s asking for this loan to buy caps, purses, footwear, tablecloths, curtains, underwear and gold plated items.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes lives in Uganda. She is single and has three children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (parents). Agnes has a business of a pub.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she works seven days out of every week. Agnes sells her products from home at home at retail. Agnes has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and soda and jerycans of local brew and gin. The main business challenge(s) for Agnes include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked pub and to buy her own plot in order to build her own house. Agnes lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more beer, soda, local brew and local gIn

loans.name: Kabingo Womens Group

texts.en: Damazo is a 29-year-old married man with three children. He lives in his own semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda. His family's goal is to buy a motor vehicle in the next six years. He operates a retail shop and he has been in business for eight years now. The major constraint he encounters is the delayed debt settlements. His dream is to own a wholesale shop. Damazo needs the loan to buy boxes of washing soap to sell. Out of the 19  members in his group, only 17 took the loan; the other two guarantee them according to the group policy.

loans.use: To buy boxes of washing soap to sell

loans.name: Bibiane Judith

texts.fr:
Cliente de 29 ans, mariée avec 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre  18 mois et 7 ans. Compte tenu de sa charge familiale pour aider son mari à subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle se lance dans la vente de la friperie.
Elle achète des ballots de friperie, qu’elle vend dans un marché, ses revenus sont de 15.000 et 60.000 frs.
Avec le nouveau crédit  elle va acheter des ballots de pulls, jogging pour enfants, des maillots et des body…
Sa stratégie est de faire des prix abordables et satisfaire les gouts de sa clientèle.
Très entreprenante elle pense à la longue avec ses bénéfices, épargner pour ouvrir une boutique  d’habits.
texts.en: This client is 29 years old. She is married, with three children, between 18 months and 7 years of age. Faced with household expenses, she has launched a business selling used clothing in order to help her husband support the family. She buys bales of clothing and resells them at the market. Her receipts are between 15,000 and 60,000 francs. With this new loan, she will buy bales of pullovers, jogging outfits for children, tanks, bodysuits, etc. Her strategy is to offer affordable prices and to respond to the tastes of her customers. Very enterprising, in the long term she would like to save enough money to open a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy bales of pullovers, jogging outfits for children, tanks, bodysuits, etc

loans.name: Jorge Fausto

texts.es: Jorge Fausto tiene 57 años su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general, tiene un hijo menor de edad a su cargo la ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante la mayoría de sus clientes le realiza pedidos él se encarga de visitarlos y de entregarlos. Jorge viaja a Managua cuando tiene el dinero que ha obtenido de las ganancias ya que tiene ciertos lugares en donde le ofrecen ciertos productos de manera favorable. El crédito es para la compra de sabanas, pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos, cosméticos y calzados.
texts.en: Jorge Fausto, 57, sells general merchandise.  He has a minor in his care.  He’s a street vendor and most of his customers place orders with him and he then takes care of visiting them and make the deliveries.  Jorge travels to Managua when he has amassed money from profits because he knows certain places where he gets the best prices for particular items.  The loan is to buy sheets, pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, cosmetics and footwear.

loans.use: to buy sheets, pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, cosmetics and footwear.

loans.name: Sirida

texts.en: Sirida lives in Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (old parents).  Sirida has a business selling fish. She has been in this business for three years and she works 7 days out of every week. Sirida sells her products at the market, by means of retail. Sirida has requested  for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more  baskets of fish. The main business challenges for Sirida include transportation and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van to ease in transportation, to be a wholesaler of fish, and to buy a plot in order to build her own house. Sirida lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish

loans.name: Victor Sebastian

texts.es:
El señor Victor es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, es separado. Él se dedica a la distribucion de todos los periodicos del país, también tiene una empresa de transporte que transporta mercaderías. Se inicio en este rubro con un tío que tenia el negocio de distribución de mercaderías, con mucho esfuerzo logró independizarse y logró montar su propio negocio.
Él se define como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, ejemplo de su lucha es que, pese a las adversidades pudo independizarse y montar su propio negocio. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia y de todos quienes de él dependen.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para la reparación de los vehículos que son su elemento de trabajo. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda.
texts.en:
Víctor is from the city of San Lorenzo; he’s separated.  He’s a distributor of all the country’s newspapers and he also has a merchandise transportation firm.  He started in this line of work with an uncle who had a merchandise distribution business.  With much effort he was able to go off on his own and start his own business.

He defines himself as a hardworking, tenacious person.  An example of that struggle is that, despite adversities, he was able to become independent and start his own business.  He comments that everything he does is for the benefit of his family and of all those that depend on him.

He is asking for the loan to buy replacement parts to repair his vehicles which are his work tools.  He is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity it provides him.

loans.use: to buy vehicle replacement parts.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa tiene 56 años. Su actividad es una pulpería, su negocio lo inicio como una necesidad de obtener mayores ingresos, uno de los desafíos que maría atravesó fue cuando su esposa falleció y tuvo que salir sola con su esfuerzo. Ella tiene que levantarse temprano todos los días desde las siete de la mañana hasta las diez de la noche, sus sueños son mejorar su negocio y realizarle mejoras a su vivienda. El financiamiento es para la compra de golosina, granos básicos, sopas, detergente, leche y refrescos naturales.
texts.en: María Teresa, 56, has a grocery store.  She started the business because she needed to earn higher income.  One of the challenges María overcame was when her husband died she had to continue her efforts alone.  She has to rise very early every day.  She works from 7am until 10pm.  Her dreams are to improve the business and to do some home improvements.  The loan is to buy snacks, basic grains, soups, detergent, milk and natural beverages.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope lives in Uganda. She is single and has one child who is in school. She also takes care of additional family members (eight orphans from her late sister). Hope has a business selling local medicine.  She has been in this business for four years and she works seven days out of every week.  Hope sells her products door-to-door, by means of retail. Hope has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bottles and tins of powdered local medicine. The main business challenge(s) for Hope include defaulters and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to get a permanent business premise, to be a wholesaler and to buy a plot in order to build her own house. Hope lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bottles and tins of local medicine

loans.name: Hortense

texts.fr:
Cliente de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 3 et 11 ans, en 2008 ayant prit conscience de ses difficultés, elle ouvre une alimentation et une cave a vins importer, elle vend en moyenne 25.000 a 50.000frs par jour.
Avec ce prêt elle va acheter des cartons de savons, cartons de conserves, des bidons d’huile de d’arachide, cartons de lait Nido, le lait cowbell.   
Pour le futur , elle  veut être une femme d’affaire et avoir beaucoup plus d’argent  pour assurer l'avenir de son foyer.
texts.en:
Hortense is 31 years old, married and the mother of 3 children aged between 3 and 11. In 2008, having taken stock of her situation, she opened a grocery store with an imported wine cellar. Her daily sales total between 25 000 and 50 000 francs.
She will use this loan to buy more stock, including cartons of soap, canned food, cans of groundnut oil and cartons of Nido and Cowbell milk.
Ultimately, Hortense wants to become a successful businesswoman with the means to take care of her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of tomatoes, canned food, oil, sacs of rice and milk

loans.name: Leeya

texts.en: Leeya is a 49-year-old married woman with six children living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main dream is to construct a permanent house for her family and to educate her children to higher levels of learning. She operates a saloon, hires out chairs, provides catering services and is a farmer. She has a challenge of high operational costs involved in the other businesses and her dream is to specialize in farming. Leeya needs the loan to pay the laborers who are clearing land for the next season.

loans.use: To pay laborers to clear the land for the next season.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and all of them go to school. She has additional family members. She has a restaurant at  the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for the last 30 years. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bananas, beef, a sack of rice, and beans. Rose's aspiration and goal is to expand her business to serve more customers. Her major challenge is seasonality. Rose lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expense includes food and power.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, rice, beans and beef

loans.name: Vane

texts.fr:
Cliente de 27 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant âgé d’un an, en 2007, elle ouvre un stand  alimentation ou elle vend des produits alimentaires et divers tel que le riz ; le sucre, la farine, de l’huile, les pâtes alimentaires et le savons.
Ses ventes sont de 10.000 a 30.000 frs par jour, elle s’approvisionne dans les grands magasins de la place et choisit toujours les meilleurs produits pour ses clients.
Avec le prêt, elle va acheter des cartons de conserves, 3 cartons d’huile de table, 50kg de sacs de riz parfume, 3 cartons de savons de lessive et de toilettes.

A l’avenir elle compte élargir son activité construire une boutique en matériaux durable  et devenir grossiste a la fin.

Très accueillante tout le monde l’apprécie dans le marché ou elle vend.
texts.en:
The client is 27 years old, married and mother of a one year old child. In 2007 she opened a food stall where she sells products such as rice, sugar, flour, pasta and soap.
Her daily sales range from 10.000 to 30.000 frs. She gets her supplies from the big stores in town and always chooses the best products for her clients.
With this loan she is going to purchase boxes of canned food, 3 boxes of oil, 50kg of perfumed rice, 3 boxes of soap, washing liquid and toilet paper. 
In future she intends to grow her business, build a shop from durable materials and ultimately become a wholesaler.
She is very welcoming and is well liked by everyone in the market where she sells her goods.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of rice, 50L of oil and 5 boxes of canned food.

loans.name: Runyenge Gamba Nokora Group

texts.en: Crizensio is a Ugandan male aged 46 years who needs a loan to buy beans for planting. He hails from Kyenjojo district. He is a father of four children between 8 and 18 years old. He dreams of educating his children and becoming a large-scale farmer. He has been in the agricultural sector for 20 years and this has enabled him to provide the basics for his family. He is a member of Runyege Gamba Nokora group where each member guarantees the other to access a loan.

loans.use: To buy beans to plant

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en: Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children and all of her children go to school. She has one additional family member (sister). Robinah has a beauty salon. She has been in business for the last 12 years. She works seven days a week. Robinah provides her services on a retail basis in a shop. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of cosmetics for her customers and a hair dryer. Robinah’s goals and aspirations are to educate her children and own a fully stocked salon. Her major business challenges are defaulters and the ever-increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. Robinah lives in her own house and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses are rent and power.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics and a hair dryer

loans.name: G.s Don Tino Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Don Tino está conformado por Constantino y Reyna. Juntos han buscado la forma de salir adelante Constantino tiene su negocio que es proporcionar el servicio de sastrería, hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, ya él aprendió por sus padres. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de hilos, tijeras, telas entre otros.
texts.en: The “Don Tino” solidarity group’s members are Constantino and Reyna.  They have sought ways to get ahead together.  Constantino has been providing tailoring services for over ten years; he learned from his parents.  The loan he’s asking for is to buy thread, scissors and fabric, among others.

loans.use: to buy thread, scissors and fabric, among others.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children who go to school. She has one additional family member. Veronica sells second hand clothes. She sells her clothes on a retail basis and moves door-to-door. She has been in business for the last two years. Veronica works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. Her goals and aspirations are to see her business grow big and operate on a wholesale basis. She would also like to get a permanent business shop where customers could find her. Her major business challenges are transportation and the increasing prices of clothes in Uganda. Veronica lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and food.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Georgina Argueta

texts.en: Georgina lives in Tegucigalpa, Honduras where she makes a living selling cosmetics and freshly prepared food. Georgina has operated these two small businesses for many years and works very hard to get ahead. She is requesting a loan of HNL 12,000 to build a bathroom at her home. Her adult son will do the construction once the materials are purchased.

loans.use: to purchase cinder blocks, cement, sand, rebar, and tiles.

loans.name: Nakato

texts.en: Nakato  lives in  Uganda. She is married with four children, and all of them go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She owns a banana stall at the market. She works seven days a week. She has been in business for many years. She has requested a loan of UGX 40,0000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her aspirations and goals are to educate her children through university, and also to build rental rooms. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She lives in her own house, and her family has access to piped water and electricity. Her major expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bananas

loans.name: Betty Del Socorro

texts.es: Betty Del Socorro tiene 31 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, ya que necesitaba ayudar para los gastos del hogar. Con el paso del tiempo ha logrado tener sus propios clientes y proporcionarle lo que ellos le solicitan. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de calzado, cosméticos, ropa interior, sabanas, cortinas entre otros. Sus aspiraciones son de ampliar su local cada día mas
texts.en: Betty Del Socorro, 31, sells general merchandise.  She’s been in business for over 10 years since she needed to help pay household expenses. With the passage of time she’s managed to attain her own customers and provide them with what they need.  The loan she’s asking for is to buy footwear, cosmetics, underwear, sheets and curtains, among others.  Her hope is to expand the business more every day.

loans.use: to buy footwear, cosmetics, underwear, sheets and curtains, among others.

loans.name: Cristian Armando

texts.es:
El Señor Cristian  tiene 35 años, está casado con la Señora Jorgelina de 39 años de edad, no tienen  hijos, viven en su propia casa en la ciudad de Caacupé. El cliente se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ladrillos común.
Se desempeña en esta profesión hace ya varios años, por medio de este trabajo logra mantener su hogar y pagar todos los gastos que surgen. Comenta que uno de sus sueños es tener un deposito de materiales de construcción donde pueda vender los materiales que fabrica.
El cliente solicita el crédito para la compra de materias primas para la elaboración de los ladrillos que fabrica para cumplir con la demanda que tiene, ya que de esa forma obtendrá mayores ingresos. Desde ya agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
Cristian, 35, is married to Jorgelina, 39.  They have no children and live in their own house in the city of Caacupé.  He manufactures common bricks to sell.  He’s been in this occupation for several years now and through it manages to support his household and pay all the expenses that arise.  He comments that one of his dreams is to own a building supply warehouse where he can sell the materials he manufactures.

He is asking for the loan to buy raw materials to make bricks to meet the demand he has since he will then earn higher income this way.  From this moment now he wants to thank the Fundación for the opportunity it gives him.

loans.use: to buy clay to make bricks.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet  lives in Uganda.  She is single, and has four children, all of whom go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (elderly parents).   Annet has a business of poultry farming.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week.  Annet sells her products at home, by means of retail.   Annet has requested a loan of 50,0000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feed. The main business challenges for Annet include poultry diseases, the ever increasing price of chicken feed, and the transportation of chicken feed. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 2,000 chickens, and also to own a delivery van. Annet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco tiene su negocio que es brindar el servicio de transporte. Hace más de 10 años que tiene este negocio, ya que él trabajaba como ayudante con el paso del tiempo empezó a trabajar por su propia cuenta. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de llantas, repuesto y además proporcionarle ciertas mejoras. Desea sacar adelante a su familia y establecer un taller pues es así que ha logrado lo que tiene hoy en dia
texts.en:
Francisco’s business is providing transportation service.  He has had this business for over ten years.  He worked as an assistant, and in time he started to work on his own.  

The loan he is requesting is to buy tires, replacement parts, and to provide for certain improvements.  

He wants to get his family ahead and establish a workshop. This is how he has achieved what he now has.

loans.use: to buy tires, replacement parts, and to provide for certain improvements.

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Osman, a small-scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 3,000,000.00 Sierra Leone Leones (SLL) in order to invest in his businesses. 

Osman is a wholesale businessman. He sells palm oil and peppers on a wholesale basis. He has been a professional businessman for more than 11 years now. Mr. Osman is a husband and father of six children – three in primary school and three in secondary school. Osman has requested this loan in order to buy bags of peppers for resale.

loans.use: to buy bags of peppers for resale.

loans.name: Anielka Lizeth

texts.es: Anielka Lizeth se dedica a la venta cosméticos, hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio. Desde muy joven inicio este negocio, pues tenía que pagarse sus estudios  a pesar de que fue con muy poco capital que inicio ha logrado proveerle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pinturas de labios, pintura de uñas, perfumes, cremas, lápiz de ojos entre otros.
texts.en:
Anielka Lizeth sells cosmetics.  She has had this business for over three years.  She started this business when she was very young; she had to pay for her education.  

In spite of having very little capital, she managed to provide her family with the necessary income.

The loan she is requesting is for lipstick, nail polish, perfume, creams, and eyeliner, among other items.

loans.use: to buy lipstick, nail polish, perfume, creams, and eyeliner, among other items.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto tiene 64 años, su actividad es brindar el servicio de elaboración de ropa. Hace más de 22 años que tiene este negocio, con mucho sacrificio ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, para él es una alternativa de trabajo ya que debido a su edad no puede obtener un trabajo. La mayoría de sus clientes conocen el trabajo que realiza constantemente pues siempre la calidad de sus prendas de vestir es muy buena. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de hilos, telas, zipper, tijeras entre otras.
texts.en: Luis Alberto is 64 years old.  The service he provides is clothes making.  He’s been in this business for over 22 years.  He’s managed to raise his family through much sacrifice.  For him, it’s a work alternative because at his age he can’t get any other job.  Most of his customers are aware of the work he does constantly because the quality of his articles of clothing is very good.   The loan he’s requesting is to buy thread, fabric, zippers and scissors, among others.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric, zippers and scissors, among others.

loans.name: Fausto's Group

texts.es:
Fausto's Group está conformado por 5 personas: 3 Hombres y 2 Mujeres de los cuales Fausto es el presidente.

Fausto tiene 34 años vive en Urcuquí cerca de Ibarra con sus padres, es soltero no tiene hijos, se describe como una persona trabajadora, alegre y con el ánimo para salir adelantes.

Trabaja en la crianza de cerdos solo por 2 años, es la primera vez que solicita crédito a FODEMI, el crédito que solicita es para la compra de crías de cerdos blancos ya que estos son de buena calidad; gracias a este préstamo ayudaría a que su negocio crezca y así aumentarían sus ingresos y mejoraría la calidad de vida de su familia.

Su sueño es tener su propia casa y que su negocio siga crecieno y así poder distribuir sus cerdos a las grandes empresas; también su sueño es casarse y tener un hijo.
texts.en:
Fausto’s Group is made up of five people: three men and two women.  Fausto is group President.

Fausto is 34 years old and lives in Urcuquí near Ibarra with his parents.  He’s single and has no children.  He describes himself as a hardworking, cheerful person with the drive to get ahead.

He has been working raising pigs for just two years.  This is his first loan request to FODEMI.  The loan he’s requesting is to buy litters of white piglets because they are of good quality.  Thanks to this loan he’ll be able to help his business grow and thus to increase his income and improve his family’s quality of life.  His dream is to own a house and that his business continues to grow in order to sell his pigs to large firms.  He also dreams with getting married and having a son.

loans.use: to buy litters of white piglets because they are of high quality.

loans.name: Medalla Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
La formación del presente comité se inicio gracias a la iniciativa de la Señora Aida de la Ciudad de Carapeguá. El grupo es denominado Medalla Milagrosa y actualmente se encuentra en el primer ciclo con 15 integrantes, ellas se definen como señoras muy activas, destacadas en el ámbito del trabajo.
Ellas se integraron para lograr mejorar sus emprendimientos, otras sin embargo comienzan con su primera actividad con el objetivo de generar sus propios ingresos y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias con una mejor calidad de vida.
La Señora Aida se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, por medio de este trabajo logra desenvolverse plenamente, ya que gracias a su sacrificio ha logrado mantener a su familia dándoles un mejor estilo de vida. En cuanto a la clientela posee mucha demanda por lo que le gustaría poder ampliar la variedad de prendas que tiene a la venta. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un local donde vender u ofrecer sus prendas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de estación para la posterior venta, lo cual la ayudará para cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda
texts.en:
The formation of this committee was thanks to the initiative of Aida from the city of Carapeguá.  The group is called “Medalla Milagrosa” (Miraculous Medal) and is currently in its first cycle with fifteen members.  They define themselves as very active ladies who stand out in their work environments.

They joined together to improve their enterprises.  Others, however, are starting their first activities in hopes of generating their own income and thus help their families attain better quality of life.

Aida sells all sorts of clothes.  She feels completely fulfilled in this work because thanks to the sacrifice she’s done she’s managed to support her family giving them a better standard of living.  As far as her clientele is concerned, she has quite a bit of demand so she’d like to expand the variety of goods she has to sell.  One of her dreams is to be able to have a locale that she can sell her wares at.

She is asking for the loan to buy seasonal clothing for subsequent resale which will help her meet customer demand.  She is grateful to the Fundación for the support it’s provided her.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
Client âge de 41ans, marié et père, 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 3 mois et 9 ans. Le manque de moyen   ne lui a pas permis de faire des longues  études et il se lance dans le commerce des livres et  fournitures scolaires voila  bientôt  17ans.
Ce commerce qu’il trouve noble, est son gagne pain.il  s’approvisionne sur place et commande quelques livres en dehors du pays. Grâce à ses épargnes, ce prêt du  cycle 3   va lui  permettre de  renforcer son activité en achetant : des cahiers (3cartons  de 200 pages, 3cartons  de  192 pages, 3cartons de 96 pages, 1carton de 32page à doubles lignes, 1 carton des cahiers travaux pratiques), des dictionnaires, les livres scolaires usuels, des lots de crayons, lots de règles, des douzaines des gommes 1 douzaine des calculatrices, 1carton des papiers rame.
Il vend à des prix abordables pour permettre à ses clients qui sont en majorité des écoliers  d’acheter chez lui.
Il épargne dans le but d’ouvrir une mini librairie.
Sa bonne réputation lui permet de s’occuper convenablement de sa famille.
texts.en:
This client is married and father of two children aged between 3 months and 9 years. Due to lack of resources he was not able to undertake extensive studies and so about 17 years ago he started a business selling books and study materials.
This work, which he considers noble, is his main source of income. He sources his supplies locally and orders some books internationally. Thanks to his savings, this loan from cycle 3 will enable him to strengthen his business by purchasing: workbooks (3 boxes of 200 pages, 3 boxes of 192 pages, and 3 boxes of 96 pages, 1 box of 32 page double lined, 1 box of project books), dictionnaries, reference books, batches of crayons, rulers, a few dozen rubbers and a dozen calculators, and 1 box of paper ream.
He sells at affordable prices so that his clients, the majority of which are school children, can buy from him.
He is saving up to open a mini bookshop.
His good reputation enables him to look after his family quite well.

loans.use: to buy textbooks, workbooks, paper, rulers and pens

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm-oil, palm-wine and cigarettes in bulk to add to his business.

loans.name: Alex Junior

texts.es:
Alex de 24 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa de sus abuelos, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Sullana que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

La actividad que desarrolla Alex es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra limón y mango, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de Piura y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así tener mejoras económicas.  Alex es un joven trabajador que con esfuerzo desea superarse poder seguir ayudando a sus abuelos económicamente y unidos salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Alex is 24 years old, single, and lives in his grandparents' house, which lacks basic services. It is located in the rural zone of Sullana district, Piura department. This area is characterized by agricultural, cattle-raising and artisan activity.

Alex is involved in agriculture. He has his own cultivable fields where he plants lemon and mango trees. After harvest, he sells his crops in different markets in Piura and thus obtains income to cover his personal expenses.

Alex has requested a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 new sols to buy fertilizers to improve his fields as well as his crops, so that he can offer them at a better price to merchants and make economic improvements. Alex is a young worker who with effort desires to advance and continue helping his grandparents economically and, together, they can get ahead.

loans.use: buy fertilizers to improve his agricultural fields and their produce.

loans.name: Juanita De Los Angeles

texts.es: Juanita tiene 54 años, su actividad es la comercialización de medicamentos. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio, la mayoría de sus clientes se encuentran contentos con el servicio que proporciona. Ella lo realiza de manera ambulante. A pesar de los diferentes desafíos que enfrenta como es el tiempo y la salud ya que muchas veces no puede salir a ofrecer sus productos por problemas de salud. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de vitaminas, cremas, pastillas, jarabes entre otros.
texts.en: Juanita is 54 years old.  She sells medicines.  She has had this business for more than 20 years.  The majority of her clients are happy with the service she gives them.  She conducts her business by going door-to-door, despite the various challenges she encounters, such as the weather and her health, since many times she cannot go out to offer her products due to health problems. The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of vitamins, creams, pills, and syrups, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, creams, pills, syrups, and other items

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
Arsenio tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Oyotun, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona la actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura y ganadería.

Arsenio desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno (vaca), su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tenga una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o lo lleva a vender al mercado de Oyotun, cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que tiene, con sus ingresos solventa sus obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar más ganado vacuno lechero para que se incremente la producción de leche y así podrá ofrecerlo aun mejor precio para poder cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.  Arsenio es una persona trabajadora y dedicada que lo único que quiere es que su negocio crezca para que sus hijos tengan otras oportunidades.
texts.en:
Arsenio is 49 years old and lives with his family in their own house. The house is connected only to electricity and is located in the rural area of the district of Oyotún in the province of Chiclayo. The area is known for farming and cattle rearing.

For several years Arsenio has been rearing and selling cows. His corral is located outside of his home. He feeds his animals with balanced fodder and grass from natural pastures to get a good milk production which he sells to the people in his area and at the market in Oyotún. He has a loyal clientele that buys his milk. He spends his income on family expenditures.

Arsenio came to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and applied for a loan of 3000 new soles to buy more milk cows to increase his milk production and earn more money from his milk sales. The profit will enable him to pay the loan installments and improve his family's quality of life. Arsenio is a hard-working and dedicated man whose only wish is to expand his business and provide better opportunities to his children.

loans.use: to buy milk cows.

loans.name: Las Abejitas Y El Zángano Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se llama “Las Abejitas y el Zángano” está conformado por 17 emprendedoras que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa, amasandería, repostería, además corte y confección de ropa. Todas ellas pertenecientes a la comuna de San Bernardo, ciudad de Santiago. 
Doris presidenta del banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en segunda fila, en el primer puesto de izquierda a derecha, usando su cabello corto y ondulado. Se dedica a la venta de ropa de temporada, durante este invierno se ha dedicado a vender pijamas de polar (tela abrigadora), durante la temporada de verano se dedica a vender poleras. Doris tiene mucha experiencia en el rubro, ya que trabaja desde hace 20 años, su mercadería la compra en distribuidoras en el centro de la ciudad de Santiago y la vende a domicilio, de acuerdo a los pedidos que encargue su clientela, por lo que ella distribuye sus tiempos de manera más flexible. En la actualidad ella cuenta con 90 clientes. 
Con el crédito comprará cortinas de baño al por mayor.
Sus metas en su negocio son optar a un puesto en un persa (feria libre), para así vender su mercadería en un local establecido. 
Doris vive junto a su marido, dos hijas y su madre. Sus hijas estudian en la universidad, por lo que es una de sus motivaciones para continuar avanzando en su negocio. Sus sueños a nivel personal son viajar para conocer otras ciudades.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito obtenido por fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha brindado nuevas y mejores oportunidades en su vida. Respecto al grupo, se siente muy cómoda y confiada. Comenta que a pesar de la vasta experiencia en el rubro, siempre se aprende algo nuevo como en las capacitaciones impartidas en las reuniones del Banco comunal. 
San Bernardo es una ciudad, ubicada  a 18 km. en línea recta hacia el sur desde la plaza de armas de Santiago (capital de Chile). Es conocida como la capital del folklore, debido a que cada año, en  enero, se realiza el "Festival Internacional del Folklore", un evento en el que las raíces del país se dan cita y se reúnen  agrupaciones musicales de toda Sudamérica. También se desarrolla la "Feria de Artesanía Tradicional", en la que participan tanto artesanos chilenos como de otros países cercanos. Luego en abril se realiza el  evento “Abril cuecas Mil” que consiste en hacer bailar cueca (baile tradicional chileno) a toda la comuna.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Las Abejitas y el Zángano” (The Little Bees and the Drone) and is made up of 17 entrepreneurs who are in a variety of lines of work.  Among them are: clothes sales, bakery, pastry making and dress designing and dress making.  All of them are from the San Bernardo Commune in the city of Santiago.

Doris is communal bank President and in the photo she’s seated in the second row, first position from left to right, with short, wavy hair.  She sells seasonal clothing.  During this winter she’s focused on selling fleece pajamas (warm, cozy fabric) and in summer she sells t-shirts.  Doris has quite a bit of experience in this line of work because she’s been working for 20 years.  She buys her merchandise from suppliers in downtown Santiago and sells door to door according to orders placed by her customers and this way she can distribute her time more flexibly.  She currently has 90 customers.  She will use the loan to buy shower curtains at wholesale.  Her business goal is to set up a stand at a free market to sell her merchandise from a fixed locale.

Doris lives with her husband, two daughters and her mother.  Her daughters go to university which is one of the motivators for her to stay in business.  Her dream on a personal level is to travel and get to know other cities.

She is very happy and grateful for the loan from Fondo Esperanza because it’s provided new and better life opportunities.  With respect to the group, she feels very comfortable and confident.  She comments that despite her vast experience in this line of work she always learns something new in the training sessions conducted at the communal bank meetings.

San Bernardo is a city located 18km away in a straight line from Santiago’s (Capital of Chile) main square.  It’s known as the Capital of Folklore because in January of every year the International Folklore Festival takes place, an event in which the country’s roots meet and musical groups from throughout South America come together.  The Traditional Crafts Fair takes place as well where artisans from both Chile and from nearby countries participate.  In April, an event called “Abril Cuecas Mil” takes place that consists in putting the entire commune to dance Cueca (traditional Chilean dance).

loans.use: to buy shower curtains at wholesale.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María D. 48 años D. edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD. que pertenece al departamento D. Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

María desD. hace 4 años se dedica a la crianza y venta D. aves D. corral (gallinas, patos y pavos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior D. su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados D. la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios D. su hogar.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 500 nuevos soles para comprar más alimento balanceado para sus animales, con los ingresos que obtenega pueD. cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad D. vida.  María es una persona trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es poder superarse y  mejorar económicamente en bien D. los suyos.
texts.en:
María is 48 years old and lives with her husband and their children in their own house. The house is not connected to public utilities and is located in the rural area of the district of TambogranD. in the department of Piura. The area is known for farming, cattle rearing and crafts.

For four years María has been farming and selling poultry (chickens, ducks and turkeys). The henhouse behind her house is appropriate and large. She feeds her poultry with balanced feed and natural grains to ensure perfect growth. She sells the poultry at the various markets in her area and earns a very good income that she spends on daily household expenditures.

María came to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and applied for a loan of 500 new soles to buy balanced feed for her animals. The profit will enable her to pay the loan installments and improve her quality of life. María is a hard-working and determined woman whose only wish is to progress and improve the economic well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her poultry.

loans.name: Maritza Elena

texts.es: Maritza Elena tiene 54 años, su actividad es la venta de comida. Hace más de 22 años que tiene este negocio. Lo inicio desde muy joven ya que necesita proporcionar a su familia el alimento diario.  Ella se levanta temprano pues tiene que buscar las compras y elaborar los diferentes platillos que elabora. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, pan, platos, café, gaseosas, jugos entre otros.
texts.en: Maritza Elena is 54 and she has been selling prepared food for more than 22 years.  She started when she was very young since she needed to give her family daily meals.  She rises early and then has to go shopping and prepare the different items that she makes.  She will use the requested loan to buy rice, beans, bread, plates, coffee, soft drinks, juices, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, bread, plates, coffee, soft drinks, juices and more

loans.name: Hipolito Aristides

texts.es:
Hipolito es un padre de familia de 62 años de edad, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia, la cual no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca. Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

La actividad que desarrolla Hipolito es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra arroz, es un producto que se consume diariamente, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de la zona donde vive  y así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa mediante Capital Semilla de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de sus tierras de cultivo y pago de mano de obra en la cosecha y con las ventas mejorará su calidad de vida.  Hipolito es una persona que se preocupa por que su cosecha sea la mejor para brindarle algunas comodidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Hipolito is a 62-year-old family father who lives with his children in his own house. The house is not connected to public utilities and is located in the rural area of the district of Pomahuaca in the department of Cajamarca. The area is known for farming and cattle rearing.

Hipolito is a farmer. He has his own farmland where he grows rice, a product that is consumed daily. Once the rice is harvested, he sells it at the various markets in his area and thus can spend his income on family expenditures.

Hipolito came to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and applied for a loan of 1000 new soles through the loan program "Capital Semilla" (seed capital) to buy fertilizers for the maintenance of his farmland and pay for harvesting labor. The sales will enable him to enjoy a higher quality of life. Hipolito cares for his rice crop and wants it to be as good as possible so that he can offer some comforts to his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the maintenance of his farmland and pay for harvesting labor.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa de 27 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijo en casa de sus suegros, cuenta con sólo servicio   de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Olmos que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Rosa desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de flores, negocio que a colocado estratégicamente al frente del cementerio del lugar donde vive, tiene su propia clientela, con los ingreos que obtenga podrá cubrir sus necesidades diarias de hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar una mototaxi para que maneje su esposo y puede tener otro ingreso económico,loque permitirá pagar más rápido el crédito otrogado y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Rosa es una mujer responsable que con mucho esfurzo y sacrificio saca adelante a su familia poco a poco.
texts.en:
Rosa is 27 years old and lives with her husband and her son in the house of her parents-in-law. The house is connected only to electricity and is located in the rural area of the district of Olmos in the department of Lambayeque. The area is known for farming and cattle rearing.

For three years Rosa has been selling flowers. Her business is strategically located in front of the cemetery in her village. She has a regular clientele and the income from the business is sufficiently high for the daily household expenditures.

Rosa came to the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and applied for a loan of 3000 new soles to buy a motor taxi. Her husband will drive the taxi and have an additional income. The profit will enable them to quickly pay the loan installments and improve their quality of life. Rosa is a responsible woman and enables her family to progress gradually thanks to her hard work and sacrifice.

loans.use: to buy a motor taxi.

loans.name: Musidal Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mohamed was born in the village of Yoni, in northern Sierra Leone about 45 years ago. He is married to a tailor and the couple has 3 children: 2 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. 

For over 6 years now, Mohamed has been selling palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice, groundnuts, etc. This is first loan that Mohamed and his group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve on their living conditions. Mohamed is going to use his share of the loan to buy palm oil, rice and groundnuts in bulk to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, rice and groundnuts in bulk to add to his business

loans.name: Mabel Roxana

texts.es: Mabel tiene 25 años, su actividad es la venta de artesanías. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, ella es una emprendedora mujer que busca la forma de mantener a su familia tiene un hijo menor de edad bajo su cargo. Ella se levanta temprano para realizar algunos retoques en sus artesanías, pues su lugar de trabajo está ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de vasijas, pinturas, barro entre otros productos necesarios.
texts.en:
Mabel, age 25, sells handicrafts.  She has had this business for over five years.  She is an enterprising woman who looks for the way to support her family.  She has one minor child under her care.

She gets up very early to make some finishing touches on her handicrafts.  The place where she works is located in the outskirts of the city.

The reason for the loan is to buy earthenware pots, paints, and clay, among other needed products.

loans.use: to buy earthenware pots, paints, and clay, among other needed products.

loans.name: Raquel Jacqueline

texts.es:
Raquel de 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Mochumí que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola y ganadera.

Raquel desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral (gallinas, patos y pavos), su corral se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa, el cual es apropiado y amplio, los alimenta con comida balanceada y granos naturales para que sus animales lleguen a tener un crecimiento óptimo para ofrecerlos en los diferentes mercados de la zona y así obtenga muy buenas ganancias para solventar sus gastos diarios de su familia.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para comprar más alimento balanceado para sus animales, con los ingresos que obtenega puede cubrir su crédito y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Raquel es una madre trabajadora y empeñosa que lo único que quiere es poder superarse y  mejorar económicamente.
texts.en:
Raquel, 24, lives with her husband and children in their own home, which lacks basic utilities and is located in a rural area in the Mochumi district of the department of Lambayeque.  This area is known for its farming and animal husbandry.

Raquel has been raising and selling poultry (hens, ducks and turkeys) for a number of years.  Her corral is located in the back of her house, and it is adequate and roomy.  She feeds them with balanced feed and natural grains.  Once they reach an optimal size, she sells them in different markets in the area and thus obtains good earnings to pay her household expenses.

She has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 Peruvian soles to buy more balanced feed for her animals.  With the income that she will earn, she will pay off the loan and improve her quality of life.  Raquel is a hardworking and dedicated woman.  The only thing that she wants is to be able to get ahead and improve economically.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
El comité San Miguel se inicio gracias a que una D. las miembros quiso formar un grupo con señoras responsables, invitando a sus vecinas y amigas más confiables, D. esta forma se inicia el comité. Actualmente se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del programa con 24 integrantes.
Las integrantes se definen como mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras y muy responsables. Tienen un objetivo común que es la obtención D. mayores ingresos para paliar los gastos D. cada una.
La señora Juana tiene una despensa, la cual explota desD. hace ya un tiempo, por lo que tiene ya una clientela bien definida. Ella lucha duro día a día por generar un poco más D. ingresos, ya que se encuentra sola con los gastos D. la casa ya que hace poco enviudo. Con ella viven 5 D. sus hijos y 3 nietos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. bebidas, comestibles, lácteos y demás para el abastecimiento D. su negocio. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da, pues D. obtener el crédito le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group named San Miguel started out when one of the members wanted to form a group of responsible women. She invited her most trusted neighbors and friends to form the group. The group is now on their third loan cycle and there are 24 members.

The members define themselves as accomplished women who are hardworking and very responsilbe. They have one objective in common and that is to earn a greater income to cover their expenses.

Juana has a grocery store, one she has managed for some time now, and it is why she already has a well-defined clientele. She works hard day after day to generate a bit more income. She is the only on ewho is responsible for household expenses because a short time ago she became a widow. She lives with 5 of her children and with 3 grandchildren. 

She requests a loan to purchase drinks, food products, milk products and other merchandise to supply her store. She is thankful to Fundacion (Kiva Field Partner) for the opportunity given to her. Obtaining a loan will be of great assistance.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, food products, milk products and other merchandise to stock the inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the fixtures necessary to get his plumbing job going.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase candy, drinks, basic grains, bread, detergents, soups and canned goods.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesus

texts.es:
Narcisa tiene 47 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los dos hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE, se encuentra ubicada recinto EL ROSARIO, perteneciente al Canton Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agricolas de ciclo corto siembra de maiz, arroz y frejol.

Narcisa se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz,arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Guzman en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol, para la compra de abonos y semillas para la produccion.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafios como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es superarse y trabajar mas. 

Se considera una persona emprendedora y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Narcisa is 47, married and lives with her husband and two children in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.

The members of the San Jose Communal Bank are located in the El Rosario area, belonging to the Ventanas canton. This area is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour; sowing corn, rice and beans.

Narcisa works in agriculture sowing corn, rice and beans. She buys her products in the Guzman market in Ventanas and sells them in the wholesale market of Ventanas.

She is requesting this loan for sowing corn, rice and beans, through the purchase of fertilizers and seeds for production. With the support of this loan you will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as pests and plagues. Her dream is to improve herself and work more.

She is an enterprising and hard-working person.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds for production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and God has blessed her marriage with two lovely children, one of whom is below the age of fifteen. She lives with her family in a one-bedroom house in Rendez-vous, a quarter in Bamenda, of the Northwest region of Cameroon.

The major challenge she has faced in life has been poverty, including insufficient money to treat herself when she was sick and difficulty in paying her house rent. She has a leg injury and hates thinking about it. She joined GHAPE in 2004 and has received and repaid Empowerment credit four times.

She plans to invest in her dressmaking and groundnut selling business. She is very sure this business will succeed because she has a good experience in it, and because there is a high demand for groundnut. Her loan will help the community in that it will enable her to make the cloths and groundnuts readily available for local buyers at affordable prices.
