Reina started her business around six years ago with her personal savings. She sells all kind of seafood, such as squid, fish, crabs, shrimp, and others. Reina lives near Bahia, in the town of Hato Mayor, an agricultural zone. She has two children who still live at home, and she lives with her long-term partner, who is their father. Reina’s most important challenge is to live according to God’s will. 

Reina is requesting her seventh loan from Esperanza International. Because her loan repayments have all been maD. punctually, she has been able to grow her business with the re-investment from each loan. She has had the opportunity to improve her life and family and expand her business to get more clients. Reina would like to save her profits to renovate her house and give her children a safer home. In the future, she wants to become a successful and professional businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy seafood

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe, in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past ten years, Ruth has run a laundry business. She is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

Ruth is requesting a 1,500,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to purchase soap and basins to help her wash clothes. With the help of her loan, she hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Ruth hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase soap and basins

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin is 50 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso, in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. For over ten years, Godwin has run a small retail shop where he sells cosmetics. He is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

Godwin is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan from BRAC Uganda to expand his business and purchase cosmetic items such as body lotions to sell.  With the help of his loan, he hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Godwin hopes to continue to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic items such as body lotion to sell

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 47 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has three children. All of his children are currently in school. Fred has a poultry farm, which he has had for 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase chickens for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fred hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Fred hopes to expand his business. Fred is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to resell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia tiene ya más de cuatro años con su negocio de venta de artículos escolares.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en compra producto escolares que es cuadernos, lápices, plumas, colores y libros, ya que le están ofreciendo  producto a buen precio y por mayoreo. Podrá formar paquetes escolares ya que en temporada escolar es cuando hay mas demanda de útiles escolares. 
Así podrá ayudar a sus clientes con precios accesibles y también ganar más ingreso para la familia, ayudar a su esposo en los gastos de sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia has been selling school supplies for more than four years. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, pens, crayons, and books since these items are being offered wholesale and at a good price. Julia will be able to assemble school kits for the school year when there is more demand for school supplies.

She will be able to help her customers by offering affordable prices and also earn more income for her family, as well as help her husband with the educational expenses of their two children.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, pens, crayons, and books.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is 28 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has three children. Two of his children are currently in school. Godfrey has a small retail shop that sells products such as sugar, which he has had for 3 years.         

To help expand his business, Godfrey has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities, like sugar, for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Godfrey hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Godfrey hopes to expand his business. Godfrey is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities, like sugar, for resale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has five children. Four of her children are currently in school. Patricia has a restaurant, which she has had for five years.

To help expand her business, Patricia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food to resell in her restaurant. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Patricia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Patricia hopes to expand her business. Patricia is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her capital.

loans.use: to purchase food to sell at her restaurant.

loans.name: Allelis Estelia

texts.es:
A sus 31 años de edad, Allelis Estelia es una mujer emprendedora que además de la elaboración de diferentes comestibles, los cuales vende entre sus amigos, familiares, conocidos y en algunas cafeterías del municipio de Santa Rosa al norte de Antioquia cuenta con un criadero de pollos que también comercializa en la zona. 

Esta emprendedora sueña con llegar a tener una microempresa de embutidos que le permita mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Actualmente, Allelis Estelia necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunos insumos y utensilios para la elaboración de sus comestibles, así mejorará su producción, será más eficiente en la elaboración de los mismos, incremenetando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
At 31 years of age, Allelis Estelia is an enterprising woman who also make different types of food which she sells to her friends, relatives and other people she knows at several cafeterias in the town of Santa Rosa, to the north of Atioquia.  She has a chicken yard, and she also sells chickens in the area.

This entrepreneur dreams of having a micro-business selling sausages, which would allow her to improve her quality of life.

Currently, Allelis Estelia needs a loan to buy several ingredients and utensils for making her food, thereby increasing her production.  She will be more efficient in making the food, increasing her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils.

loans.name: Sseguya

texts.en:
Sseguya is 39 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is divorced and has 3 children. All of his children are currently in school. Sseguya has a business of a bar, which he has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Sseguya has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sodas and beer for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sseguya hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, Sseguya hopes to expand his business. Sseguya is a member of BRAC’s small enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his business.

loans.use: to purchase sodas and beer for resale

loans.name: Martha Alicia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Martha le está haciendo falta construir un baño ya que actual mente el que tiene esta en muy malas condiciones y tiene miedo que les pueda pasar un accidente a sus tres hijos. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar de material que es block, cemento y arena ya que su esposo el señor Hermilo  se encargara de realizar la mejora en horario adicional a su trabajo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en un hotel de la ciudad y que Don Hermilo se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus hijos. 
Desean mejorar la calidad de vida y prevenir enfermedades, y que el patrimonio que será de sus hijos.
texts.en:
The home of Sra. Martha is lacking a completed bathroom. Her current facility is in very bad condition and she is worried that it could cause an accident that could harm her three children.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials such as blocks, cement, and sand. Her husband Sr. Hermilo will be in charge of making this improvement in addition to working his normal job. Martha plans to repay the loan using the salary she receives from her job at a hotel in the city. Don Hermilo will be responsible for the family expenses and the education of their children.

They want to improve their quality of life, prevent illnesses, and provide an inheritance for their children.

loans.use: to buy materials for completing a bathroom.

loans.name: Paola Lizeth

texts.es: La señora  Paola es una cliente muy joven que recién esta empezando a formar su hogar, tiene muchos sueños, actualmente vive con su esposo en la casa de sus suegros quienes le dieron un pequeño capital para que trabaje o pongan un negocio,   el cual ella quiere aumentar cuenta con el apoyo de sus papas y sobre todo de su esposo quien trabaja en construcción, ella se dedica a la venta de muebles en la feria 16 de julio en el alto, solo los días jueves y domingos,  con el dinero del crédito comprara muebles y después poder venderlos obteniendo ganancias y así poder incrementar su capital de trabajo  ambos quieren casarse antes de tener hijos,  hacerse de un patrimonio, están consientes que será muy duro pero tienen ganas de salir adelante mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Paola is a young client who recently started her family and has many dreams. She currently lives with her husband at the home of her in-laws, who gave her a small amount of capital to use to find work or to start a business. Paola wants to earn more. She has the support of her parents and her husband, who works in construction.

Paola sells furniture at the July 16th fair in El Alto, but only on Thursdays and Sundays. With the money from this loan, she will buy furniture so that she can sell it for a profit. This will allow her to increase her operating capital. Paola wanted to get married before having children and acquiring some assets. She and her husband are aware that it will be very hard, but they have the will to succeed and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy furniture to sell.

loans.name: José Alirio

texts.es:
Entusiasmo y energía positiva son las palabras que caracterizan a José Alirio quien desde hace 35 años se dedica a trabajar como independiente pues además de mejorar su calidad de vida espera ofrecerle un buen futuro a sus dos hijos. 

En su negocio, una cafetería ubicada en Itagüí en el área metropolitana de Medellín, deleita a sus clientes con diferentes platos, que según él son apetecidos por su sazón. 

Este luchador incansable necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos y mejorar sus utensilios y así mejorar su capital de trabajo y por lo tanto mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Enthusiasm and positive energy are the words that characterize José Alirio who, for the last 35 years, has been working independently because in addition to improving his quality of life he hopes to offer his two children a better future.

His business is a cafeteria located in Itagüí in Medellí’s metropolitan area.  He pleases his customers there with various dishes that, according to him, are craved for because of their tastiness.

This tireless fighter needs a loan to buy ingredients and improve his utensils thus improving his working capital and thus his income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and work utensils.

loans.name: Ever Max

texts.es: El Señor Ever trabaja como taxista con vehículo de su propiedad se dedica a esta actividad desde hace tres años con vehículo propio y desde hace mas de diez años como chofer, solicita el monto para la refacción y mantenimiento de dicho vehículo ya que siendo su principal fuente de ingreso tiene que estar en buenas condiciones, actualmente vive en domicilio en alquiler hasta que terminen de construir su vivienda, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, es una persona con muchos deseos de superación y muy trabajadora.
texts.en: Sr. Ever has operated his own taxi business for three years.  He owns his own vehicle and has been working as a driver for more than ten years.  He is applying for a loan to pay for vehicle maintenance and repairs.  The business is his main source of income so the vehicle has to be in a good state of repair.  He is renting while his house is being built.  He lives with his wife and their three children.  He is ambitious and hard-working.

loans.use: to repair vehicle for his taxi business.

loans.name: Neyda Fabiola

texts.es:
Neyda Fabiola tiene 27 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los tres hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE, se encuentra ubicada recinto EL ROSARIO, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol.

Neyda fabiola se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Guzman en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol, para la compra de abonos, insumos y semillas para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es superarse y trabajar mas. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear y se considera una persona emprendedora y trabajadora.
texts.en:
Neyda Fabiola, 27, lives with her husband and three children in Los Rios province.

The V.R.C. SAN JOSE is located near EL ROSARIO in the canton of Ventanas.  The group funds farming businesses and its members make their living growing maize, rice and beans.

Neyda Fabiola grows maize, rice and beans.  She buys supplies at Comercial Guzman in Ventanas and sells her crop at the wholesale market in Ventanas.

She is applying for a loan to buy supplies for her next crop of maize, rice and beans.  She will buy seeds, manure and other supplies that she needs for the business.  Your loan will help her buy the supplies she needs to sustain the business.  She faces challenges such as plant diseases and insects.  Her greatest wish is to continue working and getting ahead.

In her spare time, she likes to see her friends.  She is considered a hard-working, enterprising woman.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Ruth Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Ruth Del Socorro tiene 30 años y dos hijos a su cargo. Tiene un negocio de venta de mercadería en general ubicado de manera ambulante ya que así obtiene nuevos clientes. Con su préstamo comprara cortinas, sabanas, calzado y cosméticos. Tiene mucho tiempo en este tipo de negocio, por lo que se encuentra muy feliz de obtener un medio de ingreso. Ella siempre ha sido una persona responsable y que tiene las fuerzas para salir adelante.
texts.en: Sra. Ruth Del Socorro, 30, has two children.  She works as a street vendor, selling general merchandise to the customers she finds.  She will use this loan to buy curtains, sheets, footwear and cosmetics.  She has operated the business for some time.  She is happy with the business and it's become her means of making a living.  She has always been a responsible person and wants to get ahead in the world.

loans.use: to buy curtains, sheets, footwear and cosmetics for her retail business.

loans.name: La Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.en:
Maria is one of the members of the group L. Bendicion D. Dios 1 & 2. This group is located in one of the rural communities surrounding San Pedro D. Macoris. They are 10 borrowers who are businessmen and businesswomen. Maria makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and their 2 children. Her business is based on a grocery store (Colmado, means small grocery store in the neighborhood).

Maria is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost 5 years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing rice, sugar, a box of red beans, canned food, cooking oil and other goods. She will use her profits to invest in her business and to save.

Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and the sugarcane industry. The main economic activities here are a free traD. zone and a cement factory. All of them are working together to develop their Batey (town where sugar workers live) into a better place to live, with the main services and different stores.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Edwin Oliver

texts.es:
Edwin Oliver tiene 19 años, Es soltero vive con los abuelitos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JOSE, se encuentra ubicada recinto EL ROSARIO, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol.

Edwin Oliver se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol . Compra sus productos en Comercial Guzman en Ventanas y los vende en el mercado mayorista de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, arroz y frejol, para la compra de abonos, insumos y semillas para la producción.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades de los cultivos. Su sueño es superarse y trabajar mas para obtener más utilidades. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear con los amigos, leer y escribir.
texts.en:
Edwin Oliver is nineteen.  He's single and lives with his grandparents in the Ventanas canton in the Los Río province. 

The members of the San Jose village bank meet in the El Rosario district, which is in the Ventanas canton.  They earn their living in agriculture, planting short-cycle crops like corn, rice, and beans.

Edwin Oliver makes his living in agriculture, planting corn, rice, and beans.  He buys his products at the Guzman Store in Ventanas and sells at the Ventanas wholesale market.

He is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, supplies, and seed so he can plant his corn, rice, and beans.  The loan would help him financially to get what needs.  He faces challenges from pests and crop disease.  His dream is to overcome and work more to make more profits.

In his free time, Edwin Oliver likes to go for walks with his friends, read, and write.

loans.use: to buy fertlizers and supplies.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es: Marco Tulio, tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y su esposa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a veces le ayuda con el trabajo de campo, es padre de 8 hijos, de los cuales dos ya son independientes y los otros seis viven junto con ellos en el hogar. Desde muy joven Don Marcos se dedica a trabajar como jornalero y gana muy poco dinero pero siempre aparta un poquito de este para ahorrarlo. Don Marcos a visualizado que puede dedicarse a criar cerdos, ya que de vez en cuando va comprando un cerdo y lo cria hasta que este esta lo suficientemente grande para venderlo, luego de las pocas ganancias que le quedan compra otro cerdo y lo cria y lo vende y así sucesivamente. Don Marcos solicita este prestamo para comprar 22 cerdos e instalar una pequeña granja en el patio de su casa y asi poder dedicarse de lleno a la actividad de cria de cerdos. Su  ventaja principal es que la carne de cerdo se puede vender a un buen precio aunque es un trabajo arduo. Su más grande sueño es ver a sus hijos graduados. Este es su tercer ciclo en FAMA y ha pagado sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio is 53 years old and married.  His wife devotes herself to the household chores, and sometimes she helps him in the field.  He has eight children.  Two of them are independent, and the other six live with them at home.

Ever since he was very young Marco worked as a day laborer.  He does not earn much money, but he always puts aside a little to save.  Marco had the idea that he could raise pigs.  Every now and then he buys a pig and raises it until is it big enough to sell.  Then, with the small earnings that are left, he buys another pig, raises it, sells it, and so on.

Marco is requesting this loan to buy 22 pigs and to set up a small farm on the patio of his house.  That way he will be able to fully commit to raising pigs.  His main advantage is that you can sell pigs for a good price even though it is hard work.

His biggest dream is to see his children graduate.

This is his third cycle with FAMA, and he has made his payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es oriunda de la ciudad de Bogotá donde los tejidos son tradicionales, fue allí y desde muy niña que aprendió al lado de su hermana a elaborar diferentes productos tejidos en máquina. Allí durante muchos años trabajó con su familia quienes además comercializaban. 

Después de separarse de su esposa, esta emprendedora se trasladó a la ciudad de Medellín donde inició con su propio negocio, es así como espera mejorar su calidad de vida y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su hija con la que actualmente vive. 

Yolanda necesita de un préstamo para realizarle mantenimiento a su máquina tejedora y comprar insumos, así podrá mejorar su producción, ofrecer mayor variedad de producción e incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Yolanda is from the city of Bogotá, where woven items are traditional.  It was there that, as a very young girl, she learned, at her sister’s side, to make different woven items by machine.  That is where she worked for many years with her family; they also sold the items.

After separating from her husband this enterprising woman moved to the city of Medellín, where she started her own business.  This is how she hopes to improve her quality of life and to provide her daughter, who she currently lives with, a better future.

Yolanda needs the loan for maintenance on her weaving machine.  She will also buy supplies.  This way she will be able to improve her production, offer a greater variety of items, and increase her income.

loans.use: to repair her weaving machine and to buy supplies.
